Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Only disapointing thing was having to pay to use the sauna and jacuzzi, and the beds kept moving away from the wall if you tried sitting back. Bathroom was large and clean and great selection of food for breakfast

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Dylan W
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in April 2012. We received a good welcome from the receptionist, our room wasn't available as we arrived at midday but we were told to return at 3pm and our room would be available which it was. We were allocated a room on the 6th floor so noise from the street / metro wasn't an issue. The hotel had a nice bar area where they served cocktails and San Miguel (€6 a pint). A major benefit was the free wi-fi anywhere in the hotel. All the staff were very pleasant and their English was very good. Great location with the Jaume I metro station opposite the hotel. Barcelona Cathedral & Cathedral Santa Maria within 5 minute walk and 10-15 minute walk to La Rambla & Placa de Catalunya. Only negative was the air-condition didn't work in the room, but as it was quite cool during our stay we didn't complain. We would definitely stay in this hotel again and would recommend to friends & family.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nigel_Pugh Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: If I went back to Barcelona, I would stay at this hotel again. It's location is perfect. Walk out of the door and all the bars and restaurants are right around you. It is under 10 mins walk from La Rambla, but to be honest, the places on the doorstep are much nicer than La Rambla. Staff are really helpful. Room was very clean. If I can only make one tiny criticism it is that the room was a little small, and you can hear the rumble of the metro trains underneath it. But that considered, it is still worth a 9 out of 10. Really pleased with our stay there. Nigel & Nicola.

Reviews.Title: “Possibly the smallest hotel in the world”
Reviews.Author: Ddboss1010
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great ,the location great with just a short walk to la ramblas the rooms SMALL ! We were so shocked at how small it was but saying that, it was clean and adequate for what we needed, a place to sleep whilst exploring this great city .

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: kath91982
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a friend for two nights in March 2012. The location could not have been better, directly across the street from a train stop. You can either walk or train to every sight, there are tons of great places to eat and drink within a few minutes walk. We only went up to the rooftop for a short time as it was windy and chilly, but did see someone using the hot tub, and seems like it would be really nice to sit up there on a summer evening. The rooms were large and clean, bathrooms were a good size and modern. The air seemed to be stuck on heat only, and with the windows open it was loud, but I assume that once summer gets here the A/C will work and when the windows were closed you could not hear a thing from outside. The staff was very helpful, and the welcome glass of cava was a nice way to start our trip!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: andrlace
Reviews.Content: Excellent choice with location, metro across the street, many restaurants all within minutes. Right in Barri Gothic area. Room was small but adequate and clean, shower decent,free internet service. Front desk tried to be helpful and spoke English. Quick cab ride to airport. Elevator worked quickly, never a wait. Those are all the positives. The negatives were that there was nowhere to sit except for the desk and bed so do not plan on spending much time in the room.The price was reasonable. We came to Barcelona to visit our son who is spending a semester here. It was a perfect choice.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: wildchild_05
Reviews.Content: we spent a birthday week here and had an amazing time. We were upgraded to a junior suite, presented with a bottle of champaign for my birthday and the customer service was great. The rooms are clean and tidy, good drinks (although can get expensive). Best of all was the location of this hotel - perfect place to access all the Barcelona has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Cumbrian couples”
Reviews.Author: David H
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, very central, metro across the street, staff smart, helpful and friendly, all spoke good English Rooms very good, clean and well stocked, satellite TV. Breakfast was the best ever with an extravagant choice. Small inexpensive bar in foyer/lounge. 1 euro to leave a bag at end of stay. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Customer Service in Europe!”
Reviews.Author: Vikky21
Reviews.Content: Went for a city break for my partners birthday. On the metro on the way to JAUME 1 (metro opposite the hotel) I had my purse stolen from my bag, I was aware that Barcelona was bad for pickpockets and was being VERY careful and I still was a victim so my advice is put all your money in your pants! Hotel was fantastic on arrival, assisting me in cancelling my cards while my partner checked us in. We were also given a couple of glasses of cava, helped get over the loss of my purse! Reception bar area and staff were fantastic, i had just been to Mexico on 5* holiday so was prepared for the shock of the usual Europe hotel hospitality and was pleasantly surprised at how friendly & helpful the staff were - thank you! Room great size, all we required from the stay. Minibar usual hotel prices, we aren't big drinkers and just got some waters from supermarket (2mins away) and stored them in the fridge. Shower / bath and toiletries - amazing. Only complaint was the towels were not 4* fluffy, quite old and stiff, however thats being fussy I know! Ideal location to see all sights - most are within walking distance. Great places to eat nearby - Tapeo in El born area was superb! Breakfast - hot items (bacon eggs etc) and vast cold selection. Used the spa - fantastic hot tub was great. Never on a city break have I been so impressed by a hotel - H10 MONTCADA THANK YOU!

Reviews.Title: “A very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: fcoya
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at this hotel. Right in the middle of the Gothic Area, we were within walking distance to almost every place we wanted to be. Our room was modern and clean. We got a mini suite upgrade just because it was available. When I asked the front desk to fix a problem they did it right away. Everyone was nice and helpful. Across from the Hotel there is a great Coffee and Croissant place that is nice to go to in the mornings just before heading out. All in all we had a wonderful time in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: DonnaMM
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights at the beginning of March. I can only echo other reviewers in respect of the great location of the hotel if the purpose of your visit is to explore what Barcelona has to offer rather than rest in peace in your hotel room. We got a really great room rate from the Internet. However we did have a room on the first floor. There is no other way to put it other than the metro does disturb you with its rumbling! But to be honest I was more disturbed by the mini fridge noise after a few hours than the noise of the metro trains. It was a point of a giggle between me and my husband listening to the rumble of the trains. The room was compact but had everything we needed for the two of us including a safe, drawers, storage.The bathroom was a really good size with shower and bath. We went up to the rooftop and the views are really good, although we didn't use the jacuzzi as it does have an additional charge. The breakfast choice is what makes this hotel very good in my opinion. Hot choices, continental meats and cheeses, fresh juices, pastries, toast, yoghurt, fresh fruit and cereals are all available with a good selection. It's hard to feel hungry after breakfast. We did many activities, and can highly recommend a Segway tour to see much of the city, as well as making the most of all the Gaudi architecture. Being in the centre of the Gothic and the Born districts restaurants, bars and shops are all in easy reach, and the Ramblas is just a little over 5 mins walk away. If you can accept that hustle, bustle and noise are all part of a city break then this hotel is not a bad choice for a few nights making the most of the wonderful city of Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Long Weekend 17/02/12 - 20/02/12”
Reviews.Author: Michellef
Reviews.Content: Excellent service on arrival. Friendly helpful staff. Glass of cava on arrival was greatly appreciated, Room was excellent. Very clean and tidy, Great range of food at breakfast. One of the best breakfasts we have had in a hotel. All of the sights are within walking distance and close to airport bus. Surrounded by excellent tapas bars and restaurants. We have been to Barcelona before but never to this hotel. We would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, metro a bit of a bind”
Reviews.Author: Shabba-Ranks79
Reviews.Content: Modern hotel, room and bathroom were well equipped. Great central location – only issue was the subway which literally stops right beneath the hotel causing a racket at night! You get used to it, but was a real negative. The staff were very friendly and the breakfast was excellent – loads of choice. Fantastic welcome and the hotel had organised special treats for Valentines also which was good. Free, fast wifi so on the whole a lot of positives with one negative.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms and location overshadowed by greedyness and over pricing!”
Reviews.Author: Michael K
Reviews.Content: The hotel is perfectly located for anyone wishing to explore the city. Most of the main attractions are, at most, 20 minutes walk away. There are numerous restaurants and bars withing 5 minutes walk from the Hotel. Upon arrival we were welcomed with a glass of champagne and very welcoming staff. However, although we had paid the extra for strawberries and cream upon arrival we were not aware that these would need to be collected from the bar and would not be brought to your room as most would expect. There was also no offer to take our bags to our room. This maybe pretty minor but with a bottle of champagne in one hand, strawberries in another it was difficult getting the bags upto the room. The room itself at first sight appeared nice though after a few minutes we noticed a few problems which once pointed out to reception were remedied quite quickly though i would expect to have a clean problem free room for the money we paid. However, they failed to fix the problem with the window in our room on the 4th floor which made it very noisy at night. It appeared as though the seal around thw window was no longer fully in tact with the frame. One of the selling point of the hotel was the roof top jacuzzi and bar. However don't be fooled. Upon reading the literature it states that the roof top bar is closed and that the jacuzzi needs to be booked from 2pm. When we tried to arrange this with reception we found out that the cost of doing this was 49 euros for 30 minutes. I felt this was steep, especially as we had paid almost £80 extra for a better experience. We also planned on taking advantage of the 20% off for massages and other treatments. However, upon looking at the prices, the 20% discount would have made very little difference to what I would consider very expensive treatments. To end on a plus point the breakfast, which was included in the extra money was of good quality. Local pastries, fresh fruit and numerous dishes to suit everyones breakfast needs. Despite all the problems i would recomend this hotel purely based on its location though i would recomend that you do not book it on the basis of a nice relaxing soak in the roof top jacuzz. I would also recommend you do not pay the extra amount and just go for a basic room. I felt this hotel let itself down, its nice rooms and location over shadowed by its greedyness to charge for everything. I felt if the prices were more reasonable a lot more would make use of them and feel less ripped off!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, well priced hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: Tammy1catobe
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a three night break with my partner and another couple. The hotel is ideally situated by the Jaume 1 metro station and you can't really miss it when you come up onto the street. We were greeted with a glass of Cava each and received a voucher for a free cocktail. The rooms, though small, were well equiped, modern and clean. We asked for a high up room to avoid the noise from the road and metro and were allocated a nice double room with a bath and shower on the seventh floor. Our friends were offered a slightly bigger room along the corridor but it was a twin room so they swapped for a double on the sixth floor and were not troubled by the noise. They only had a shower with no bath so it's worth asking for what you want if you are fussy about baths/showers etc. The staff are very helpful and gave excellent recommendations for restaurants and showed us where to find them on the map. The area is ideal, right by the cathedral and on the edge of the gothic area and Ribera area, where there are a large number of very good restuarants. We travelled from the airport by the RENFE train and metro which was easy and a bargain compared to UK travel prices. We bought a T10 ticket for €9.25 which got all four of us from the airport to the hotel and back again, with two journeys to spare! The rooftop terrace is a lovely place to watch the sun go down and it was warm enough for us to take our cocktails up, although the bar up there is not open in February. Excellent breakfast, included in the price we paid. Hot and cold buffet with loads of juices, fruit, meats and cheeses. We didn't need lunch after enjoying our breakfast! Would recommend this hotel for anyone who wants to stay in Barcelona and doesn't want to pay a fortune - after all most of the day is spent sight-seeing!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in the heart of the city”
Reviews.Author: HanQuirk
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently visited Barcelona for the first time for a 3 day break. As I wasn't overly familiar with the city I wasn't sure where the best area to stay would be but we could not have been happier with the H10 Montcada with all the major attractions only a short distance away and a metro stop directly opposite. The hotel itself is clean and modern with good sized rooms and great views over the city from the roof top. We didn't have breakfast included in our rate and so paid for it additionally for €10 each per day so not the cheapest but the buffet had a good selection of Continental items (fruit, cereal, meats, cheeses, pastries) as well as some cooked items and definitely set us up for all the walking we did each day! What made our trip here was the fantastic customer service and a special mention goes to Laia Paipol, the reservations manager, who went above and beyond to help me out with our booking before we arrived. I had also mentioned that the trip was a surprise for my husband's 30th birthday and we were surprised and delighted to find this had been noted and a complimentary bottle of Cava was delivered to the room with their best wishes. My husband and I absolutely loved Barcelona and hopefully we will get the chance to come back soon and without a doubt we would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but could be better”
Reviews.Author: BigE1241
Reviews.Content: Just got back from this hotel the good points are the friendly staff, the location,the roof terrace & the breakfast. The bad points are not big things but do it let it down a bit no kettle in the room? no big deal to me but a massive big deal to my girlfriend. I booked a double room & got a twin not ideal on valentines day but it was fine. Overall we loved Barcelona & the location of this hotel made it even better. Some nice bars & restaurants near the hotel. Go to Gilda by Belgious 5 minute walk from the hotel awesome food & romantic setting & good price. I will stay here again when I return to Barcelona. One more thing it's cheaper to flag down a taxi than let the hotel book it for you it was ten euros dearer going back to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly receptionist, great location, good facilities = A fantastic hotel. I would recommend!”
Reviews.Author: Corinne R Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Within 2 hours of arriving in BCN I had my handbag snatched from me. Luckily I managed to snatch it back but I was very shaken up. As I arrived at H10 Montcada, the receptionist was very friendly. I explained to her what had happened to me and she offered a glass of champagne to calm me down. She gave me some map's of the area and explained where the best places to go were. She was absolutely lovely and made me feel calm and relaxed. The room was sound-proof which was amazing considering the noise outside. Very good facilities - It's only flaw is that my room did smell of smoke a bit - but overall, a fantastic hotel!

Reviews.Title: “City break”
Reviews.Author: CMurrayDundeeUK
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel with excellent staff in a great location. Stayed with friends in three rooms all of which were exceptionally clean and comfortable. Feature of the hotel was the cleanliness - the glass mirrors in the lift were always spotless. Hotel offers a very good breakfast for 9.90 eus although there are numerous cafes in the area which offer coffee and toast for 3 - 5 euros. Perfect location for walks to the harbour area or through the cathedral area to La Rambla. Trip included visits to sagrada familia (easy 25 min walk) Gaudi house at park guell (4 stops on the metro) and Barcelona zoo (easy 10 min walk). Hotel staff also obtained tickets for Barcelona v Valencia (6 stops on metro then easy walk). Clear the congested area at end of the match and get a taxi back to hotel for 8 eus. All visits recommended. Fantastic city, great hotel, great trip.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location with excellent service.”
Reviews.Author: mikeh515
Reviews.Content: Our 4 night stay was made so memorable by the excellent service of the staff. We are used to Catalan hospitality but the staff in the hotel went beyond. Nothing was too much trouble and always a smile. The room was not huge but perfectly adequate, clean with a very comfortable bed. The bathroom & facilities were excellent. Breakfast in the restaurant also was beyond expectations. An abundance of choice. All in all we cannot praise this hotel enough.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: Linda C
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights at the end of November beg. Dec. Managed to get a really good deal both from the hotel and Last Minute. Could not fault this hotel, friendly, helpful and efficient. Free glass of champagne and a free cocktail! Rooms clean and comfortable. Close to everything, one block over from Las Rambla, close to the tour buses. Hotel staff gave us all the information we needed to make our stay in Barcelona a good one, always had time to explain and a great breakfast to set us up for the walk around. As it was November we didn't try the spa on the roof but did go up there for the views, wow!! Unfortunately I had my bag snatched and the hotel could not have done more for us, contacting the police and translating when they arrived, letting us use the telephone to cancel cards etc. and much more. Thank you for everything you did. Despite what happened we loved Barcelona and would certainly go back and stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Very helpful and positive staff”
Reviews.Author: J W
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfectly located for restaurants, shopping and sight seeing. My wife and I walked for hours per day all over Barcelone but from this hotel we were always close to a lot of interesting things to do. I can strongly recommend this hotel for an extended weekend in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “A Little Gem”
Reviews.Author: tricia298
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here 3rd to 6th January and after extensive research on the hotel we were not disappointed. Check-in was speedy and efficient with glass of champagne. We had requested a bath, not shower, but only requested a high floor on check-in. The staff were very accommodating and our requests were met. Room very comfortable, clean and bathroom spacious and modern with complimentary toiletries. Breakfast was good with plenty of choice. Location was excellent and within walking distance of all the attractions. We took the train from the airport to central Barcelona station (about 40mins) and then the underground - two stops on the yellow line to Jaume 1. Station exit was directly opposite the hotel. Cost of return train/metro was just over 9 Euro for both of us. Excellent value for money. This was our first visit to Barcelona but we shall certainly visit again and will certainly use the same hotel. Well done to all the staff at the Montcada for making our visit enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Craig_Derbyuk
Reviews.Content: We stayed here to start our honeymoon trip through Europe. The location is great and the rooms we comfortable and modern. We used the spa on the roof which was expensive for the hour but well worth it. It came with two free cocktails which I think were almost pure alcohol and was a great way to relax. The only down side is the rooms were small for the cost and as we stayed for 5 days it started to feel a bit closed in. It would be great for weekend breaks though. The city is well worth visiting with plent to do and great places to eat.

Reviews.Title: “One of our favourite places....”
Reviews.Author: Denise_
Reviews.Content: Hubby and I Stayed for four nights just before Christmas, this being our third visit to this hotel. Once again, we had an excellent stay. Staff very helpful. Breakfasts excellent, room very clean, comfortable and warm. Good location, within walking distance of many good bars and restaurants. Especially tapas bars. Ideal for sightseeing on foot but close to a subway if you wish to visit further afield. Taxi from airport approx 30 euros one way. Looking forward to our next visit in December 2012.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for a Barcelona City & Beach trip”
Reviews.Author: DrDanWest
Reviews.Content: I love Barcelona, great people, weather and activities. The H10 Montcada is perfectly located close enough to walk around most of the central part and 1 minute from a subway station if you need to go further away. The rooms, facilities and amenities are great. Well above par for European hotels and somewhere I would return to for my next Barcelona trip. The rooftop lounge/jacuzzi are particularly great features for late spring/summer trips. The gym is basic but I use it to keep up with my routine.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel and good location for a city break”
Reviews.Author: Lea020
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 3nts in Dec. Hotel staff were very friendly on check in and offered you a glass of cava on arrival which was a nice touch. Hotel is located right near most of the main tourist areas and it's not too far to walk to most of them. La Ramblas only approx 10mins away by walk. Standard Rooms in the hotel are a little small but clean and comfortable enough. Would stay here again if the price was reasonable. p.s they also have a roof top terrace with amazing views of the city and a roof top jacuzzi.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel with style”
Reviews.Author: ROgalati
Reviews.Content: The staff were very helpful and friendly. The hotel is a very good location for exploring Barcelona, close to square Catalunya. My room was small, but decorated with style. I had a glass with cava for welcome and a free drink to the bar included in price of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fab location, killer roof deck, bummer metro vibrations”
Reviews.Author: Jpipes79
Reviews.Content: We pulled this place as a last minute deal on a trip to Barcelona. We immediately loved the proximity to all the quirky streetnshops and touristy areas without the typical Ramblas area riff raff. Excellent roof terrace with a varied view of the city skyline. Really a stand out spot, however the noise from the subway can be a bit jarring. All in all great value for money/location disappointing sound isolation.

Reviews.Title: “Very good service”
Reviews.Author: eyvvv
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights and had 1 double and 1 twin room. Even though our check-in date was on 29th Nov, we were allowed to store our bags at the hotel for 4 days when we went to Madrid. The location is good, rooms clean and comfortable. Of the 3 hotels that we stayed in Barcelona and Madrid, H10 Montcada was the best of all. The staff was very helpful, friendly, efficient and informative. We were not charged for the storage of our bags and on my birthday, they even gave me a bottle of Cava in the room. How nice! Will definitely recommend this hotel. Oh, we had breakfast included, but we only ate 1 breakfast as it was only so so.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, comfortable rooms and warm welcome”
Reviews.Author: Sheena L
Reviews.Content: Long weekend for my birthday. Complimentary Cava on check in, even for additional party member who wasn't staying there. Room very comfortable, lovely powerful shower, mini bar and comfortable bed. Roof terrace is lovely and although the bar was closed for the winter, there was no problem about taking drinks up there. The location is great, just across the road to numerous shops and bars and about 7 mins meander to either Las Ramblas or the Harbour. The hotel even put a bottle of Cava and two glasses in our room for my birthday, even though we didn't say anything. That was a lovely surprise and totally unexpected. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great stay, great city!!!”
Reviews.Author: spyros74
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Barcelona with my wife for a medical convention. The hotel was booked by a greek travel agency and it was the same for all greeks travelling from Athens. The hotel is just in the heart of the city right across the cathedral in the most beautiful area. Most of the monuments and the picasso museum is in a very short walking distance, la rambla is not far from the hotel so it is the sea!!! Barcelona is a great city with plenty of things to do , great food everywhere, and very friendly people . H10 montcada i think is the best hotel to stay, not expensive and definitely a value for your money. The only negative thing is that the room was small just for a double bed, but very clean and with a great view!!! Just steps from the hotel is a subway station with connections to the whole city. P.S a tip: if you want to avoid long queues get the city pass (incl. Gaudi. Picasso museum etc...)

Reviews.Title: “40th birthday”
Reviews.Author: Stephen E
Reviews.Content: Long weekend for 2 in excellent suroundings with a complimentary cava on arrival. Staff brilliantly friendly & approachable prices in hotel bar good value in comparison to restaurants & pubs round about with sizeable measures on offer. Excellent breakfast to set you up for the day eggs, bacon, beans, toast, cereals, yogurts, fresh fruit or cold meats, with 4 fruit juices on offer & an array of coffees & teas you couldn't be anything other than satisfied. Situated in heart of Gothic quarter you can find all you want in walking distance. Like some other reviews though we also got woke up by passing metro trains so a room on an upper floor may be best idea (we were in 1st floor) nevertheless I would deffinately do this place again

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Londoner48
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel after reading lots of reviews online. It was the best hotel I have ever stayed in, beautifully decorated, rooms immaculate, and breakfast was amazing. The staff was also really helpful and pointed us in the right direction on numerous occasions and recommended a great restaurant to eat at. The location was great too, right in the Gothic quarter and a minutes walk to the metro. Would definitely highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, clean & friendly”
Reviews.Author: SouthernPacific
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the H10 Montcada whislt attending a conference at the Forum. It is agreat location, close to the Gothic quarter with lots of restaurants, and easy access to the Gaudi sites. I thouhg the hotle was excellent value for money. If you can, get a room on hte upper floors. I was on the third, and was woken every morning at ~ 5 am when the metro trains started running. The rumble echoed around hte room. Not a problem for me as I needed to get up early, but if you were on a relaxing break it could be tiresome.

Reviews.Title: “Well located very functional hotel”
Reviews.Author: NRCEdinburgh
Reviews.Content: Very well located hotel on the edge of the Born district. Comfortable and clean, yet compact rooms. On the noisy Via Laietana but double glazing deals with this well. Breakfast is good including well made buffet scrambled eggs - a definite plus. Gin and tonics in the lobby bar are substantial! a good base from which to explore - not a place in itself you would hang out at.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: TimoTuominen
Reviews.Content: i spend there 7 nights and I must say that it was more than worth the money + Excellent location (near harbour, old town, bars, metro just 50meters) + Excellent breakfast + Nice and friedly service, + Rooms clean and new decoration (small though) + Roof terrace view is beautiful Rooms: Depends what you want. My room was streetside, top floor (8th) and view from the room was splendid, but I think that view from lower is typical street view. - Noisy. Street side rooms are noisy because of the evergoing traffic and bar goers. Other side may be quieter but there is no view - so you must consider which one is more important. Noise comes also from metro when it starts going in the morning. Windows let the noise come through. - jacuzi was nice, but free without charge only limited time and the fee from using it was not from this world.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lainey221081
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend booked a trip to Barcelona for my 30th birthday and got a very good rate for this 4 star hotel. The staff were very pleasant and welcoming. We were offered a glass of cava on arrival and told to make ourselves at home. We had a double room on the 8th floor, which meant we couldn't hear the rumble of the metro. The room was quite small (who needs a massive room in a city like Barcelona anyway) but very nicely decorated, clean and had everything we needed. Breakfast was included, there was a good choice of hot and cold food available. It's also in a great location for sightseeing, eating and drinking. We will definitely be returning to Barcelona and almost certainly to the Montcada.

Reviews.Title: “Convenience is everything”
Reviews.Author: barb1129
Reviews.Content: We had a twin room on the top floor facing the city! Could not ask for a better view. The front desk staff, specifically Katia and Seline were the best! Only con was that the Bathroom is dangerous...With marble floors and tub with nothing to hold onto.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location!”
Reviews.Author: PJS7777
Reviews.Content: Good value for money, and a great location -- lots to do and see around the hotel, and a subway station just a block away. The roof bar offers a spectacular view of the rooftops of Barcelona. The rooms were clean and not cramped, and the staff was exceedingly pleasant. Definitely worth returning to when we plan a more extended visit to this beautiful city.

Reviews.Title: “Location+Quality=I heart you, Montcada!”
Reviews.Author: VeniVidiEdi
Reviews.Content: Overall experience with the hotel was wonderful. It's location - at the intersection of the El Born, Ravel, and Gothic Quarter neighborhoods - is magical. If you're in Barcelona for a brief period of time, this location allows you maximum access to La Rambla, La Boqueria, the Cathedral, and Lady of the Sea church, and many other attractions without having to walk for longer than 5 minutes. The staff were wonderfully helpful and infinitely patient (as we watched them deal with a spectrum of visitors/customers over the week we spent at the hotel). Breakfast is excellent - the self-serve espresso machine is a nice bonus. The roof-top bar ain't nothin' to sneeze at either. The rooms are nicely done and clearly recently refurbished. We stayed on the top floor so whatever noise there may have been from the street/subway was not a problem for us. The room was large by EU standards, and the bathrooms nice and gleaming. I am so glad I ended up staying here, and would return in a heartbeat!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and clean stylish rooms”
Reviews.Author: Baileyboo2000
Reviews.Content: Can't beat the location. It is right beside the Jaume metro station, the shops and restaurants on Ferran street. It is steps to the Born district on one side of Via laietana and on the other side of the street is barri gothic. Las Ramblas and Barceloneta are about a 10 minute walk in different directions. The staff are very helpful and the majority of the front desk staff speak English fluently. If you need anything, they are quick to help you resolve whatever the issue is. We stayed in room 205 . The room is small by North American standards (maybe 250 sq ft), but spacious compared to hong kong or Tokyo. More than enough room for 2 people. Because the room is close to the road, you will hear some outside noise (people talking occasionally at all hours of the night) but it didn't bother me or my husband. The beds are comfortable, but are a bit hard. It rests on wheels, so when you lean on the headboard, the bed rolls away from the wall. The free wi-Fi works well. There are only 4 English speaking tv channels and usually they are all showing the same program and sometimes the satellite isn't picking up the signal properly, so those channels will be frozen.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay in great location”
Reviews.Author: helpfiji
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our 3 night stay here. As already mentioned, easy walking distance to many attractions and the Marina is about a 10 minute walk. Lots of nice restaurants. We went back 2 nights for drinks and tapas at Luz de Gas at Port Vell with the beautiful view looking out to the Marina. We were in room 609 which was not a bad size at all, was quiet, reasonable view. Beds were firm but comfortable, there is a fridge but no tea/coffee making. There is a bank ATM right next to the Hotel and the reception staff were very helpful and polite, all spoke English. Hotel is clean, breakfast buffet was very good and the view from the top floor outside bar was wonderful! Would definitely stay here again and recommend to others. We booked the Montcada Package well in advance and it was very good value!

Reviews.Title: “Beware the rumble of the metro!”
Reviews.Author: thomaschef
Reviews.Content: Our group took 4 rooms for a long weekend in Barcelona. The hotel is located in the heart of the Gothic Quarter which is an excellent location.....many reasonable bars and restaurants are within easy walking distance. Two of our rooms were located on the first floor, facing the road. As you would expect it is pretty noisy but is OK once you are used to it. What did come as a bit of a shock is that fact that the metro runs right underneath the hotel and the whole building vibrates every time a train passes by. This is particularly noticeable on the lower floors (we had rooms 102 and 104). Mornings tend to be worse as the trains seem to start running about 6:30 so don't expect a lay in! The roof bar was great with fabulous views and the staff were all very helpful. Just a pity about the metro!

Reviews.Title: “short break away”
Reviews.Author: jap5
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a 3 day city break. The position was excellent (in the Gothic area) in between the Born District and Las Ramblas both of which were well within walking distance, the city sightseeing bus was also within 2-3 mins walk. Lots of good places to eat close by as hotel only did breakfast whilst we were there. Really friendly helpful staff. The room we stayed in was at the back of the hotel, and had rather a strange layout, but none the less it was fine. very clean our only fault was the bed was very hard and a bit uncomfortable, but very clean. Nice touch was cava when we arrived..nice roof top bar. Excellent short break!

Reviews.Title: “Great service, lovely room”
Reviews.Author: FerrisWheeler
Reviews.Content: 6 friends on a weekend away, large rooms, good location, champagne to greet us, clean and comfortable. Could not ask for more, very good price. Would definitely stay in this chain again as you know what you are getting, everything was as photos.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, reasonable price, nice amenities in small rooms”
Reviews.Author: ReKoSLC
Reviews.Content: Beautifully designed nicely located hotel (parallel to La Rambla). Welcome drink (cava) at check-in. Cool lobby and roof top. Also really nice amenities in the room plus free wi-fi. At the same time, be prepared for New York sized rooms - very very very small. At the same time, you are in Barcelona not to stay in the room and enjoy the beautiful city! I'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location”
Reviews.Author: lesleyhally
Reviews.Content: Ideally located near to Las Ramblas. Not far from the beach and the port. Close to Metro station. Very clean hotel. Rooms not spacious but adequate. good sized flat screen tv, minibar. Plenty of storage space for clothes. Bathroom a good size. Staff efficient. Good breakfast, but sometimes have to wait for a table at busy times. Roof terrace handy for a relax with a view. Nice for a coffee or a cocktail. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Go stay at H10 Montcada!”
Reviews.Author: tommeelad
Reviews.Content: We would both 100% recommend H10 Montcada in Barcelona. Our trip was to celebrate my wife's birthday and I pre-requested a room with a view - this was done with a room on the 8th floor looking towards the cathedral. The terrific rooftop bar catches the sun until it disappears and the private jacuzzi & massage package is a must - it was superb! Ok, the rooms are small (everyone says this), but they are comfortable and well equiped. Besides, the cheery staff and excellent breakfasts more than make up. Only downside was being pick-pocketed on the way in from the airport when we arrived (beware and be vigilant!) but would we return to this hotel - yes, absolutely.

Reviews.Title: “Great location with fabulous City views”
Reviews.Author: queenofmarbella
Reviews.Content: The Hotel looks good from the outside and has a stylish lobby and reception area, with very friendly and helpful staff. The room was a good size for a large City, with nice bathroom and very comfortable beds. Although on a main road, the double glazed windows provide good noise reduction. The Hotel is nearly opposite the Cathedral and is round the corner from the popular Picasso museum, both of which are a couple of minutes walk away. It takes ten minutes to walk to the bottom of La Rambla, and also to Port Vell. There is also a Metro stop opposite the Hotel. There is free WI-FI available throughout the hotel, with the addition of free computers with internet access and a printer in the lobby. The best feature of the Hotel is its rooftop terrace with bar and chill out areas which provide a tranquil oasis in which to sip cocktails after a busy day sightseeing. The breakfast room is rather disappointing, although the choice of food and drinks is good. I will definitely visit this Hotel again if I return to Barcelona

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel;great location”
Reviews.Author: marian54_11
Reviews.Content: This hotel did not disappoint on any level. The staff were fantastic particularly on reception. We had a lot of touristy questions and they were friendly and extremely helpful with all our queries. The location is excellent, near the gothic quarter, metro, shops and restaurants. The rooms were spotless and beds were really comfortable. Despite being on a busy street we found it relatively quiet. We had 3 rooms in different locations. The rooftop bar is small but is nice on a sunny evening. We did not use the jacuzzi as we were too busy sightseeing. There is a charge for its use and we thought it sounded a little expensive but worth checking out. I would return to this hotel!p s the breakfast was fantastic except for the coffee!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: ivz28
Reviews.Content: hotel was great during our stay. great location ( close to La rambla,plaza Cataluna and other major spot in BCN), great staff and great room. i would love to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Barcelona City Center Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DG-KWI
Reviews.Content: Located in the heart of Barcelona City Center area. 3mins walk to Ramla Shopping & Walking street. This hotel has an excellent location in the center of all there is to do in Barcelona. I paid Euros: 80/- for this superb hotel and will definitely stay here again if in Barcelona. The Hop On/Off bus passes by the hotel and the stop is 100mts away. I bought my tickets for the same rates from the hotel lobby. Room & Toilet are clean and big enough considering european standards. Reception staff was very helpful and explained everything and everywhere we wanted to go. Wonderful glass of Champagne offered on arrival. Apples at the reception/lobby to take with you when you head out in the morning sight-seeing. I stayed for 3 days and will definitely return again to this hotel for all the good reasons.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: mcginnmichelle
Reviews.Content: We stayed in H10 Montcada, Barcelona, for 5 nights in August as part of our honeymoon trip. As soon as we entered the hotel we loved it. With a glass of complimentary bubbly on arrival and later that evening a complimentary bottle of bubbly was brought to our room, as they knew we were on our honeymoon. The staff at this hotel are really lovely, we couldn't have asked for more from them. The rooms are a good size, modern, with a nice big bathroom and Air Con, a must have in the August heat! Good cupboard space and a safe in the room. Noise was never an issue here, although our room wasn't on the main street! The breakfast is fab, everything you could imagine and as much of it as you like. The views from the roof top terrace are breathtaking, also try the Mojito cocktail up there, they are lush!! Great location for everything, we walked to the beach which was only 10/15 mins away and the zoo/park which was 10 mins away. We will definitely be returning to this hotel on our next Barca vacation!

Reviews.Title: “GO THERE”
Reviews.Author: ersan2000
Reviews.Content: The hotel is just oppsite the metro station and very close to La ramblas, only 10 mins. walk. So the location is really perfect. Rooms are very comfortable, receptionists are really halpful. Breakfast is like a 5 star hotel breakfast. Open buffet is full of many foods. You will not want to leave the table. WI-FI is free and the hotel has got 4 computers for you at the loby, so if you don't have your laptop with you, you can use them without any charge. The view of the terrace is excellent and there is a big jakuzi. Just choose this hotel, you wil not regret..

Reviews.Title: “location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: suzanne c
Reviews.Content: in the heart of it all. easy walk to everywhere - la ramblas, the beach and nestled between gotica for beautiful history and el born for beautiful history with cafe/bar and foodie modernity. hotel itself was great. lovely 9th floor roof terrace - drinks were hotel prices and there are better bars just around the corner, but worth a drink up there for the views across the city at sunset. the staff were very helpful and offered to call venues etc to find out any details they could answer themselves. we got an upgrade to a superior room which was lovely and with a 7th floor view, we were very happy. buffet breakfast was good quality and a quick turn around meant dishes were continuously refreshed. quite a busy restaurant - on one morning we had to wait two or three minutes to be seated! there was a walking tour included in the price and although we were already quite familiar with the city it was well worth the time. the tour guide was very knowledgeable and had a very good sense of humour. would definitely recommend

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: JTrainotti
Reviews.Content: Very kindly staff and helpfull! The breakfast is fantastic. Everything are ok. Great localization, much better then near the Ramblas! The bus turistc stop is near the hotel. The majority points of interesting from Barcelona is in this district and the most beatiful and charmous streets too. We'll be back!!

Reviews.Title: “Super Rooftop Terrace”
Reviews.Author: HaveMumWillTravel
Reviews.Content: We booked through booking.com and were surprised to see that the full amount was taken from our credit card when we arrived at the hotel as we were planning to pay with cash. That was the only 'bump' as the hotel is in a great area, is very cool and stylish, friendly and has an excellent rooftop terrace for drinks. We were given a room upgrade to a suite as our room wasn't ready when we went to check in early - which was a nice surprise. The room itself had no view but was large and had a separate seating area. We didn't care about the lack of view because we spent a lot of time on the rooftop terrace overlooking stunning view of Barcelona. Our fiends complained that the rooms were small but that was the only complaint overall we were all very happy with the hotel. Staff very friendly and the cool glass of Cava was a welcome touch on check-in. You can buy tickets for the open-top bus tours at reception at a discount, and the bus stop is just around the corner. About 30 euro to the airport in a taxi. Not the cheapest hotel but it does give good style - and not stuffy but rather a quite friendly boutique hotel. Tip: if you are staying in the hot months, leave a key card in the slot in the room to keep the air con on - otherwise it goes off with the lights when you are out and about and you will come back to a really hot room.

Reviews.Title: “Make sure you see your credit card charge before accepting room.”
Reviews.Author: Ghiverney
Reviews.Content: I called the H10 Montacada to enquire about a room price for 2 nights and was advised 180E. I asked, "is that for one night or two nights", and was told, "for two nights". Me and my two young daughters came with 6 pieces of luggage and again I asked the cost and was again told 180E and again I asked, "Is that for one night or two nights", and again was told "that is for two nights". I signed the contract which stated 180E. They were kind enough and allowed us to leave our luggage until the 3pm check in time. We returned and I was given the keys and the credit card bill which showed 360E. I said, that this was a mistake as it was to be 180E. The receptionist pulled out the contract to show me and now beside the 180E was written, x 2 ngts. This was not originally there as I specifically looked for this earlier. The woman I spoke with had no customer service or people skills and I asked to speak with the manager and she told me she was the manager! My daughters and I had just arrived from a terrible apartment rental problem in which the apartment we had rented was 35C and the sewer smell was so strong it kept us awake the previous night. I took this apartment because it had AC, which now did not...(do not rent from Barcelona Next Door) and I was not willing to expose my children to this. We left the apartment without any compensation whatsoever. We had two days in Barcelona and I was not wishing to spend anymore time in locating accommodations and so in tears, I took this hotel room. The room was small and the bathroom was about the size of the room. The beds were the worst I have ever slept on. I like a hard mattress too but this was like sleeping on rocks! I was in pain for the next week. The international channels did not work and they never did come to fix it. The WIFI only worked if you sat in one spot in the room and even then it was so painfully slow.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: DollyD426
Reviews.Content: A fantastic hotel! The service of staff was excellent; very helpful and good communication. Bed comfy and bathroom incredibly clean! A superb location - would most certainly recommend!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Kraktin
Reviews.Content: The hotel being situated on a main traffic road we were worried that the room would be noisy and disturb our sleep; at check-in we therefore asked the receptionist if we could have a "quiet room". He gave us a room at 6th floor facing the back of the hotel, and to our great pleasure we had absolutely no noise problems. We knew of course that breakfast was not included, and he informed us that breakfast was available at €15, but he also told us that there was a discounted rate of €10, if ordered before 9 o'clock morning! We took advantage of this and had a really good breakfast every morning during our stay at a really favourable price.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Jctc79
Reviews.Content: The hotel as very conveniently located in the Gothic Quarter. It was easy to walk to many attractions whilst the metro was also just outside the hotel connecting the rest of the city. The reception was friendly and welcoming and resolved all our small issues quickly. Our room had a lovely view of the city and had every amenity that was necessary. The roof terrace was great although we didn't use the hot tub. Barcelona is a vibrant city (we were out until 6am and the beach was heaving) with interesting sights and great food. A perfect short break destination.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel because of the location”
Reviews.Author: Vegas003
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights before a cruise departing Barcelona. The hotel location is excellent, near the Cathedral, La Rambla, museums, the beach and many restaurants and boutiques. It is very easy to walk to all those locations and the staff is very helpful if you need direction. The hotel is very clean and as a beautiful terrace on the roof with a bar, the view of the city is beautiful, you could see La Sagrada Familia, the port ... The room was small but since we were going on a cruise it was not an issue ( ship cabin are small), but you could here the noise from the street during the night ( after the first night you get used to it ). The bed mattress is very firm ( like sleeping on a cement block) my back was sore in the morning. The bathroom was amazing, very nice and big but the best part was the huge shower and very strong water pressure ( it did wonder on my sore back). Barcelona is a beautiful city. The best way to visit is the Up and Go double decker bus, not expensive and you could get out visit some sites and catch the next bus. Tapas restaurants are excellent and many many choices near the hotel. The market on a side street off La Rambla is very nice and they have everything you could imagine in terms of food, but it gets very busy in the afternoon. We will definetely go back to Barcelona. Loved everything about it.

Reviews.Title: “After our cruise”
Reviews.Author: linda p
Reviews.Content: The hotel was really nice - a much bigger bathroom after our cruise. The rooftop lounge was beautiful. Great location! Not much choice for room service but the breakfast buffet was incredible! Staff was very pleasant. I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel great staff and lovely breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Shazo54
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel we thought our room was small and a little shabby but had everything you needed. The hotel staff were excellent really helpful and obliging. We got a really good deal here but would not like to pay the prices they normally ask for the room we had. The bed was really hard and uncomfortable thank goodness we were only staying for 4 nights. The proximity to metro and town centre was fantastic and it was a really nice quiet area at night time. The view and bar area on the roof was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Modern and stylish”
Reviews.Author: indauk
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a long weekend trip to Barcelona. The hotel was very easy to find, close to a underground station. A very friendly welcome with a glass of bubbly. Room was huge and very clean. Would stay here again without a doubt. Great location, close to the beach and easy access to all the highlights of Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Well located, very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: oy-bell
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for just 1 night. Very enjoyable, staff were very helpful and friendly. Room small but not too small. Comfortable bed. Got a last minute deal on it and was a very good price. Perfectly located. Room looked over busy road but had 2 sets of windows and the road noise didn't bother us at all. Lots of nice restaurants and bars very nearby, as well as a number of places of interest. Directly across the road from a metro station allowing easy access to elsewhere in Barcelona, as well as getting the metro to Barcelona airport.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, room and breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: SuzanneA-A
Reviews.Content: Lovely, quiet clean room with hardwood floor. Great view from rooftop cafe and bar. Located in gothic area next to cathedral and within walking distance of many sites including LasRamblas. Good value. Rate included excellent buffet breakfast, strawberries and champagne. Staff was helpful and professional.

Reviews.Title: “Almost ruined our honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: Luca_Sardaryan
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for 5 days on the way back from our honeymoon in Gran Canaria. We chose it for its location and good comments on tripadvisor and ... it was a disaster. The room was so tiny that if one of us was standing there was no room for the other. The bed was so small that normally sized me and my husband could barely fit on it, both by height and by width. It was on rollers and was not fixed and moved with every movement. The metro vibrations were felt every 2-3 minutes. The bathroom was clean but really small too. I have stayed in many European middle class hotels and know that they have small rooms, but this was the smallest room I have ever seen in my life. The breakfast was OK, nothing special. The staff was OK too, friendly and willing to help. The hotel had 2 elevators but one was almost always out of order. When checking out we waited for 10 minutes for an elevator and finally took our suitcases by stairs so as not to be late for the plane. The only really good thing about the hotel is the location, right in the middle of everything. I regret very much that we did not pay 15euros more per night to stay in Hotel Barcelona Colonial.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, well-appointed room in GREAT location”
Reviews.Author: bctravels54
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in an amazing place in the Gothic quarter, the metro was within a block, and great shopping and restaurants within 2-3 blocks. ALso, lots of sights -- very central wonderful location. Staff was very helpful, lovely buffet breakfast. Would definitely stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location and hotel, I will return”
Reviews.Author: newcastle74
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my mum in May. The glass of cava on check in was a welcome treat after a hot taxi ride. The room was very small but perfectly clean and adequate for our needs. The breakfast was outstanding with so much choice it makes you dizzy. fresh juices, coffee, tea, yogurts, fruit, english breakfast, bread, pastries, meats and cheeses, the list is endless. The hotel roof terrace bar is a lovely way to start and/or end your eveing, with great city views. The hotel is in a perfect location, 10 minutes walk from catalunya square, la Rambla, the port, and the gothic quarter with its myriad of quirky shops and street cafes. If you are looking for a great meal out then i highly recommend Ginos italian resteraunt up the street. The food is cheap but very deliscious. I really recommend thid hotel. Im already planning my return to Barcelona next year and when I do i will be staying here.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Choice!”
Reviews.Author: travelwizz
Reviews.Content: I travelled to Barcelona with a family group (three couples) for a three day break. On arrival at the hotel we were greeted by the very friendly and efficient reception staff and as we were a bit early our rooms were not ready so they suggested we leave our cases and start to enjoy Barcelona. We found a lovely tapas restaurant and had lunch and returned to the hotel to find our rooms ready. We were on the 8th floor at the front of the hotel and we had a good view. The rooms were spotless and perfectly equipped - yes the rooms are quite small but the bathroom was very spacious. As hotel on busy road you can hear traffic but hardly at all when window is closed and there is air conditioning so no problems at all. Probably one of the best rooms we have had on a city break. The breakfast is excellent with plenty of choice - continental and cooked available - fruit was delicious! We went to the rooftop terrace for pre and after dinner drinks and it was great - very friendly barman who made great cocktails! It was a lovely place to sit and relax - we did not use the jaccuzi as it had to be booked and we were too busy exploring the city but it did look nice! We also had our complimentary champagne and strawberries on the terrace which was a very welcome gesture from the hotel. Had a great time in Barcelona doing the bus tours and other sights and eating and drinking at different places. Hotel was a good choice as location was central but most of all it was well run and friendly. On a previous visit to Barcelona we stayed at The Magestic which was 5 star and quite grand but we enjoyed this just as much and the breakfast was better!

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting non existant service”
Reviews.Author: titch08
Reviews.Content: Its a shame i have to criticise this hotel, as the hotel itself is nice and in a good location, but their customer service is beyond poor. I took my partner there for her 30th birthday and upon arrival was told our room wasn't avaialble due to a leak and they had been trying to contact me (i had no messages nor missed calls) we were sent to anpther hotel for the night which was disapointing in itself but the hotel wasn't great. However, we were assured on our return in the morning we would recive VIP treatment! When we went back to H10 the following morning we were told we had to wait till 3pm to check in so had to leave out suitcases in the lobby and carry our passports and money etc on u. Now anyone who has been to Barcelona will know this is far from ideal as it is known for muggings! When we were eventually able to check in our VIP treatment was a glass of Cava. We requested a late check out afterall we had paid for 2 nights in this 4 star hotel but no - we were called and told we had to check out (despite my girlfriend being unwell) and having spent all of about 15 hours in the hotel. Upon my return to the UK i wrote to H10 to say i was dispointed however their lack of compassion and in fact their disgusting reply prompted a full compaint to which they cut and paste their first reply to me again!!! My advise - don't waste your money at a H10 hotel. Customer Service or satisfaction obvioulsy isn't their thing.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel! Would stay again and again.”
Reviews.Author: levd1_10
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 days, was very impressed! We were welcomed with a glass of champagne, and shown to our room. The rooms are not very big, but clean, contemporary, and the bathrooms are modern and clean. We were also given a complimentary bottle of champagne and strawberries, to be enjoyed on their rooftop bar. It was GREAT! Didn't try their spa, but the rooftop bar we kept coming back to over and over again, it was a nice way to end the day. There is also free Wi-Fi, which was very convenient. The breakfast was DELICIOUS, and they offer a huge spread - from scrambled eggs and chorizo, to sandwiches, yogurts, toast, an assortment of freshly baked pastries, fresh fruit and deli meats and cheeses. It was definitely something to look forward to every morning! The location is very convenient - steps away from a metro station, and a pleasant 10-15 minute walk away from La Rambla. We were able to take the metro right up to all the Gaudi buildings. Definitely recommend this hotel to anyone. It's a hip, boutique hotel right in the middle of all the action. Two thumbs up!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Great Location !”
Reviews.Author: VailAZTraveler
Reviews.Content: Recently completed a pre- and post- cruise stay at the H10 Montcada. Hotel and staff were excellent ! Location was fantastic - very close to the Ramblas and many great sites in the Gothic district. Breakfast buffet was also a plus. Close to many excellent restaurants in the old quarter. Highly recommend this hotel for a great stay in Barcelona !

Reviews.Title: “First rate!”
Reviews.Author: Sean_WBelfast
Reviews.Content: Used as a base for 3 day trip to Barcelona! Rooms really comfy and spotless! We had 2 rooms -I had asked for one with a good view and got it. really close to everything and on the red bus tour line. Would def recommend highly.

Reviews.Title: “location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: Sierra015
Reviews.Content: Hotel H10 Mopntada was the perfect location for my grown son's and my recent whirlwind trip to Spain. It was recommended to us by my former Spanish teacher who had lived in Barcelona, and she was right on. It is a stone's throw away from Placa Catalunya and all of the city's hubbub and tour departures; it is also in a safe section of Barcelona so that we felt perfectly comfortable walking to and from our activities. The hotel itself is quite hip and contemporary, and we were thrilled to be greeted with a large flute of champagne upon arrival. The staff are very helpful and friendly, and most of them speak decent English, which was nice, although my son and I spoke enough Spanish between us to make our requests/needs known. There were two downsides, however, to our stay. The Wi-Fi did not work in our guestroom, so we had to use the two hotel computers, and there was often a long queue. The other thing is that the rooms are quite small, which might be a problem for some travelers. The rooms are immaculate and well-appointed, as is the bathroom, but there is not a whole lot of moving around space in the actual bedroom.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a GREAT location!”
Reviews.Author: heather297
Reviews.Content: The H10 Montcada was recommended to me by a friend, and I'm happy to recommend it to others! The best part about this hotel is the location, hands-down. You're right around the corner from the Gothic district, full of restaurants and shops and a web of tiny roads to explore. Walk a little further down Via Laietana and you'll hit the water and the beaches. You're basically in the middle of everything, a short walk to the Rambla and the tourist areas, to shopping, to historical sites... everything you'd want to explore in Barcelona. The rooms themselves were sparse and clean- not the biggest rooms, so I wouldn't recommend it if you're looking to stay in the lap of luxury. But the staff was friendly and helpful, the price was right, and we were extremely happy with our stay. I would absolutely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel in Fantastic City!”
Reviews.Author: TaraStirling
Reviews.Content: The H10 Montcada hotel was a great hotel. We stayed for 4 nights back in February, and would say this hotel was perfect for what you could want on a city break. Perfect location, about a 10 minute walk to La Ramblas, Plaza Catalunya and other main attractions while Barcelona Cathedral is just across the road. To get to the water front and the beaches, it is a short walk away ( around 15 minutes), with things of interest to see on the way. There were shops within the area, and also bars and restaurants serving good food located near by the hotel too. The hotel itself is lovely. Very clean and the rooms are nice - average size and well equiped. There is a nice bar/reception area on entering the hotel, and also there is a rooftop bar with jacuzzi with great views of the city! Staff were very friendly and always availabe to help and office advice. I would definatly stay at this hotel again when visiting Barcelona, and would also highly recommend it. Feel free to contact me if you have any questions about the hotel itself, or about Barcelona!!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely tiny room”
Reviews.Author: Lesleyannw
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel after reading several good reviews but were totally disappointed when we arrived at our room - it was minute! To get round the side of the bed, we had to shuffle sideways, this was the same on both sides and my husband could not pass each other in the room. It was not even a double bed, it was a 3/4 bed. The air conditioning did not work properly but it was just too noisy to have the window open so we seltered for the whole weekend. The bathroom was nearly as big as the bedroom. On the plus side the breakfast was OK and the hotel was well situated. Would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “H10 Montcada was great!”
Reviews.Author: superrayz
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 1 night for the FC Barcelona-Shakhtar Donetsk CL match last Wednesday night. Location is perfect right next to the Gothic Quarter/Las Ramblas and one block from the Metro station (Jaume I). Stayed in a single room on the 6th floor which was tiny but very clean and comfortable for 1 person. Bathroom was also very clean. My room rate came with the buffet breakfast in the lower level and was full of selections and variety so I ate as much as I could!! The check-in process was smooth and had a free glass of champagne (cava, i think though) and they held my luggage since I arrived too early for check-in so I went out throughout the city to kill time. I also stopped by the rooftop lounge and it has really, really fine views of the city...Great aerial shots of the streets and the various buildings all along the city. Highly recommended for convenience, cleanliness, and value for any traveller!!

Reviews.Title: “perfect city hotel”
Reviews.Author: baluethebear
Reviews.Content: Barcelona is just one of the greatest cities in europe. and the H10 is in a very very good location. right next to the gothic quarter and walking distance to the harbour. everything a traveler need just outside the door! we rented a scooter at cooltra (cooltra.com) and quite secure parking for the scooter just outside the hotel. By far the best about this hotel is the marvelous hot tub on the roof terrace! after e day of sightseeing, shopping and cruising through town an hour in the hot tub is just perfect before you head off for some tapas!

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT HOTEL HIGHLY RECOMMENDED”
Reviews.Author: Laurie84
Reviews.Content: Arrived at hotel and was will pleased, room on high floor at front no noise brilliant views over the city by day and night.Breakfast 100% best we ever had stuffed until the afternoon.Very helpful staff, only thing no swimming pool.Would highly recommend this hotel to anyone.Walk out the door and your in the middle on everything.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in a beautiful city, would not stay any where else!”
Reviews.Author: TomJdm
Reviews.Content: We have just got back from a 5 night stay in Barcelona with H10 Montcada. On arrival we were greeted with a glass of champagne and very pleasant reception staff. We went to our room, only to find it was on the 1st floor and I had asked for a higher room, although at the time of booking they couldn't promise this. Anyway, we asked to be moved higher and within 5 minutes we were in a room on the 5th floor, no problem whatsoever. Overall, whenever we needed any help or had any questions the staff were fantastic. They helped us with what restaurants to go to and told us about their favourites. The bar staff were great, very happy and chirpy. My partner was without a drink one evening as she didn't fancy one and they brought her a Cosmopolitan cocktail on the house. Breakfast was great, full english cooked breakfast available, fresh fruit and cereals; something that met every dietary requirement. Fresh juices and even alcohol including Cava and Vodka. I found the only negative reading through the comments before I went, was the size of the room but we were very pleased. There was plenty of room to get round the bed and the bathroom was huge. For a hotel in the centre of a city the size was great and you must remember this is a city centre! I have stayed in hotels in London with rooms half the size. The hotel location is the best of the city as you are walking distance from everything and hardly need to spend a penny on public transport etc! The harbour is 5 minutes away, beach 10 - 15 minutes walk, las ramblas 10 minutes walk, lots of restaurants in the area so you are not walking far in the evening etc etc Taxi from the airport cost us about 30 euros which isn't too bad if like us you land quite late and don't want to be getting buses etc Overall this holiday was very special with us getting engaged and then having a fantastic hotel and friendly staff it made an overal fantastic week. We will be returning to Barcelona and will definitely be returning to H10 Montcada

Reviews.Title: “Anytime again!”
Reviews.Author: MnMBasel
Reviews.Content: The very friendly stuff kept us well entertained with cava till our rooms for ready and helped us in every situation ( nasty pick-pockets in this city). Great location with excellent rates and a gorgeous view over the city from the rooftop. We would stay there anytime again!

Reviews.Title: “Micro sized modern minimalism at it's best”
Reviews.Author: MissPennyLane
Reviews.Content: Greeted with a glass of (free!!!) champagne, the H10 staff made my first few moments in Barcelona feel as if it were out of a movie. The lounge area was filled to the brim with all sorts of people. Different nationalities were represented in an array of fashions. It was all so whimsical, except for the fact of having a huge pack strapped to my back making my presence being know to everyone. Once we arrived in our room we were brought back to the real world. It was MICRO sized. We had opted for a double (two very small twin beds crammed into an even smaller room) hoping to have some extra space, but that was not so. The room was very clean, but the hassle of moving around and strategically placing our things in the nooks and crannies made our stay less enjoyable. The bathroom was nice and very accessible. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants the NYC minimalist/posh inspired experience. It is expensive and I do believe there are better hotels in the area for the same price. I did have issues bookingthe room for a second night. It was on a Sunday so you would assume that the price would bs the same or cheaper than the night before, but hotel staff charged me €20 more. I tried to dicuss my frustration with the front desk staff but it was uncessful. So, if you choose to stay at this hotel, book your stay through a discount search engine. Your sure to find a cheaper rate and not deal with the hassle of overpriced rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Location for Exploring Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Phil D
Reviews.Content: The staff were excellent, helpful and informative, even had a glass of bubbly on arrival while checking in. The room we had was a double to the front/side of the Hotel on the 3rd floor. Some traffic noise and underground was heard at night but nothing to interupt our sleep. In the heat of the summer with windows opened this may be different? The hotel was clean and tidy at all times. Plenty to do and go and see. Our main reason for staying was running in the Barcelona Half Marathon only 10 minutes walk from Hotel ideally situated between the Arch de Triumph and La Ramblers with all the little streets and shops on the doorstep. The restaurant was excellent, a little quaint, breakfast meals help yourself to whatever as much as you want. Plenty for everyone, lots of choice and well presented. All tables clean, tidy and nicely laid out. Facilties are good, small gym, Jacuzzi on rooftop. Would prefer Jacuzzi late afternoon evening free for guests but you have to pay after 1pm. Evenings are for the more romantic. Bar area in reception, nice soft seating, staff very helpful. Hotel close to Underground, bus terminals and taxi's everywhere. Recommend the Cafe corner shop directly opposite, nice setting. Park Gardens and Zoo close by. All in all a very enbjoyable stay and would go back again. Hope the standards don't drop.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location and Rooftop Jacuzzi”
Reviews.Author: lollidSydney
Reviews.Content: This hotel was awesome, the staff are really friendly, rooms are clean and really nice. The rooftop bar area has such a great view, and can chill out in the outdoor Jacuzzi which I did for 2 days. The breakfast is yummy and worth paying for it if not included - we found by the time we bought breakfast outside the hotel it was costing us around the same price anyway and you get more being a buffet in the hotel. The location is such a bonus! It's just a short walk to the shopping area and the beach..

Reviews.Title: “excellent location, fantastic customer service”
Reviews.Author: Braithwaite422
Reviews.Content: I travelled to Barcelona for 3 nights for my birthday with a friend. The hotel is very central; walking distance to many of the districts of interest and 2 minutes to the metro to visit the sites further out. Close to many nice restaurants as well in the evening. I booked on-line through Expotel for the flights and this hotel. E-mailed them separately to ask for twin beds and although they never acknowledged the e-mail it was all arranged when we arrived. The service from the reception and the bar was wonderful. They must have realised from my passport that it was my birthday and delivered a bottle of cava to our room to help the celebrations. We paid extra for the breakfast and it was first class. A huge array of fresh fruit, cold meats and breads and a cooked breakfast for those that wanted something more substantial. The hotel isn't quiet. We had a room at the back and it was still noisy with the windows open because of the neighbouring air conditioning machines and street noise. But that is the pay off for having such a wonderful central location. Take ear plugs and live with it!! We walked 10 minutes out each evening for a vast array of Tapas bars and other restaurants and then had mint tea in the foyer bar which provided excellent service. Room small but very clean and tidy with a large bathroom, Very good for the price and we were there to be out and about and not in our room all the time. Beds very comfortable and excellent sleep after long days of walking around the city. Would definately come back here again for the location and service.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location.Great staff”
Reviews.Author: montyballs
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at the end of January and found the staff excellent and the location could not be better.We booked a three night stay and even though our flight was cancelled and we arrived a day late the hotel still put us up for three nights at no extra charge,anything we asked for was no trouble to the staff .The hotel is in a great location just 50 yds from the cathedral and many other sights within walking distance.Yes the rooms are on the small size and you can here the rumblings of the metro at night as mentioned in other reviews but it didnt keep us awake.If you come by air buy a T10 ten journey ticket at the Renfe train station at the airport and take the train and metro to the hotel and use it to get to all the other sights.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Motherland
Reviews.Content: From the moment we walked in the door, we were made welcome. The reception staff were brilliant and spoke perfect English. We were greeted with a chilled glass of Cava and shown to our room. We had booked the ‘Montcada’ package which meant as well as having breakfast covered, it also included ‘cava and strawberries’ at a time of our choice. We were given a voucher to redeem at the bar and this was most welcome after a hard day of sightseeing. We had booked on www.getaroom.com and the price for our package was the same as other sites were charging for room only. The location is very good – 5mins from Las Ramblas and near the Gothic area. Getting there from the airport was also easy – take the RENFE train to Passage de Garcia, then change to the yellow metro line to Jaume. It will however take you about 5-7mins to walk from the RENFE platform down to the yellow metro line. The hotel is literally opposite Jaume metro station. We bought a T10 ticket at the RENFE station at the airport and at only €8.45 for 10 trips (if you change transport with 90mins of first journey then it is only one trip) is great value as it can be used on the bus, tram, train and metro. Breakfast was very good – large choice of fruit, cheese, meats, toast, cereals, hot buffet, teas/coffees, cava and juices. The cost if you hadn’t paid was €9.99 (special offer in January, normally €14.99) but it really sets you up for the day. There are many local cafes nearby if you are on room only basis. The room was small but comfortable, big bathroom, large screen TV with several English channels and a free digital safe. The mini bar was also well stocked. We were on the 7th floor and on the main road and wasn’t too noisy, but you could hear police sirens and the distant rumble of the metro. There is a roof top bar and terrace (bar closed due to the season) and the night time views are amazing. There is also a mini gym which we didn't use. The hotel has free wi-fi throughout but is strongest in the foyer, and there are also 2 internet PC's free to use. No advice regarding trips / sights etc – too many, but the hotel is a great base for any visit to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in a fantastic location.”
Reviews.Author: H-DUFC
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in Jan 11. Cava on arrival coupled with very good service from the staff. Room was small but perferctly adequate for a city break. Would stay here again especially in the summer so I could use the rooftop bar & jacuzzi!!

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms but great location”
Reviews.Author: ferrisgirl
Reviews.Content: Yes the room was small - and my window just looked into an internal section, but it was clean, with good amenities, good bathroom, bed comfortable and the rooftop terrace was a great place to chill out with a drink and look at Barcelona. It's right in the GOthic Quarter and everything is easily accessible. Staff were lovely and we got a free glass of champagne on arrival.

Reviews.Title: “too many inflated reviews”
Reviews.Author: NadB7
