Reviews.Content: I arrived early am and was not accommodated a room. Imagine being jet-lagged, having traveled over 7 hours, and then having to wait until 3 to check-in. This is not a hotel that cares about how it treats its clients. I could care less about the cheap cava you're provided. Rooms are subpar. Beds not very comfortable. Towels feel like sandpaper. Rooftop terrace uneventful. Never saw a bar man in the week I was there. Forget the overpriced jacuzzi. Pros: Good location. You're in the middle of everything; however, traffic down Laetana is quite noisy--avoid lower floors. The staff lent themselves to helping with directions, printing maps. Nothing out of the ordinary. I had working internet which was a plus. If you can afford to stay at a better hotel, I would recommend you avoid this one. Otherwise, if you're a budget traveler and have minimum expectation and only care for clean room and good location then you'll love this place.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: brownhorse
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights in January, the room was small but it had everything you need for a short stay, including air con, nice flat screen tv but only news channels in English. Toilet/shower area was big and good selection of products. It was too cold for us to sit out on the rooftop terrace but it was clean and had great views. The staff were amazingly helpful and friendly. The glass of Cava on arrival was a nice touch and you should book breakfast if poss as it was excellent, very fresh and varied items to tempt you. The location of this hotel was excellent, 10 mins walk from the bus station and a few mins walk from Les Ramblas and the gothic area. We did a walking tour which was very interesting taking us places only 5 mins away that we would never have found ourselvs. As a whole, we found Barcelona to be an expensive place to eat out so be prepared for that. For 2 people, tapas and main course with wine will set you back 40-50 euros.

Reviews.Title: “New, clean, great location!”
Reviews.Author: mikieema
Reviews.Content: That's a very good 4 stars hotel in the city centre. We found a special offer on easytobook.com and paid 70Euros for a double room! It's newly redecorated and has got a lovely terrace. Very clean and friendly staff. We really recommend it! P.S. We suggest not to have breakfast into the hotel. Go to the Pasteleria Santa Clara (www.pasteleriasantaclara.com) and you'll be amazed!

Reviews.Title: “Not quite as described - location is really the only draw”
Reviews.Author: Pete190722
Reviews.Content: Booking this hotel based upon price, location and the reviews for a one night New Years Eve trip we were initially very pleased as we arrived at the hotel at midday although the check in time should have been 3pm we were allowed to check in. However after this initial pleasing experience we were somewhat disappointed by the room. Small would perhaps not be a fair decription. The small bed could barely be described as a double, there was perhaps barely more than a foot around the bed to the walls and we both had to walk crab like around the bed! The bathroom was more than adequate although the bath was really very small but the shower above was fine. Unfortunately we had an internal view from our only window of a dark enclosed courtyard which was overlooked by about 8 rooms. The roof top bar and jacuzzi I would definitely say is very seasonal as when we ventured up to see it there were no staff and it did look like no one had been up there for days. Good points - the minibar is well stocked. The staff are friendly and helpful. The location is excellent. The hotel is kept very clean. The complimentary toiletries are good. Bad points - expensive for what it is. Rooms very very very small. Bed very small and matress very poor. Television does not have many English language channels apart from news. There was no iron or ironning board in the room. The photos shown are taken with some very special angles or lenses by the looks of things.

Reviews.Title: “Chic, Comfortable and Convienent”
Reviews.Author: mel4
Reviews.Content: I was a solo female traveler and could not have selected a better hotel. The room was sleek, comfortable and clean. The hotel is located in a great section to go to restaurants and shops in the Barri Gotic as well as to the harbor. The breakfast is amazing and I strongly suggest you add it on if possible. The morning of my departure was too early for breakfast so they prepared a picnic version in a bag. So accomodating and helpful. Prices were reasonable for drinks and meals. Lots of little extras. Loved it

Reviews.Title: “okay hotel, budget , no frills”
Reviews.Author: amit_email
Reviews.Content: okay hotel. they gave us an upgrade room, as it was our anniversary, but this room looked into the shaft and had no other window. the room was also L shaped, which kind of made is very wierd. we arrived early in the morning and only got a room around noon. so please do not ask them, for early check in as they will always refuse. all in all, breakfast is okay, location is the key reason people stay here as it is close to plaza catalunya which is the hub in barca.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service and perfect location!!”
Reviews.Author: Nadia_and_Andrew
Reviews.Content: We had originally booked just the 2 of us into this hotel, however needed to add an extra person at the last minute. After emailing the hotel the night prior to arrival, we were told on arrival that we would have to go from a double bed to twin beds in order to fit a 3rd person in. The staff could see were were disappointed about this and offered to check into it further for us. They then offered to upgrade us to a suite for what was a minimal amount (approx 15 euros) so we could comfortably have a double bed and single bed in the room. they were very accommodating and helpful- especially Simone & Giuseppe!! To top it off they then offered us a complimentary glass of champagne. The hotel position is fabulous, only being one street away from La Rambla and very close to the Gothic quarter. The hotel provided great advice re: restaurants and were also very helpful with maps and directions. The view from the rooftop bar is amazing!!! We would thoroughly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, location, service and breakfast buffet”
Reviews.Author: dbearToronto_ON
Reviews.Content: We just stayed three nights at the H10 Montcada. Being greeted with champagne, chocolates and water in the room was nice but would not have made any difference if the room had not been exceptionally good (4 star rather than the 3 we paid for), the service throughout or stay invisibly good and the breakfast (14 euros extra if separate) a delightful broad selection of hot and cold, fruit and baked goods, cereals and meats/cheeses. All in all, a great experience for the price in a central location. NOTE: WiFi in the room was a bit iffy but they brought a cable quickly and with apologies. The area can be noisy but on the 7th floor we didn't feel it was. Although the hotel has a spa, its fitness center and pool are tiny - but we weren't here for that.

Reviews.Title: “Almost Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: dewdrop281
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for six days as part of our honeymoon. Barcelona, as a whole, is an absolutely fantastic city. The people are incredibly friendly, the city is impeccably clean and it is very easy to find your way around. We had read a lot about pick-pockets and con artists, but aside from seeing a scam game being played on the street, we didn't have ANY problems. The H10 Montcada is in the perfect location on Via Laietana in the gothic quarters. The Picasso Museum is literally a 2 minute walk, the Mediterranean Sea an easy 15 minute walk, Las Ramblas 5 minutes with plenty of tapas, buses, metros and shopping in between! The staff at the hotel were very friendly and helpful (practically everyone in the city speaks English). The rooms were clean, but were very small. We enjoyed our cozy little room and were very lucky to have a room facing the main road, but I could see how some people would be very turned off by the size. The terrace on the 9th floor offered spectacular views of the city, but the bar itself was not open the entire time we were there. We did pick up some fruit, cheese and bread from the market along with a bottle of wine and sat on the terrace regardless. We used credit card rewards points so our stay was free, but I believe it was only $100USD per night, which I think was an incredibly fair price for this hotel. There are plenty of places right outside the door to get breakfast so I would not advise paying the steep hotel prices for their buffet. Just as a side note, the metro does run directly underneath the building and even on the 7th floor we could hear when it began running early in the morning. As city people, it was not a big deal for us although I imagine on the lower floors it could be quite bothersome. All in all we had a fantastic time and would gladly do it all over again!

Reviews.Title: “Great position to explore Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Mediterranean10_10
Reviews.Content: It was our first time in Barcelona, straight off a cruise ship and we were able to store our luggage there prior to the check-in time. Great location to explore the city and close to eating places. Room was to the back, so less noise from the road and bathroom was spacious and modern. Breakfast had a good choice and there are plenty of other alternatives close by. We had one problem, we presumed that we would get a double bed but the room had single beds which we complained about and we were told that it was because we had not requested a double room which I found a bit strange as we had booked it as a couple and had not requested single beds. The good thing was that they came and fixed it before we wanted to flop. Overall we found the hotel and staff very good. We would stay there again, if we were fortunate to visit Barcelona again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic - Why did we come home?”
Reviews.Author: Biblet_10
Reviews.Content: My husband and i visited Barcelona for the 4th time last week. It is the first time we have stayed at this hotel and it is by far the best one we have stayed at in Barcelona. Staff very friendly and welcoming on arrival, the glass of cava was a lovely idea! Yes, the room was small, however this is a city break! These types of hotels have small rooms! Very quiet room, on 5th floor. Didn't use breakfast room as we were room only, however a small cafe opposite did breakfast for an amazing 3 Euro! The bar was comfortable, relaxing and lovely to come back to after a busy day sightseeing and an evening of tapas and cava! Although we keep saying we must go somewhere different, we just love Barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “Disrespectful Staff, Small Rooms”
Reviews.Author: sprach73
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I were traveling to Spain for a long awaited vacation. We arrived at H10 Montcada and were greeted with a complimentary glass of champagne. I was looking forward to the "free cocktails" that I had included in my room cost online. I thought it was a great deal that for 10 Euros more per night I would receive unlimited drinks any time I happened to be passing by the bar (including the roof top bar which was closed for the duration of my stay). The staff then proceeded to hand me a coupon for free drinks one time from 4-7pm and that was all. The same coupon would have been handed out to me if I stayed 1 night or 20 (paying 10 euros or 200). This didn't seem to make sense to me and I disputed with the hotel and the chain. The staff treated me with disrespect, did not want to receive any of my complaints, and would not refund my money if I gave the coupon back. I felt as if I had been scammed. This alone gave me an overall poor experience at the hotel. Also, the rooms are very small.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Hayley435
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel twice now. The location is great for a city break as it is just a short walk from the main sights. There is a train station just opposite and a bus stop at the end of the road which is useful. The hotel itself is clean and fairly quiet. Breakfast is good with both hot and cold food offered. The roof terrace is lovely with great views over the city and the jacuzzi and bar are great for relaxing after a long days sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Good for a citytrip when you get a promotional price”
Reviews.Author: swch71
Reviews.Content: We stayed there 3 nights last year in December. We liked the location very much as it is close to the barri gotic. Most of the staff were nice and friendly, some of them seemed to be very young and inexperienced. The room was very basic, some of the amenities did not work (TV, safe, phone) and did not get fixed during our stay. The room is outdated but was very clean. Bathroom is old too but everything still properly functioning. The breakfast buffet offered a wide choice. However, some of the food did not look fresh. We have got the room for a cheap price (approx. 80 Euros per room) - for this price the hotel was ok. We would not recommend it if you have to pay the full price as the rooms need renovation.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in ideal location”
Reviews.Author: OldXeroid
Reviews.Content: We stayed at H10 Montacada 13 - 17 September. Glass champagne on arrival. Rooms not the biggest but well appointed. Great location for all the sights. We found the staff and service excellent. Used the roof terrace every day for afternoon drink and evening nightcap. Due to fly back Friday night at 21:30, flight cancelled at 01:00 on Saturday morning, quick call to hotel got us last room. Met by night receptionist at 02:00, she was great and really perked us up considering how fed up we were. Would have no hesitation in going back or recommending. Keith Moore, Spalding, Lincs

Reviews.Title: “Sun terrace and jacuzzi not always available”
Reviews.Author: lindasmile
Reviews.Content: My husbsand and myself stayed at this hotel in Sept 10 having seen it when we stayed next door at the Grande Central 2 years ago. We were told by some friends of ours that a sun terrace and Jacuzzi were being built and according to the brochure looked amazing. Everything about the hotel was lovely, the service the area the rooms even the one I requested was offered. Champagne on arrival. However, when we arrived, as we always do we felt like a freshen up and cool down and a trip to the roof terrace was favourite as the jacuzzi on the brochure looked very inviting. We caught the lift to the 10th floor and was met with a barrier and a sign saying private party. According to the hotel the only time the terrace/ jacuzzi was available was if it hadn't been hired out. There was a wedding on that day so it was out of bounds. Also if you wanted, you could rent the jacuzzi for 2 hours at a time at a charge of 69 euros inclusive of massage and tropical fruit. Whilst this happened yet again it could not be used. Most days this happened and we ended up using the jacuzzi only between 10am and 1pm. Other days the terrace would be hired for business lunches and private parties and that ws out of bounds too. This is not mentioned and i think very greedy. They would make just as much money at the terrace bar if it was used by the guests at any time. Other than that we had a fab hol. But i would not return. Grande Central next door has an extended area for bathing and a pool for only the guests. Would recommend if you weren't bothered about the terrace etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: 311visit
Reviews.Content: We recently spent part of our honeymoon at the H10 Montcada. There couldn't be a better location in Barcelona. Right on the edge of La Ribera and El Born and the Barri Gotic most of the places to visit are right there. For those that aren't, the Jaume I metro is across the street which was fantastic. The street is noisy, and the metro does rumble below all night, but this didn't bother us at all. The rooftop bar is great, but expensive. We had two incidents with problems with out in room safe, (this was of no fault of the hotel)...each time within minutes a service person was at our room to fix it. Great staff!

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad but Not great”
Reviews.Author: Cken470
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is in a great location of Borne, and near all the bars, restaurants and shops. Very close to the beach and harbor as well. From a location point of view, perfect! A lot less touristy, and more hip then the La Rambles area. Plenty going on in the area, felt safe. The hotel room was quiet, no noise from the street, which was a plus.The staff was very friendly and helpful as well. The room (standard room) was very small, and the beds were horribly hard. I am all for firm mattresses but i really had trouble sleeping comfortably. Bathroom was nice, room clean all the amenities you need. We had free wifi in the room, which was excellent! Breakfast was over priced, but there was a coffee cafe across the street we went to every morning, with affordable options. The roof deck lounge was very nice, views were amazing. Disappointed there was no pool. And the hot tub, that appears on the site must be reserved in advanced, and at a high price. I also felt that the room rate was a bit expensive, for the size and comfortably of the bed (so uncomfortable). But the location was the incentive's for me. It all depends on what is important to you.

Reviews.Title: “Best Stay of Our Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: angrycmx
Reviews.Content: Best front desk staff that I have ever encountered, very helpful. This is a great hotel in an interesting part of the city. It has good rooms and services and as mentioned above, an excellent front office staff.

Reviews.Title: “Barcelona - Go, H10 - stay there!”
Reviews.Author: cevans65
Reviews.Content: Barcelona – 1st of all the best advice is GO as you will have a great time. The H10 Montcada is a fantastic hotel in a perfect location with great views and is away from the noise of las Ramblas, (full of hostels and 2am clubs) but just a 10 min speed walk or 30 min amble along the winding passages browsing in all the shops. It is also just a few mins from Placa de Catalunya which is very much a central point for which to either go down La Ramblas or any other street. The negative comments about the room sizes in some reviews is unfair and just inexperienced, although only seeing 1 room of course. It is a central city hotel and having done a cpl of Euro trips and New York these are all of a similar size. This also goes for the subway noise, you can bearly hear it and certainly don't view it as a bad comment about this hotel, it is less than having your washing machine on when you are in bed and we all sleep through that. My girlfiend didnt even notice it and she reads before sleep. The hotel and room was v modern, well air conditioned and the staff helpful when asked about trip recommendations etc. We got offered a drink on arrival and the breakfast, which we got included, was great with a buffet type selection inc full English and fantastic pastries. As for the roof top lounge/ bar – this is a big bonus! It must be 1 of only a cpl of hotels with a rooftop and the views are panoramic across the city and you can spend a fantastic night watching the sun go down sipping cocktails or having a beer. We went on a bus tour of the city and to the places you cannot walk to and this inc the La Sagrada Famililia, Parc Guell and the Nou Camp stadium. You can hope on and off as you want and the main ‘starting points’ inc buying tickets is Place de Catalunya. Overall the city is not as expensive as expected and cities such as Rome and Paris and is generally on par with pricing levels the UK. The streets are full of little local shops as well as big high street names and every time we went out we walked a different way. I would also recommend this for food and drink as everything other than on La Ramblas is as you would pay here on which ever level. We read about the pickpockets and bag snatchers on here and in the guide books and have not seen it mentioned as much about any other city. That said, there was plenty of police about (more than you see on the UK streets) and we didn’t experience, see or hear of anything. Bottom line is don’t be put off or think you need to wear protective clothing but just use common sense. Don’t put your bags on spare chairs or the floor in crowds, don’t wave your money about and in crowds just put your hands on your bag or in pockets – simple. In summary – Go and I def recommend the H10 montcada!

Reviews.Title: “couldnt ask for better”
Reviews.Author: dodimac
Reviews.Content: from the moment we arrived the staff were really great. the rooms were comfy and well air conditioned. bit of noise from the metro but bearable. great location very central to beach , la ramblas, zoo, aqu, harbour and in middle of quotic area. really liked the rooftop lounge and spent most nights there. all in all a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, attentive staff in good location”
Reviews.Author: rodneyebird
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the hotel, for a 2 night stay, to a glass of cava. Well located, near Metro, Sites and Nightlife. Breakfast was good and the rooftop bar gives wonderful views. Stayed as part of a 'romance' package.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Jimmy069
Reviews.Content: As I had already booked for a four night stay when I read the previous couple of poor reviews, I was concerned. However my fears were unfounded. This is an excellent hotel very well located. La Ramblas, the port area and the Place de Catalunya are all only about a 15 minute stroll away and there is a Metro station across the road, which we used as it is cheap, air conditioned, fast and has a frequent service. Our room was very comfortable, quiet and the aircon worked well which was very important in July. Two LCD TV's with over 80 channels of choice. The breakfast buffet has a good selection and much better than most hotels I have stayed at. The staff were all pleasant and polite. We never witnessed any security issues, but there was a highly visible police presence on the Ramblas. Lots and lots of places to eat. So much to do in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for overnight stay before a cruise”
Reviews.Author: solwaydooker
Reviews.Content: Do not worry about the review which suggests Barcelona is one big crime scene. We had absolutely no problem - but of course we have heard all the dos and donts. If we worried about crime we would go nowhere in the world. Welcome at the hotel was spot on, nice young lad who spoke good English and was very helpful with advice about local area. Las Rambelas is overrated, but elsewhere Barcelona is beautiful, particularly around the cathedral area; there were a couple of flamenco guitarists playing in a side street by the cathedral and we bought a CD for 10euros, CD inside looked like a blank, with no name so the wife felt we had been conned, but no - it's now on my itunes! Notice another reviewer recommends Qins Nites, but it is the worst restaurant! We had a terrible meal and two young Norwegian lads on table next to us complained about inedible paella. Breakfast good. Room was a bit small and basic, but we were en route to a cruise ship, so didn't want much. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “NOT a 4 star hotel......but if you can get a cheap rate consider as an option”
Reviews.Author: allyo065
Reviews.Content: Hotel H10 Montcada is not a four star hotel, our room was very tiny and the bed and pillows were terribly uncomfortable, we both woke up aching all over. The rooftop bar has a pretty view but it closes at 11. The one good thing about the hotel is the location. The hotel staff downstairs is a bit clueless, when we asked for a local laundromat one of the staff gave us a map and circled the street where it was supposed to be located - not there, we had to walk into another hotel which pointed us into the right direction. Another "mishap" happened when we rented a car for a day, two front desk employees told us that we can just drop it off in front of the hotel and the car rental employee would come pick it up. Upon our return once we dropped off the car another front desk employee told us it couldn't be left there and if it were to get a ticket or be towed it would be our responsibility so we found ourselves driving around forever in a middle of a busy city trying to find parking for it.......and the rental service didn't end up picking it up until midnight!!!! Also the breakfast buffet is not the best but ok if you get it included with your stay, I wouldn't have paid $15 or even $10 euro for it. A lot of items looked and tasted very stale, and the bread wasn't always fresh either. I guess the bottom line is stay there but only if you can get a very cheap rate.....otherwise its not worth it......

Reviews.Title: “Okish”
Reviews.Author: sloopy1234
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for 9 nights for our honeymoon, I actually though it wasn't a bad hotel but it wasn't great either, what sold it for us was the hotel roof bar which had amazing views but limited sunbeds, it shut around 11pm and you had to pay a fortune to use the jaccizzi 50 euros! The location is perfect everything is within walking distance and the metro is outside. Luckily we requested a room at the top which has a window overlooking the street they are bigger rooms and the noise of the metro isnt too bad so do request 7th or 8th floor! I must say when we walked into the room we were a bit disapointed as it is very basic, no luxuries at all and a very hard bed, the bathroom was ok not a bad size and bigger than on the lower floors, I hate so sound like i am spoilt or moaning but I have stayed in better hotels that were less expensive including in Barcelona. don't get me wrong it is not terrible but just lacks any kind of personal touch or comfort, we would choose a different hotel next time but in the same area. oh and we ordered food on the roof and it was horrid, we had pita bread which hadn't been warmed up and a ceasar salad the chicken was so dry we couldn't eat it and it didn't even have any dressing on it, there are a lot of very good cafes resaturants and bars to eat in so don't eat at this hotel you will be dissapointed. if you have already booked to stay here don't worry it's ok, and the whole of amazing Barcelona is on the doorstep. good places to eat ate a bar calle Shilling very fresh lovely food and cheap Quinz nits you have to queue but well worth it 30 euros with drinks for 2 people and lots of great food lovely tappas at the marina in the top pf the shopping centre great cafe and resturant on the top floor of the main department store opposite the sq with the fountains its called el court englaise (amazing view)

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Debs08
Reviews.Content: l stayed for two nights in this hotel last week to celebrate my wedding anniversary. This is my fourth visit. The hotel is perfectly situated within walking distance to the beach, bars, restaurants and many more attractions. The hotel staff could not be more helpful and are always willing to assist with a smile on their face. Little added touches like fresh flowers in the bathroom and sweets set by your bedside add to the enjoyment of your visit. The buffet breakfast is excellant with something to suit everyone. Great choice of hot food, cereals, juice, fresh fruit, breads etc. One word of warning .. hold on tight to your handbag, wallet etc. A favourite spot for thieves is around the Gothic Cathedral anytime after 10.30 in the morning when the bus tours come in. This visit we heard of three people who had bags stolen. One girl had set her bag on the ground while her friend too a photo. In seconds the bag disappeared - thats how quick it can happen. Other than that Barcelona is a wonderful city to visit and the H10 Montcada a great choice of hotel for your holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for exploring Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Hamster_9
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Montcada for my mums birthday. I had read the reviews about the metro station and asked to be put on a high floor. The hotel accomodated this. On arrival we were given a glass of Cava and the staff were lovely and spoke excellent english which is unusual for barcelona. The metro never caused us a problem however my mum heard it but only on the Saturday night. There is a degree of traffic noise but not enough to disturb and the hotel is situated bang in the middle of the gothic area about a five minute walk from the marina and is excellently placed so the trade off is the traffic noise. This though does not disturb. The breakfasts were absolutely excellent every type of juice and cereal. cake, english, spanish tapas, cold meats, smoked salmon and even cava, white and rose wine and vodka to make a bloody mary. Would recommend this hotel and would definitely use again. It is brilliantly located to explore this city. I note the review about street crime.There are petty theives and criminals in all cities its about being aware and not carrying your handbag in one hand on the road and leaving your wallet in your back pocket. This is a cracking hotel and cracking city and would defitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a city break”
Reviews.Author: CarolD56
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for three nights on our first trip to Barcelona. Everything was perfect from beginning to end and the service was first class. There was plenty of choice for breakfast and it was well presented.. The location is ideal for exploring the city and right by a metro station. I would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable hotel with helpful and enthusiastic staff”
Reviews.Author: FudgeUk
Reviews.Content: Excellent service from an enthusiastic and professional staff. A small but confortable room decorated in a contemporary style, the powerful shower certainly woke me up in the morning. Situated In the gothic centre, a five minute walk to the marina and one minute away from the Turistic sight seeing bus stop. The hotel has a gym/spar and roof top bar not used by this customer. Well worth taking the bed and breakfast option as the choice at the breakfast buffet was incredible. The dinner menue was pleasant but limited and should be expanded to plug the only weakness that this venue has.

Reviews.Title: “Worst deal ever-was very dissapointed with everything!”
Reviews.Author: CorkKeepmovin
Reviews.Content: I was so surprised how bad this hotel was. i arrived late on the sunday night to be told that a reservation number was not good enough to go away and print off my email stating this, okay could have been my fault should have done this, but went to anotehr hotel in barcelona two days later again with only the reservation number and was accomodated immediately. I was given my room number which was on the first floor, i had asked for a view when booking and boy was i not only not given a view but it was possibly one of the most depressing rooms i have ever stayed in, like a box u could hardly get around the bed and the bathroom door wouldn;t even open fully as there was no room for it to go back by the wall the whole way, the sink was literally at the bathroom door. i booked H10 because of their website, i was thinking barcelona centre(~it's true the location cannot be faulted), with a jacuzzi (another joke this would have cost me 69 euros for half an hour even though there is no mention of paying on the interenet, i made sure of this). I rang and said i was not happy with the room and she said these are our standard rooms and we tried to give you a view, i said a view of what all i could see when i looked out was a black alleyway that was so so noisy at night, but this really didn;t bother me since i am a heavy sleeper anyway. overall i paid 200 euros for 2 nights and thought even if there wasn't access to jacuzzi (i can get over that) that i would for this price get a nice room, would really not recommend this to anyone. went to the cristal palace on the wednesday after getting out of this place, and that was fabulous, central huge room, luxury in comparision and for way less money. i warned you and believe me i really am not difficult!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a good location.”
Reviews.Author: SunFreak
Reviews.Content: We chose the Montcada on the strength of Tripadvisor reviews and the hotel's location. It is just a few minutes walk from where the airport bus stops in Placa Catalunya and on the edge of the Barri Gotico. The hotel is modern and very pleasant. Reception was efficient and gave us a room on the 7th floor. If we concentrated, we could only just notice the Metro. The room was small but perfectly acceptable. If you don't like a hard mattress, request a mattress topper before you go - we got one but they are in short supply - it makes all the difference The shower was powerful and the water hot; maid service very efficient. Breakfast was good, with a fair choice of hot and cold food - great fried eggs! Quite funny to hear and feel the rumble of the Metro, We liked the bar, it was friendly and the drinks were reasonable, although we did spend quite a few euros in 'Molly's Fair City', an Irish bar on Calle de Ferran. Being near to the Metro is great for reaching all the sights and moving from from one line to another is simple. We bought a T-10 card for ease and value. We'd recommend 'Sinatra's',( tucked away on Carrier Heures, just off Calle de Ferran and near Placa Reial) for a delicious modern take on Tapas. Regarding safety, I think it's a question of being 'street wise'. I took an inconspicuous bag which I could wear across the body and kept the contents to a minimum. Walk with confidence and don't go down dimly lit side streets at night, You wouldn't do that in your home city/town so why change your behaviour in a new city? Barcelona is an amazing, vibrant city. Park Guell and Casa Mila/La Pedrera are fantastic. We did think some of the entrance fees were a bit steep, but that's the Euro today. We went into Sagrada Familia (again) but really, you can see enough from outside. Inside the renovations are interesting but I rather think Gaudi would have been horrified to see them.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money at the Montcada”
Reviews.Author: margles51
Reviews.Content: This was a very good hotel that I would recommend to anyone. Some reviewers have referred to the noise from the subway, but although we were on the 2nd floor we never heard it. We had smallish side rooms - overlooking a building site, but we weren't there for the view and we had got a cheap deal so did not expect the top rooms! The staff were all very friendly and went out of their way to help or make a fuss of us. The bar was nice and frioendly, the breakfasts were excellent value, although the room got a bit hot when crowded. The tea tasted awful due to the hot water machine needing a good clean. Not wonderful TV channels but that was not a problem. The central location was really a big selling point. Be careful - we knew the reputation Barcelona has for pickpockets, but my friend got her purse stolen the day we arrived, thanks to a clever distraction ruse.

Reviews.Title: “My husband is still complaining he didn't get to come!”
Reviews.Author: MFarnborough
Reviews.Content: Blissful 3 night stay on an away break with my sister. It took us a while to crack the central heating/aircon controls but otherwise bliss. Professional friendly staff, great breakfasts - though bit worried about the bottle of vodka in the ice bucket, but didn't encounter any Russians. Brilliant location - the city's noises did not worry us in the least but we had a seventh floor room. But this is a city centre. We both decided to go back - and take the husbands this time. Highlight of the trip has to be the amazing political protest against raising the retirement age to 67. It was assembled on the Via Laietiana at sunset. Must have been about 10,00 people and they only needed about 10 policemen and 5 cars to steward the lot. We'd wondered why the bus we were travelling on earlier suddenly filled up with all these people older than us. We even recognised some of them on the march. The hotel staff were great at explaining what was going on.

Reviews.Title: “Smart refurb”
Reviews.Author: RJKBrussels
Reviews.Content: Well located hotel on the edge of the gothic quarter (opposite side to Ramblas). The hotel is clean and efficient, rooms comfortable and quiet, with flat screen TV and good bathroom facilities (didn't like sealed windows however, a reminder of the local street crime epidemic). Welcome drink was appreciated as was rooftop terrace bar and gym. Would certainly revisit.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but beware of muggers and pickpockets!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Gracelynn55
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, rooms clean but in need of attention eg lamps hanging off the walls and wood floor needing fixing! A large bathroom with lovely marble tiling, bidet and bath with shower over, very good indeed. Air conditioned rooms with safe (essential in this city). Nice comfy beds with blissful pillows. We opted for the buffet breakfast and it was very good. On the down side, the hotel is right on a busy main road and there's lots of traffic noise. Sirens going on and off all night long, also note the rumbling of the Metro trains which run underneath the hotel. Most importantly, do not take any handbag out with you as muggings and pickpockets are an absolute nightmare. We were mugged on our first night right outside the hotel and no-one even batted an eyelid nor did they offer any help. Barcelona is a dangerous place and we witnessed another 3 muggings whilst there. We also saw a body being removed from the Port Vell dock area. I will never return to the city as I can only describe it as a cesspit of crime. BEWARE!

Reviews.Title: “Love, love, love H10 Montcada Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: travelnalong
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right in the center of historical Barcelona. Our room was very clean and the staff was outstanding. We stayed at H10 two nights before and 2 nights after our cruise. We arrived at the hotel before regular check-in and they got the housekeeper to stop what she was doing and prepare a room for us. We were on the7th floor corner room and had a terrific view of Barcelona. The rooftop terrace is breathtaking. I look forward to going back this summer. Be careful of pick-pocketers. The only negative thing I can say about this hotel was that the hot tub wasn't hot. Five stars*****

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, great value for money”
Reviews.Author: Fi_26
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a short break to Barcelona with my husband. First impressions were great - quick check-in, with a glass of cava to welcome us. Our room was on the 4th floor, looking out onto a side street (not a great view, but we didn't come here to look out the window) and was pretty quiet. Room was relatively small, although the bathroom was lovely with a large walk-in shower. There was a flatscreen TV with some English channels and a minibar, and the decor was contemporary. Only downside was the rock-hard bed - however it didn't annoy me enough to request a room change. There is a roof-top jacuzzi and bar, although these were closed when we visited - there were some pretty strong winds while we were there, which is probably why. The bar on the ground floor sells a small selection of food, bar snacks and drinks, all very reasonably priced. In terms of location, it doesn't get much better. We were approximately 10 minutes walk from Las Ramblas, right on the edge of the Gothic Quarter. There were shops, bars and restaurants all around, although it didn't get noisy at night (we were there over a weekend). We flew into Girona, and took the air coach into the coach station, picking up a taxi to our hotel - all very quick, easy and cheap. Would definately stay here again, and would recommend the small tapas restaurant just across the road from the front door, next to the subway station.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE. The rudest staff you will ever meet.”
Reviews.Author: crazyb44
Reviews.Content: The hotel was ok but the staff on reception were the most arrogant unhelpful staff I have ever met, which is a shame as it was our first trip to Barcelona and this experience has given us a very bad taste in our mouths. Its a great shame when you go to a nice city and have it spoilt by rude and arrogant staff. Do not expect customer service as you wont get it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, perfect for a weekend away”
Reviews.Author: purps81
Reviews.Content: We went to Barcelona for a long weekend as a surprise birthday treat for my husband. This hotel was perfect for it. We arrived about 11ish but couldnt check in till just gone 3 which was a pain but they took our bags and we went for a wander. Its 10 mins from Las Ramblas, 5 mins from cathedral and lots of eating places round the area. Subway is literally across the road. Our room was on 6th floor and very clean and cosy with a fairly good sized bathroom. All very modern. You can hear and feel the subway but being on the 6 floor it didnt really bother us too much. There is noise from the front street but we didnt find it a problem. The breakfast buffet was delicious with lots of choices from fruit, yoghurts, pastries, meats, cheese and the english breakfast too. We had a free massage each with the deal that we got and I have to say it was one of the nicest I've ever had, so good I booked another! We didnt make it up to the jacuzzi and sun lounge bar as it was raining all weekend. The bar downstairs was a bit slow at times but a good chilled out feel either for a drink before going out or as a nightcap. The reception staff were always very helpful. We went to see a Barcelona match on the saturday and definately get the subway there as its cheap and easy to follow. We got a taxi back from the ground as the queue was huge to get into the subway, this cost about 12 Euros. We also did a tour of the Nou Camp and incorporated a hop on and off tour bus into this as this stops right outside the camp. The tour is a must, very impressive - 17 euros. The taxi from the airport and back cost us about 30-35 euros each time. All in all a very good weekend and we would love to go back sometime.

Reviews.Title: “Location was everything”
Reviews.Author: rider1129
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel was its greatest asset as it was right at the heart of the Gothic Quarter and next to a good half dozen good inexpensive restaurants, a five minute walk down to the beach, and right next to the metro. There were always complementary apples and champagne out for us after a day of touring that were a nice touch. The rooftop terrace provided one of the best views of the city. The room was pretty small and left little room to maneuver, but there's no reason to spend a huge amount of time there. It took us quite a bit of time to get checked in even though everything seemed to be in order. But other than those slight qualms everything was great.

Reviews.Title: “Fantasic Hotel in a Fantastic City!”
Reviews.Author: emmabliz
Reviews.Content: Had a fantastic 3 night stay here Jan 2010. Upon arrival they checked us in at midday and didnt have to wait, glass of champaigne on arrival was a nice touch.The rooms are quite small but clean and modern and everything you need for a short stay. The only issue we had with the room is as our room was facing the front (which has a nice view of a catherdral) however it is on a main and busy street so you can here the road noise even on our floor (2nd), were quite heavy sleepers so didnt bother us too much, it just got annoying at times wen u cant hear the TV. The hotel staff are fantastic, so helpful and they really go out of their way for you, giving us directions,booking us taxi's etc.The breakfast is also fab,lots of choice to cater for all needs.The hotels location is ideal..a stone throw away from all the major sights..couldent of picked a better spot!Overall we had a fantastic few days and the city is magical.

Reviews.Title: “Good all Rounder”
Reviews.Author: Lyndamuller
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a perfect place for all of the touristy things that need to be done. 10 minutes walk to la Rambla, 5 minutes walk to Picasso Museum and a metro station about 1 minutes walk. The hotel staff were welcoming, but a little slow at times. Champagne and all you can eat continental breakfasts - very good selection of hot and cold foods. The coffee out of the machine isn't the best, lucky for the Nescafe sachets provided as well. Our room was a twin room (708), was small but you don't go to Barcelona to stay in your hotel room. The room itself was very clean and serviced every day. Didn't manage to check out the hot tub on the sun deck as too cold. The sun deck has good views of Barcelona and the beach. All in all a good all rounder hotel. If you have breakfast included in your package, make the most of it as it will keep you going all day, so you can make the most of the sights.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: bluebird1000
Reviews.Content: If you are interested in 'absorbing' the Gothic Quarter, this hotel is clean, friendly and the location can't be beat. The rooms are typical European small size but the bathroom was large and modern. You're just a short stroll away from many interesting places and the most fun is to wander down the interesting streets of the quarter. The main problem we faced was arrival about 8:30 am and our room was not ready until about 4 pm, seems they only had one maid on duty (but 4-5 working behind the desk). Another bother was our adapter plug in for the laptop worked only in the bathroom outlet and not in the bedroom. Pretty inconvenient but they do have the two computers in the lobby which are for guests. The breakfast is huge and you can fill up on a variety of eggs, meats, pastries, fruits, juice and more. The area is in easy walking distance to the Ramblas and many attractions and the metro stop is just across the street. There are great rooftop views from the terrace. I am anxious to return to Barca; if you are looking for a modern, clean centrally located hotel in this exciting Spanish city, the H10 Montacada is great.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel - Service was amazing & suite was massive”
Reviews.Author: a_little_precious
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here early in December and this has to be one of the best hotels we have stayed at. We arrived a little earlier and was told to come back later but then our room was not ready, The manager immediately upgraded us to a suite which which was huge - so no complaints from us over the minor debacle. PROS Large clean modern rooms Massive bathrooms Flat screen TVs Close to lots of eateries Great service Complimentary cocktail on arrive Very modern hotel Comfortable big beds CONS None. Perfect stay.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay there again”
Reviews.Author: PurpleRaye
Reviews.Content: I had to write a review about this hotel as it was a pleasurable experience. The location was within walking distance of many points of attractions, across the street from a subway stop, clean and eco -friendly. A friend and I went to Barcelona to celebrate our birthdays and the staff provided us with complimentary champagne. The staff was very knowledgeable about the attractions and very friendly. There were also 2 computers that we could use to check email and surf the web which came in handy since we were suffering from jet lag at 4 am. Oh- and there was a bidet! the only negative would be the hard bed that made me think this is what an army cot feels like. All in all, I highly recommend this hotel as it was everything you need for a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Well located, Modern, Cool Terrace Jacuzzi, BUT Poor Service and Uncomfortable Beds”
Reviews.Author: DashaNova
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for my long weekend trip with my partner to Barcelona. I was attracted by the outdoor jacuzzi on the hotel terrace with a great view of the city. It is also very well located in a walking distance from most of the major central sites. The jacuzzi was free to use before 1pm and the views were indeed fantastic, though the advertised 30C water was at least 10 degrees colder. The free welcome champagne was a nice start of the trip, but this is where a good service stopped being good. In the middle of the stay we were asked to pay for the stay. When we asked why, it was explained that they had a few cases of fraudulent card payments and it's their standard procedure now. To tell the truth it felt a little bit like if they were calling us theives. I wouldn't mind paying at the check-in, if they had bad experiences in the past. But the fact it happened in the middle of the stay suggests that first they thought us reliable and then changed their mind. Also the invoice had wrong tax figures, but they couldn't explain why. The hotel itself was quite nice and modern. The bathroom was full of useful things like shaving kits and toothbrush with mini toothpaste, which is rarely available free of charge. The room was of a nice size as well. But they had one of the most uncomfortable beds I've ever slept in. To cut it short, if you you are not a fussy sleeper and don't mind very average service, go for it. However if this sort of things are important to you, avoid the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value hotel in very central location”
Reviews.Author: RichardCK
Reviews.Content: Booked via Travelocity, we had three nights' bed & breakfast, with champagne on arrival, plus a further bottle of champagne and strawberries included in the price (around £80 per night for the room). The reception staff were friendly, and nobody pushed for a tip or tried to wrestle our luggage away from us when we arrived. The room was clean and modern, with bath, shower, toilet and bidet facilities, and a well-stocked minibar. Spa facilites also included a jacuzzi on the roof terrace, with commanding views of Tibidabo, the cathedrals and the coast. Breakfast included choices of continental, cooked, cereals, fruit... in fact, the largest choice I have seen in a similar-standard of hotel. The only slight downside was the beds - two small twins which made up a medium-sized double when pushed together (and with the brakes on!). However, this is only a minor observation and would not put us off from staying again. (After all, when you're spending a good 12+ hours wandering around Barcelona in the warm December sunshine, you'll be asleep when your head hits the pillow anyway!) All in all, a great little hotel, and we would recommend this to everyone and anyone who wanted to stay in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: suncolour
Reviews.Content: This hotel is on good location and has clean room. The best thing is friendly staff who went extra mile for our comfort.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic customer service”
Reviews.Author: TeriBucks
Reviews.Content: From the moment we walked in until they collected our bags for departure, we were given a first rate service by everyone.The rooms on 7th and 8th floor were spotless,the breakfast plentiful and tasty and the friendliness of the staff better than seen in a long time-will definitely be returning.The hotel is central to everything-metro, tour bus and harbour.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - but could do better”
Reviews.Author: pjohnson101
Reviews.Content: When we checked in, I was told that we had a twin room despite stating I wanted a double when booking. They told me that if you want a guaranteed double bed then you need to ask for Matrimonial. Also, the heating didn't work in our room and it was like a fridge - they offered us blankets... suprisingly I declined and went for the room change! Apart from that the hotel is in a great location, but above the subway. So it does rattle a fair bit every time a train passes under - and we were on the 7th floor. Would I stay here again? probably not, but I'd try one very close as it is just where you need to be.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Zanterocks
Reviews.Content: Location is perfect, 10 mins to Marina, 15 mins to beach, across the road from metro stop, 5 mins to Born area. Hotel, clean, smart, friendly staff, room is small but wasn't in it a lot. Tip, ask for a higher floor as we were on 1st and could hear the rumble of the metro and the street noise - which you wouldn't hear if you were higher. If I went back to Barcelona I would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Small hotel,great location,super breakfast, nice bathroom but tiny room,”
Reviews.Author: Megan0001
Reviews.Content: First visit to Barcelona booked B and B at this Hotel for 3 night city break basically due to its location. Positives are - easy walking distance to La Rambla, to the Cathedrals, to the Port and the numerous cafes and restaurants, hotel buffet breakfast here is superb, bathroom lovely,roof top views amazing. Disappointments are - hotel is very small, probably not 4 *, the bar and seating area just inside the main entrance are just ok, small restaurant is in basement no windows, we could hear the rumbling of the underground metro up on floor 4....but main disappointment was our room 407, it was tiny, no view,one locked window which looked out into a small central courtyard (actually this is a covered light well to provide limited natural light into all rooms ending in 07 as they are boxed in ), room was so stuffy , air con not working , the fan worked but so loud, bed hard and no tea/coffee in room . Barcelona is fabulous - the Montcada was ok for the price ...be prepared as there are other hotels in this great location.

Reviews.Title: “Thoroughly enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: Kokomonkey
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel from the generous breakfasts to the roof top bar with views of the cathedral, mountains and sea. All the staff were helpful and the room was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, location, amenities. Warm and fuzzy feel.”
Reviews.Author: aa442u
Reviews.Content: Loved this place. Other having a room above the street and subway which could get noisy at times, I really enjoyed this hotel. The women staff members were all really nice and helpful (no men?). Anytime we had a question, they were right on it. Champagne, newspaper, apples, all free at front desk. Rooms nicely decorated with internet access in lobby. Terrific buffet breakfast with wait staff to help. Location can't be beat - near restaurants, tour bus, attractions - all without being tacky.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: kjvaca
Reviews.Content: We had a great 4-night stay at the H10 Montcada. Room 801 had a nice view, was clean and comfy and had a huge bathroom. Front desk staff spoke english (as well as several other languages) were friendly and helpful. We did not eat at the restaurant or use the jacuzzi (it was too cold) but the rooftop was nice. The best part about the hotel was the location! Could not have been more central or convenient. We like to walk so we walked most places (Las Ramblas, museums, beach, etc.) but it was right across the street from a metro stop so it was easy to get to the attractions that were farther away. We loved just wandering the narrow streets and getting lost in the experience. When we got tired we just walked back to the hotel, took a nap and headed back out again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, few annoyances, some rooms like a prison cell!”
Reviews.Author: mattaimes
Reviews.Content: First off, you cannot beat the location of this hotel. Close to La Rambla but far enough away so it's not right in your face, this hotel is situated right between El Born and the Gothic Quarter - the two best bits of Barcelona - with the beach a 15 minute walk away. The hotel itself is obviously of a good standard... cava on arrival, very polite staff, everything immaculately clean. However, the room we were given (607) was an internal-facing room - there's one on each floor (all probably x07's) facing into a dim outside space between the corridors. I was expecting a small room but this one literally had enough room for the bed, with almost no natural light - it really was like a cell. So for the first time ever, I asked to be moved, which they did the next day, and the new room faced over the main road and, although small, was perfectly nice. Windows are locked shut and keep out the road noise - but we like a bit of noise and prefer fresh air, so they lent us the window key without any queries. The rooftop terrace is lovely, but the bar only opens 4.30-10.30, and they close the whole thing after that so you can't even sit out and enjoy some night air which is a shame. The Jacuzzi is free until 1.30, but we stayed in much after that on one day as there was no-one up there to tell us otherwise! (just remove the rope they block it off with!!) Our tip is if you want a relaxing couple of hours is to buy some drinks from the supermarket nearby, stick them in the fridge in the gym just off the terrace, and have a thoroughly nice (and cheap!) few hours in the sun! Wouldn't recommend food, massage, romantic packages etc - all appear overpriced (£79 euro for a jacuzzi, massage and a bit of tapas). Drinks are expensive (8e) but not a million miles off all the other tourist traps - I would suggest looking for happy hours and the small 'local' bars.

Reviews.Title: “great location, hotel needs a bit of attention”
Reviews.Author: min-dol
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights for my birthday and while the location is fantastic, the hotel needs a bit of work. The gothic quarter is accross the street so you dont need to go very far for the most charming section of the city. The rooms are tiny but to be expected in Europe. However the tiny beds have to be the worst we have ever slept in. They are so hard and they roll and everytime you move. The rooftop bar is very nice to relax at after a day of touring, but the prices are ridiculous. While we were there the hotel did lower the price for breakfast to 10 euros (previously 15 euros) and it is a great selection of food. So you just have to decide whats important to you, and then make your selection. Barcelona is a fun,beautiful city. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: chrismhYorkshire
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our silver wedding anniversary and found the hotel to be in a great location for everything and the staff were extremely helpful. the hotel has a lovely rooftop terrace with a jacuzzi you can book privately which is lovely weather permitting. We were very happy with our stay here and would recommend the hotel particularly after hearing other visitors complaining about their hotels.I think barcelona is an expensive city to visit so do not expect great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great location; good hotel”
Reviews.Author: jn52
Reviews.Content: this hotel was in a great location next to museums and cathedral; gothic quarter. thought hotel would be a little more trendy than it was. rooms were good size; bathroom spacious. air conditioning had a hard time keeping up but it was hot and room faced west in the afternoon. all in all above average, but not fantastic. booked through a travel agent and appeared to have paid more than internet price for rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Very Comforting!!”
Reviews.Author: n87
Reviews.Content: We arrived early morning and our room wasn't ready yet but we were presented with very friendly and comforting service from the front desk. They served us champagne and let us relax while we waited for our room to be ready. The room was very small but clean and tidy. Bathroom was of a decent size and they gave us lots of ammenities. It was great for a short stay. The hotel had a beautiful roof top terrace with a bar that overlooked the city of Barcelona. The position was great, very close to the main shops and not too far from the beach (approx 15min walk).

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel - shame about overbooking practice”
Reviews.Author: MaldonDW
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for a 3 night stay in Sept. 2009 because of it's great location. The booking was made in Jan. 2009 so you can imagine our annoyance when we were told the first night would have to be spent in another hotel (in an area we did not want to be) because of an electrical fault with our room. I did not believe this excuse and on arrival at the replacement hotel they confirmed that the reason we were moved was due to overbooking. You can imagine my frustration! This spoilt an otherwise great stay. On the plus side the majority of the staff were very helpful and the location (eventually) was perfect for a short stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wowee! Just perfect for location, style and Relaxation”
Reviews.Author: sazzle23
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just come back from a wonderful City Break to Barcelona for our 10th Wedding Anniversary. I wanted to make sure that this would be a great hotel not only for the location but also for the quality of our accommodation. We arrived late.. midnight, and was given a galss of cool Cava! Ummm good start. The receptionist adivsed of the bars to go to that night and where not to venture in the middle of the night! Our room 611 was very nice, it was more like a suite with a separate area with armchairs and a table, The bathroom was very roomy and exquisitley clean with bath and shower and a bidet! Huge mirrors everywhere! The bedroom area was small but perfectly formed. It wasnt til the morning that we realised we had views over to the Sagrada Familia church and beyond. Fantastic. Breakfast was wonderful with too much choice even for a fussy puss like myself... hot and cold buffet and sumptuous cakes. 6 different juices and loads of cereal! Need i go on! The days were spent exploring all Barcelona has to offer, on foot by metro and even cable car! The evenings were spent relaxing at the 9th floor Sunset Bar which has a few sun loungers and a jacuzzi, we didint use them though. The views from up here are fantastic and very romantic! I cant wait to go back to the hotel or Barcelona! Our tip would be to eat like the locals at Tapas bars and try to steer away from the tourist traps where the prices are higher and pickpockets are around. One nearly got me but they have to get up earlier to catch me out!! Hope you find this reveiw helpful...... Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: vl59
Reviews.Content: We stays in H10 Montcada Hotel two nights. The room is basic according to standards of Spanish 4* hotels, but very clean and well equipped. The breakfast was great. The very especial thing of this hotel is the jacuzzi on the roof - very pleasant and with fantastic view. We paid for it, but it is important to know that each Monday it is free. The hotel is situated in heart of Gotic Quater of Barcelona and next to Metro station.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location - Amazing Roof terrace”
Reviews.Author: Bennybooy
Reviews.Content: We got this hotel as part of a package at lastminute.com, so were unsure as to how good the hotel would be, as it was such a good deal. The Hotel was excellent, its location is in the gothic district, very close to some lovely restaurants and bars. The hotel is opposite a metro station, about 200 yards down the road from a stop for the Hop on-Hop off tourist bus(recommended-but dont buy tickets in the hotel as they charge £4 for stuff you get free on the bus!!), so transport is very close indeed. However, we walked mosty of the time as the gothic area is the prettiest oldy-worldy bit. Las Ramblas is only a 5-10 min walk away, but after you have seen it once you wont want to go back, so you will be glad its a 5-10 min walk away. Museo Picasso is about a 5 min walk around the corner, but get there before 10, or you will queue for hours! The beaches are briliant, get there early as they do get busy, but its just 2 stops on the metro from the station right outside the hotel. If you come out of the hotel and turn right, up the road are a few nice looking italian restaurants very close by. However, its well worth a wander arond the gothic areas quaint bars and restaurants, as the meals are reasonably priced and taste great. Try not to eat on the beachfront, especially Opium, as the menu is limited and very expensive and service is not great at all. We went to 2 bars in the gothic area i would highly recoomend, MIlk and Shilling. Both serve very nice cocktails at a good price in lovely venues. The cocktails on the hotel roof terrace are nice, but pricey unless you go between 4-6pm, as thats their happy hour. Back to the hotel, The rooms are very modern, with good bathrooms. i recommend you get the buffet breakfast as it has everything and sets you up nicely for the day. The service was brilliant, the staff very friendly and bi lingual. There is free internet in the lounge, great views from the terrace and a welcoming blast of air con in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “very sympathic and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: dibakubu
Reviews.Content: I was surprised about this gread Hotel. Really, it was very comfortable, also with roof-terrasse with a great view. Only the street sounds are not so well, because its situated at a main road of Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location and some luxury with a few faults”
Reviews.Author: Jessibellissimo
Reviews.Content: We went to Barcelona to celebrate our engagement. So we purpously chose somewhere which we hoped would give us a bit of luxury at a reasonable price. When we arrived the girl at reception proceeded to give us a lecture on pick pockets in Barcelona and persuaded us to give our passports and valuables to be locked in the luggage cupboard. I know she was just trying to be helpful but it wasn't the most welcoming reception and made us very paranoid about our bags and wallets throughout the trip. As we had arrived early we were sent off to explore Barcelona and were very pleased to find out how easy it was to get around and how well our hotel was located with the bustly Ramblas 10 minutes walk away. When we returned we were given our room key and a glass of Cava each to take to our room, which was a lovely touch. Our room was really lovely and perfectly spacious enough for our needs. Unfortunately when i went to use the shower it started to overflow and seep into the bathroom. We called reception and they sent up a handy man promptly who unblocked the drains and cleaned up the bathroom. We were a bit fed up about this but we were pleased with the quick response, unfortunately no apology was offered. That evening we decided to eat at the Hotel. This was the most dissapointing meal of the trip. The food was not at all what was described on the menu it was pretty poor quality and tasteless. On another ocassion we ate some tapas at the bar and the food there was much better there. After dinner we took a trip up to the roof and it was truly gorgeous. The loungers were comfortable, and looking out over Barcelona at night was fabulous. We also returned here during the day and lounged in the sun. Unfortunately we never saw anyone manning the bar. The majority of staff were friendly and helpful with the odd grumpy exception. Overall we had a lovely trip but just felt let down that we did not get the total luxury we had hoped for at the hotel. The few small blips did not damage the holiday but i would not choose this hotel again as a luxury break.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, easy access to ths subway, highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: rmb1971
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Barcelona, my fiancee and I. We found the H10 very reasonable in price and very well located in order to bounce around and see the city. It's directly across from the Jaume subway station, which is quite easy to use and made our stay very nice. The staff is extremely friendly and helpful, as we were asking many questions and our Spanish speaking is somewhat limited. They all spoke English and were willing to guide us whenever we needed. The negatives we encountered were mainly that the price of breakfast in the hotel restuarant seems way high (15 Euros), especially when, depending on what you're looking for, you can venture to tons of close by cafes for lower prices. Also, the jacuzzi they advertise on the website is indeed gorgeous, but what they don't tell you is that the only way you can take advantage is if you book a "romance package," which is currently I think 69 Euros and gets you private use of the jacuzzi and drinks at the bar on the rooftop terrace. I just wanted to enjoy the jacuzzi, but what I found instead was that only one couple on 1 day of our 3-day stay ever even booked the package. The rest of the time, the jacuzzi was cordoned off. That, in my opinion, is really stupid!! Maybe that's how they do it in Europe, but we were highly disappointed; however, in no way did it ruin our stay. The only other word of advice I could offer is if you need a ride to the airport, there are plentiful taxis just outside the hotel at almost any hour of the day and night....seriously. We made the mistake of having the hotel get arrange a cab at 3:30 AM because we had a super early flight out. Big mistake. Although they told us the cab would be here 5 minutes early, we thought that was just their way of saying that's our guarantee. What they were really saying is the meter will start running 5 minutes early. That makes no damn sense, as we came down promptly at 3:30 AM and by the time we got our luggage into the trunk and began moving we noticed the meter was already at 8 Euros!! And although this isn't the hotel's fault, the cab driver was a complete [--] and literally kept stopping to explain why the meter was running. A trip that should've been probably 25 Euros ended up at 35 Euros. Either way, we felt that the hotel should've been more clear about when the meter starts. We were on time, and the truth is that we knew we could've walked right outside and gotten a taxi straightaway. We'd been out late a couple nights experiencing the nightlife, and cabs were very plentiful. I'd still highly recommend this hotel; just watch for those pitfalls.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, beautiful hotel, breathtaking roof terrace!”
Reviews.Author: MissHT
Reviews.Content: For our first holiday away together my boyfriend and I decided to have a week away in Barcelona. We didn't have a huge budget and mostly travel agents websites were coming up with 3 star hotels but the Montcada was amazing value! The location of the hotel is perfect. If you're catching the bus from the airport then it will drop you off at Placa de Catalunya. Walk down the shopping street Portal De l' Angel towards Placa Nova where the front of the old cathedral is, turn left and head towards a big road that is Via Laietana :) It's about a 10 min walk - maybe 15 if you're lugging cases and tired. Upon our arrival we were greeted with cava (spanish champagne) and were shown straight to our room. The hotel is modern, beautiful and very clean. The room is I suppose smaller than is usual in a 4 star hotel but we didn't have any problems. It was modern and there was a safe, a huge flat screen tv, lots of wardrobe space and a big marble bathroom with fresh flowers. Our room also overlooked the famous Santa Maria del Mar church. The service in the hotel was good - reception staff were happy to offer advice and the house keepers were happy to offer us more coat hangers. Like I mentioned earlier - the location of the hotel is wonderful - accross the road from a metro station means that all the sights - park guell, barceloneta, fc barcelona, joan miro foundation, sagrada familiar etc are accessable. Turn left out of the hotel and carry on walking and you get right to Port vell. Once you get to the port which is a short walk away carry on walking left and you get to the beach. The Picasso museum is a must see and is literally 5 mins away. Just turn up Princesa which is to the left of the hotel go up that road and you're there. One thing that cant go unmentioned about this hotel - it is by far it's best feature - the amazing roof terrace! You can see the sea, sagrada familiar, infact you can see the whole of the city it's breathtaking. Make sure you chill out up there a couple of nights with a glass of wine, it's so peaceful and relaxing. You can even eat tapas up there if you like, but we didn't. There's also a pretty jacuzzi up there but it's only free to use in the mornings. A few tips - on the first night if you're shattered there's a lovely homely italian with great food - just turn right out of the hotel, walk a little bit and you're there. I think it's just past a little organic supermarket. For a bigger explore turn left out of the hotel to the trendy el born and gothic quarters and go down the little streets to find some amazing gems. There's a great tapas place that is really spanish called El Rovell. Cheese Me lets you dine in a modern style overlooking the sqaure. Theres also lots of restauantes around santa maria del mar. Make sure you head further away from the hotel some nights as well back towards the centre. Just off the main shopping street, for example, de'angel there is a street called Montsío which is home to the 4 cats restarant. Wow this place in unbelieveable. The rabbit with almonds is delicious. It's traditional catalan dishes and it was where Picasso used to hang out :) We visited La Rambla by accident one night and virtually ran away - it's tacky and has a dangerous air to it at night time. The restarants there looked dirty and were expensive anyway. During the day it's worth a visit. I enjoyed seeing the various human statues and listening to the street music but I found it too touristy, overated and disapointing compared with the magic that the real Barcelona has to offer. Have a great trip - Barcelona is wonderful to explore and this hotel is a real find. i wish i was back there now - it's raining back home.

Reviews.Title: “The naked man in the street was a bonus”
Reviews.Author: freeloaderEngland
Reviews.Content: Just back from 4 nights at H10 Montcada.The room wasn't any great size but considering what we paid through lastminute.com we couldn't find fault with any aspect of this hotel. The location was perfect, the staff were very friendly and efficient, the view from the roof was fabulous, and we even got a room at the back so it was quiet at night.All in all a great trip and a wonderful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but small room”
Reviews.Author: U2lover
Reviews.Content: After researching the many hotels in Barcelona, we finally opted for the H10 for our recent trip to Barcelona to celebrate our 20th wedding anniversary and to see U2 at Camp Nou. To say we were disappointed, is an understatement, the hotel room was tiny and didn't have an external window so was dark and dingy, more like a prison cell. None of the pictures or description online suggested the rooms were so small. The room and ensuite were lovely and clean and well equipped but the size of the room was just a joke and put us off dining or relaxing in the hotel. We did ask to be moved, as did other guests but were told the hotel was fully booked. The hotel itself is centrally located but is on a very busy road. It is directly opposite a metro station, Jaume 1, which made getting around very easy and U2 were brilliant!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: dejazazz79
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great, I really have no complaints! The staff was very nice and the location was awesome. Close enough to Las Ramblas and the metros but far enough that you can get away from the touristy areas. They must have a room stocked with champagne bc it seemed to flow everyday! When we checked in, we received our complimentary glass. Then they gave us a pleasure ticket which gave us a free bottle and chocolate covered strawberries any time we wanted, for free. So we enjoyed that perk on the rooftop, which was really nice and pleasant after a long day of walking around. Having a beer and tapas on the roof overlooking the city was definitely a nice way to end the afternoon. I had a birthday while I was there and again, they sent a free bottle of champagne to our room as a gift. I asked the staff who sent it and she said they noticed it was my birthday from my passport. I thought that was a nice gesture! We had the free breakfast everyday, which was nice. They had a good spread that filled us up. The rooms were very small but being from NY, it didn't bother us at all. Internet in the lobby was convenient too. I would definitely stay here again and really enjoyed this hotel and Barcelona!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay in Barcelona no complaints”
Reviews.Author: hazewill
Reviews.Content: My husband and i have just returned from a wonderful break in Barcelona we stayed4 nights in the hotel Montcada . On arriving rather hot and sweatyfrom our journey we were greeted by a very pleasant receptionist who handled our check in swiftly and efficiently whilst we sipped our complimentary glass of ice cold champagne.We had requested a room on a higher floor of the hotel which was implemented. We were on the 5th floor at the back of the hotel. the room was entirely adequate for 2 people and everything was spotlessly clean. We had a shower over the bath but it was a wonderful power shower. the air conditioning worked well and was very welcome after ahot days sightseeing in the lovely hot weather. we could not get any English channels on the television but this turned out to be a blessing in disguise as it was nice to be without tv for a few days. All th staff were wonderful and helped us in any way they could . In our holiday package we had booked complimentary wine and strawberries which was served to us on our request on the wonderful terrace on the top floor of the hotel. The terrace area has comfortable seating sun loungers. In the evening there is a bar ( the drinks are quite expensive but this is the norm for hotels) from here you can look out on stunning views of Barclona. The terrace also houses the jacuzi I booked half an hour one morning which was wonderful.I was also free! We booked breakfast in the hotel and could not fault it .The list of produce is endless. all types of fresh fruit, fresh juices, cereal, delicious pastries of all sorts, chesses meats, yoghurts toast fresh bread rolls and then on top of all that cooked. Bacon sausages mushrooms beans fried bread eggs! we never needed lunch! absolutely excellent service in pleasant restaurant. location was fantastic just on the outskirts of the busy Ramblas. A short walk from the impressive beautiful harbourand very convenient for all sightseeing. Barcelona is a wonderful place with so much to do and see. We opted for a 2 day pass on the bus turistic. We spent one whole day on the blue lane and another on the red line. The bus is wonderful value you can hop on and hop off wherever you like for as long as you like then hop on again.It is wonderful value takes you to all the major sights even as far as the nou camp. The weather was fabulous we encountered no problems with pick pockets etc. We had a wonderful stay and would definitely return. Warning when booking flight with easy jet or any travel company that deals with easy jet make sure you read the small print about baggage! unfortunately a mix up was made when we booked our trip and no bags were logged for us on our flight.
