We had to pay nearly £80 to take our bags to Barcelona and back! The only black mark on an otherwise wonderful holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay, loved the rooftop jacuzzi!”
Reviews.Author: SaltaireClaire
Reviews.Content: We had a great break at this hotel, the location is excellent and the rooftop jacuzzi (which you can book for half an hour for free in the mornings) is fantastic! The breakfasts were lovely, with lots of fresh fruit, cheese, cold meats, bacon, scrambled eggs, choice of juices and even cakes! It meant we could skip lunch which saved us money. Good restaurants nearby in the Gothic quarter and an easy walk to the Marina. Our room was quiet as it was at the back, and the air con and bathrooms were both good. Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed a great stay at the Montcada.............but it wasn't faultless”
Reviews.Author: Yeemei
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week for a romantic holiday and the hotel did not disappoint. The major advantage of staying here is the location. Right on the Via Laietana which is a very busy road between the Gothic Quarter and the La Ribera. The Jaume I Metro stop is directly opposite the hotel which is very convenient as the Metro stops outside most of the major sights in the city. The hotel is in an ideal location for exploring the Gothic Quarter on foot and the beach is only a 10 minute walk away if you go via Carrer Argenteria as this takes you through the winding streets and brings you out in front of the Museu d'Historia de Catalunya. There are loads of restaurants nearby, we recommend exploring down Carrer Argenteria for some decent places. The lovely roof top terrace is an ideal way to get your bearings and it gives wonderful views of the sea, cathedral and the rest of the city. Drinks are expensive (10 euros for a mojito) but they are worth every penny. There is a rooftop jacuzzi which guests can use if they make a prior booking. There are also sun loungers available should you decide to give the city sights a break. We enjoyed the terrace so much that we used it every day. The only downside was that the terrace bar closed at 10:30pm but I think some guests took up drinks which they had purchased from the bar downstairs. The rooms were a little on the small size but adequate for 2 people. We had a double wardrobe and plenty of other storage space around the room. The private safe in the room was also very handy. Air conditioning worked well and there was a TV in the room showing a few English channels for those who wanted it. The bathroom was of a very good size and the big walk in shower was very welcome after a long day of walking. Housekeeping were very efficient and did a good job as the room was spotless all week. The only issue we had with the room was the noise levels. As we were on the 3rd floor we could hear most of the street noise and the the occasional metro train rumbling through. We did request a room on a higher floor prior to our stay but this was not honoured. We decided to opt out of breakfast and at 15 euros per person, we weren't sure that it would provide good value for money. Instead we walked across the road to the Placa del Rei every morning to a little cafe called Buenas Migas which served delicious toast and English Breakfast tea for around 4 euros. There are also a few places to get pastries and coffees in the Placa de L'Angel next to the Metro stop. The staff were very polite and were able to provide recommendations for restaurants, etc. The reception staff were also very friendly and the glass of cava on arrival was a nice touch. As we had time to spare before catching our flight, the reception staff were able to look after our luggage and order a taxi for us whilst we hung around. Overall we really enjoyed our stay here at the H10 Montcada and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Heed reviewers' warnings and do not stay here...if something goes wrong, the management could care less”
Reviews.Author: worldytraveler
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately the hotel marred what would have been a wonderful holiday in Barcelona. It was the worst management that I have ever seen. As other travelers have stated, they often pass the blame to the next person on duty. The hotel manager is especially incompetent at dealing with customers: --The airport was to deliver our luggage after check-in. We mentioned to the front desk and asked about it repeatedly. The next morning we were notified that our bags were delivered but the front desk turned our bags away because: 1. They didn't have our names as guests even though they had our credit card and registration card upon check in (1st excuse) 2. The person at the front desk was training (2nd excuse several hours later) 3. They didn't have the luggage tag numbers, which they never asked for when we mentioned the bags three times when checking on the status (3rd excuse the next day). Because of the hotel's mistake, the bag was sent back to the airport and lost for the entirety of the trip. The manager was completely unapologetic. When she finally made a concession, it was to pay for the phone calls we had to make to track down the bags that they had turned away! They also ruined our laundry by throwing our dry cleaning (clearly indicated on the laundry slip) in one wash with the rest of the laundry, thus ruining the drying cleaning items and dying everything. To make matters worse, after asking us to leave the damaged items for the incompetent manager to review, they would not return our clothes for "insurance purposes." The service the hotel provided was appalling. This was by far the worst hotel I have ever stayed at.

Reviews.Title: “Never, Ever Again.”
Reviews.Author: jwindt77
Reviews.Content: Well, getting my wallet stolen on the Metro was admittedly a bad start, but this hotel was nonetheless a hug disappointment. Don't let the photos fool you. The rooms are tiny, and very modest. The air conditioning left us sweltering in the room, even on the 2 days that we were there that were in the high 70's outside (low 20's celcius). The fitness room was a joke, just one tiny treadmill and a few free weights. The jacuzzi / spa looked nice, but is inadequate for a hotel this size, and was always full. The television in the room stopped working. I was told someone would look at it the next day (when we were going to check out). The only english channels were CNBC and CNN. Even the Spanish language channels were few in number, on a 19" TV with rounded screen no less. There have got to be more modern hotels with larger room for a better price. At 120 Euros + a night, this is a rip off. Only decent thing about it was the location. despite my complaints, they never offered any discount or incentive...not even to throw in one of their 15 Euro breakfasts. 15 Euros for breakfast??!! This was by far the worst AND most expensive room in Spain on a 2 week trip.

Reviews.Title: “We will be back”
Reviews.Author: Jen-Pompey
Reviews.Content: Barcelona is a wonderful city. The h10 Montcada have fantastic, helpful and very friendly staff. The hotel is spotlessly clean and modern inside. Well positioned in the centre with the beach just a stop away on the underground system. Although the room was quite small (507) it had every thing you could need for a short city break. I will be recommending this hotel and the city to all my friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely experience in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: jimillym
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 nights at the hotel following a cruise. I booked it on the internet, largely due to location and price..Montcada Pleasure Package, which was very nice. Never having been to Barcelona before, we didn't know what to expect, but we were very happy during our stay. We arrived early Sunday morning and the room was not ready; but they stored our luggage, gave us a map and good information to do some sight seeing. When we returned, we enjoyed a nice glass of cava while checking in. They even gave us a choice of 2 rooms, letting us look at them first. Yes, the room was a bit on the "funky" side but it was comfortable, very clean, and they provided us with robes/slippers, nice toiletries, extra pillows, etc. We enjoyed our strawberries and bottle of cava on the rooftop terrace, which we visited both days we were there. The breakfast, also included in our package, was great and plentiful. Best of all, we enjoyed the friendly staff at the reception desk. They greeted us by name whenever we came in and seemed to enjoy talking with us. The location of this hotel couldn't have been better for us, just across the street from the cathedral area and close to the stop for the Touristic bus. Wonderful for walking the old city and La Ribera. You won't like this hotel if you are looking for a cookie cutter type chain style. But if you like things a little different, try it. We would definitely stay at the Montcada again. We found it delightful.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fabulous”
Reviews.Author: Travellersplymouth
Reviews.Content: From arrival and a welcome glass of Cava to departure 5 days later the hotel was fabulous. The reception staff were very friendly and helpful and their English was amazing. Our room was a corner room (603) and had plenty of space and also had views of the Cathedral. The Ramblas were only 5 mins walk away as was the marina/beach area. Everything you could think of was available for breakfast. A variety of fresh fruit and fresh juices, cereals, bacon, sausages & fried/scrambled eggs, toast, fresh bread rolls, cold meats & cheese, yoghurts and local pastries and it was all delicious. Hotel tour guide was extremely interesting and well worth 10 euros. A dip in the spa on the roof terrace is very relaxing, then lie back and enjoy the sun on one of the sun beds. We only heard another hotel room door close once in the 6 days we were there.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional staff; clean, modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: YogaTravel
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel at the conclusion of our cruise. The staff is extremely helpful, accomodating, and speak great English. They quickly offered maps with highlighted routes and top restaurant picks. The H10 Montcada is a very chic boutique hotel. They offer free internet/computer use in the lobby. The rooftop view is beautiful! It's a very relaxed area where people were reading books, playing cards, or napping. The location is great- you are close to many great restaurants, cafes, and shopping. The Hop On-Hop Off bus stop is a quick block from the hotel. Also, you can take the Aerobus to the airport from a plaza (7-10 minute walk w/luggage) for a mere 4.5Euro per person- so much cheaper than a taxi! The bathroom is spacious; the shower head felt great! The beds were extremely firm- so we took sleeping medicine to help fall asleep. The hotel also offers several English channels. All in all, we would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Not for us...”
Reviews.Author: Buzzards
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Montcada over the Easter Weekend. On booking I specifically requested a smoking room and was told that this should not be a problem. On arrival we were informed that there weren't any left but we could smoke on the street. On arriving in our "superior" room we found light switches hanging out of the wall and televisions that didn't work. We called room service for a coffee as it had been a long day and were informed that room service was shut (closes at 10.30). On waking the following morning we again called room service for a coffee, it doesn't open until 10.30. My expectation of a hotel of this standard would be 24 hour room service. We asked at reception if anyone with a smoking room was checking out and if we could change rooms. We were told we were in luck, asked to pack up our suitcases and leave them with reception, room would be available about 3pm. 3pm came and went, by 5pm the room was ready..... another non-smoking room!! When we complained there didn't appear to be any understanding of the fact we had been without a room all day on the basis we were being moved to a smoking room only to find that wasn't the case at all. The rooms, even the superior are tiny and somewhat shabby for a hotel of this standard and they have an unwelcoming feel. The only good thing I can say is the location is excellent and the coffee shop across the road is excellent for breakfast should you wish to avoid the bank breaking £15 per person for a buffet breakfast at the hotel. Never again!

Reviews.Title: “excellent location,can be noisy.”
Reviews.Author: burritoman
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this Hotel during recent city break to Barcelona,we were given a very nice room with balcony that opened out onto main road,2nd floor corner plot. Previous reviews state rooms very small so the hotel has a mixture of both. The only negative point was that without double glazing it could become noisy at night and in the early hours. Hotel had great rooftop space with comfortable chairs to relax and take in the good views. Staff seemed good but some people we spoke to were complaining that they had a very poor attitude towards guests who had problems mainly with stolen money/bags(2 during our stay, both on the Metro) as much to say that this sort of thing is common in Barcelona and nothing could be done about it, even suggesting that for the loss of 200euros it would not be worth going to the police!. I must stress that security in the Hotel seemed ok and every room had a safe deposit box which should be used at all times. Breakfast was excellent with a wide choice for all nationalities, and always fresh. Cleanliness was very good in Hotel and in room.The location of this Hotel is very good with good public transport links(metro just over road) and is a good base from which to walk around the city. There are plenty of restraunts and Tapas bars nearby also fast food outlets, overall the Hotel is highly recommended and just about worth 4 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Smart, centrally located comfortable hotel with a great breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: bigsurUk
Reviews.Content: We went on a 5 day city break, the hotel was in a perfect location to reach all the attractions. We had a room on floor 7 to the side of the hotel (you need a high floor if possible as you can feel the rumble of the Metro). Very pleasant staff and a nice glass of Cava on arrival. Modern furnishings and very nice bathroom made for a comfortable stay. A really good breakfast selection of fruit, meats and cheese, cereals, cakes and even a hot section with juice, coffee and tea set us up for busy days sightseeing. The roof terrace was a big plus for an hour or two of relaxation in the sun. The Metro station was just across the road and the sea front was a 10 minute walk away. Las Ramblas was 10 minutes away and Barcelona Cathedral only 5. Liked best: location, cleanliness and breakfast Liked least: leaving Barcelona!!

Reviews.Title: “Raise the roof !”
Reviews.Author: helisherSydney
Reviews.Content: This place is in a great location, right on the edge of the Gothic area and a relatively short stroll from the harbour and beach. Las Ramblas is about 10 mins away across the Gothic area, an interesting way to make it there is to get lost amongst the bars along the way. Fantastic rooms, spacious, with all the mod cons that you'd require. My favourite part was the rooftop bar which has spectacular views plus the rooftop spa, it made relaxing with a few drinks in hand more than a pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Fabolous hotel in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: quintontravels
Reviews.Content: We travelled as a group of 6 females on a hen do wanting something a little special rather than the normal tack!. As soon as we arrived at the hotel we were greeted with a warm welcome from Anna, she said our rooms were not ready as we arrived early but they arranged to take our suitcases and gave us a safe which she recommended we used for our passports/money etc. Anna then gave us a map which she highlighted various attractions shopping area's, she also suggested a Tapa's bar to have a bite to eat. She recommended not going to Las Ramblas at night and not to eat there as prices would be high and not so good!!! We went off the explore and found the Tapa's bar that she recommended it was called Taller de Tapa's and considering we were only there for 2 full days we visited it 3 times as it was so good and very reasonably priced the Sangira was also fantastic and priced very well. We went back to the hotel at 2pm alothough our rooms shouldn't have been ready until 3pm, we were given a glass of Cava and told to take a seat, Anna came over and done our check in while we were sitting down enjoying our cava we just were not rushed that is the first time I have had such a great experiance of checking in. We were given vouchers for a bottle of cava and strawberries for each room (we had 3 rooms) as we were booked into a certain package and she suggested that we book a slot for the jacuzzi so we had it to ourselves and arranged for us to have Cava and strawberries in the jacuzzi on the roof terrace. Our rooms were very clean and the bathrrom was very spacious, they were cleaned every day even sunday. The breakfast was just as good as everything else, great selection hot/cold the hot was not greasy at all and there was more fruit than you could imagine. The location was great, walking distance to everything and on the bus touristic route. I could go on and on and on, but overall this was a fantastic hotel and I will be going back

Reviews.Title: “H10 Montcada - Not a "10" in our book!”
Reviews.Author: jeninyc
Reviews.Content: From the moment we checked in to the moment of checkout, the H10 Hotel proved to be a disaster. We were greeted by a surly and nasty front desk clerk by the name of Anna J. who argued continually with us about the configuration of our room. We had booked a triple but she assigned a small room to us without the proper placement of beds. We were then given a room on the second floor overlooking the busy Laietana Street. It was extremely noisy. It not only overlooked the street, but had a train rumbling underneath every five to ten minutes. It was very difficult to sleep. We had no choice to stay as we were travelling with a child. It was pointless to argue with the unprofessional front desk staff. Our first morning we called the front desk to have our room made up early. Ms. Anna J. answered and stated that "This is not possible...it would be done before 5 PM." She intentionally informed the housekeeping staff to make up our room late and it was made up at 4PM. This was not acceptable. We had to personally ask the housekeepers to make up our room each and every afternoon or otherwise it would never have been done. What kind of hotel makes up rooms at 5 PM? I was both taken aback and shocked at the shabby public impression that the H10 Montacada gives. Our trip to Barcelona was truly marred by our unfortunate staty at the H10 Montacada and our encounter with the rudest, most unprofessional hotel clerk in Europe.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, wonderful location,”
Reviews.Author: NC-glasgow
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to Montcada and we were very well look after again. We were retuning to Barcelona to celebrate our engagement there one year ago to the day. My fiance emailed the hotel prior to staying and they very kindly upgraded us to the same suite we were in last year (and added the "Montcada Pleasure Package" of cava and strawberries), which was lovely! There were lots of great little touches in the room like a box of chocolates and some mineral water (water was also supplied free for the rest of our stay) along with a nice welcome card from the hotel. The room was very spacious (but it was a suite) and immaculate. Tastefully decorated and well kitted out - mini bar, trouser press (does anyone still use these things?), safe, hairdryer (good powerful one), decent toiletries and accessories, bathrobes, slippers, flat screen TV, tourist guides...the list goes on! The reception staff are very friendly and helpful. The breakfast was fantastic with loads of choice and very well organised. We also had dinner at the hotel on our first night and this was delicious and would do so again. There is also a spa which we did not have time to use but they had a great selection of treatments available, and a lovely rooftop terrace with jacuzzi for the warmer months. This is a fab hotel which I would definitely recommend to anyone - we hope to go back again soon!

Reviews.Title: “Our Review of H10 Montcada”
Reviews.Author: Tripster0814
Reviews.Content: The rooms are very small and very clean. We have two twin beds, they are very, very hard, surprisingly, you do not wake up with body-aches the next day. The hotel is on a main and very busy street. There is no parking in front of the hotel, nor do they have assigned parking in the area. If you want to park, you have to go about 1 block away to the Saba parking for 25euros/night; the hotel staff will provide you a piece of paper, where you receive the 25 euro rate or you can try to find parking on your own. Our room faces the street and it is very noisy so bring your earplugs, you'll hear ambulance/police cars, people coming out of clubs yelling and playing music in the street. The hotel is about a 5 minute walk from Las Ramblas, just a step away from Barrio Gotic. There are many restaurants and shops in the area. The staff is small and friendly. There are no clocks in the room, only one very small garbage can. There is a blow dryer. If you like a/c, the hotel shuts it off during the colder weather, we asked if they could open a window because the heat was on very high. If you want a wake up call, someone knocks on your door. You receive one towel and one pillow per guest, we asked for an extra towel and were informed that there is only 1 towel per guest. The TV has english speaking channels. The hotel jacuzzi was closed. The hotel has one computer with internet and printer in the main lobby. The every day buffet breakfast consisted of: Hot breakfast on chafing pans: poached eggs on toast, scrambled eggs, pork mini-weenies, bacon, and baked beans. Cold breakfast: Assortment of cheeses (mozzarella, emental, swiss, brie); chorizo and salami slices, prosciutto, potato torte; rolls, sliced bread, peach & strawberry jelly and butter and yogurts. Fresh fruit: pineapple, melon, oranges, apples, grapes. Fresh juices: pineapple, orange, peach and tomato; and some pastries: mini croissants filled with sweet cheese, chocolate cookies, mini-muffins, some fruit tortes and cereals. Coffee and tea with milk -- the coffee is delicious! FYI: someone ordered breakfast/room service and the staff took the breakfast from the chafing pans and delivered it to the room. Do not waste your money on room service, it isn't very good and with all the many restaurants in the area, you can get a delicious meal for a fraction of the cost. Overall, we agree that the hotel is a nice, clean, basic hotel, however, we're in our 40's and prefer a more quiet, comfortable hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Time had by all”
Reviews.Author: mrsC75
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a weekend stay at this hotel and can highly recommend it. We were a group of three women who wanted to stay in the same room. From contacting the hotel directly and throughout our stay the staff couldnt have been more helpful. We arrived and received a complimentary glass of Cava and were shown to our room 803 which is the room shown in the hotel photos looking down Via Laitena down to the Marina. They accomodated our request for an additional bed in the room and I must say it was exceptionally clean and to a very high standard. The bathroom was well appointed with a little quirk of being able to shower while watching the world go by down on the little square by the Jaume 1 metro. There were toiletries supplied even down to toothbrush and paste, sewing kits and shaving kits. The hotel is well placed for bars, restuarants and nightlife although we did get harrassed on a few occasions in the evening heading along the street which links the street the hotel is on to Las Ramblas and Place Reil where the clubs are. We were offered everything from cans of beer, food, sex and drugs which we found very intimidating and at times quite scary as we were a group of three women. I would suggest only walk this area if you are very confident and/or in a group. We had read the postings on here before going and did not take any bags out with us in the evenings and kept our money in securely on our persons. We went to some fabulous restaurants near the hotel namely Ginger which is about 5 minutes walk and another Tapas bar recommended by the hotel ( I cant remember the name) and the card they gave us entitled us to a free glass of wine. Both ngohts the food was excellent tapas like you have never tasted. The only downside to our trip was that the jacuzzi was not operating during our stay due to repairs but we were so busy we didnt really miss it. Would love to go back to Barcelona and would definately stay here

Reviews.Title: “perfect location”
Reviews.Author: suzy31
Reviews.Content: recently stayed 4 nights at the Montcada on a leisure break with a girlfriend. The Location of the Hotel is excellent you can get to the port or Ramblas in 10 min easily, you are also right by the Gothic quarter with plenty of bars and restaurants around the hotel, there is also a supermarket 4 doors down great for stocking up on wine. I have no complaints with the hotel other than the room being a little on the compact side and no kettle. They have a lovely roof terrace and jacuzzi, you are allowed one use of the jacuzzi am. they then charge 79euros for a romantic 30 min package with cava which I thought was a bit of a rip off. The gym is nothing more than a very small room off the roof terrace with a sad looking running machine and a few weights, it would be boiling in the summer. The breakfast in the hotel was excellent and served till 10.30am we didn't sample the evening meal. If you need a taxi hail it yourself on the road as it is more expensive if the hotel calls it for you, it costs around 25 euros to get to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, incredible location, perfect”
Reviews.Author: Lara_Valseca_King
Reviews.Content: 25th feb 2009- 28th feb 2009 On our day of arrival, we were told that the hotel had lost electicity on 2 floors and were moved to a hotel 50 yards away (Hotel Gotico). This was slightly annoying, and when arriving at the other hotel even more annoying as the corridors were like mazes, and renovation being done, so just outside of our room was ladders, plaster on the floor, general dirt (cigarette butts etc)-not good. As for the room, was also dingy and small, uncomfortable beds, and nuiscance with air con. However the next night (without notice admittedly, and late in the evening, which was a hassle) we were taken back to Hotel Montcada, with sincerest apologies, glass of champagne, upgrade to a VIP room, pleasure ticket for champagne and strawberries on the rooftop, and box of chocolates waiting on the bed. The staff were very sorry about it, and very concerned and helpful when we had any queries afterwards. Their english was also very good. I would definately stay here again. The loaction was superb, so close to the metro and able to just walk out and wander the streets of Bario Gotico and Las Ramblas etc. Wish I had been there for longer! :( Also I warn anyone as the woman previously who I noticed stayed here at the same time as I did, of pick pockets and muggers!! In 3 days me and my partner (of 18 and 19 years old) encountered two events of this sort! First day I caught an elderly man with his hand in my bag whilst riding on the metro. And on the final night whilst walking down the busy street back to the hotel, two arab men began harassing me and my boyfriend, so I clutched my bag, and before I knew it the had both grabbed my partner round the throat from behind, and yanked his wallet from his back pocket! It was not a nice incident to happen on the last night, but it could have been worse. Thankfully we were both very careful and only took out 10 or 20 euros with us at a time, and removed all our cards and driving licenses and kept them in the hotel safe. We didnt report the incident as it was only 5 euros they took (hardly even worth their effort) and not worth ours to report it. Barcelona seems to have a very bad reputation for this sort of thing so please anyone reading this, be careful if you do go!!

Reviews.Title: “Dont stay here”
Reviews.Author: DublinPaco
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for a weekend but turned out to be a disaster. Booked half board and the only thing that was anyway good was the breakfast. Double room was tiny and evening meal was a shambles. Tried complaing but no one cared. Will never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel / Great Food”
Reviews.Author: catherineBlackpool
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 day short break with our friends. Great central located hotel about a 10min walk to las ramblas, the food in hotel spot on. Staff very friendly and helpful, bedrooms spotless and clean, loads of free little accessories in your bathroom eg shower gel/body lotion, toothbrush,shoe shine,comb,tissues,shower cap,soap. The rooftop views are spectacular from the hotel. If i had to give one negative point it would be the bar closing at 11.00pm as when we had been out for a meal and then walked back to the hotel for one final nightcap before bed, they would not serve us even when we said charge it to our room. I found this very strange in a large city the hotel bar closing at that time, there was quite a few people going to the bar after 11.00pm and getting turned away.

Reviews.Title: “Be careful in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: DaisydiLancashire
Reviews.Content: Just returned from stay in H10 Montcada. On sunday evening I had my bag snatched off my shoulder just as I was going through the doors of the H10 Montcada. They have no CCV cameras on the doors, only on the reception desk. The staff could not care less, we didn't even get offered a glass of water and they avoided eye contact with us next day. At the police station there were queues of tourists reporting stolen bags, cameras etc. I have travelled all over the world and never ever seen as many incidents. Shame, Barcelona is a lovely place,- the police blamed it on the economic crisis!! but hey if tourist stopped going they would have a crisis!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: flowersarah
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel, in a central location which is walking distance from Ramblas, the harbour and has a metro station right outside. The service in the hotel was wonderful, and included a friendly welcome with a lovely glass of cava. Our room 511, was a mini suite, with a quirky layout, that added to its charm and gave a small setting area which was seperate from the bedroom. The room was really quite, a surprise given the busy area and the metro underneath. The bar and lobby area at the entrance were beautifully decorated and staff were friendly and helpful in getting anything we needed. The view from the rooftop bar is spetacular, the gothic cathedral is really close and the view extends to the sea, the montjuic and across Barcelona to the mountains behind. Even though the rooftop bar was not offically serving (due to the season), staff from the downstairs bar were more than accomodating and delivered drinks and food to the roof top. Breakfast had an amazing selection, which included a cooked English breakfast, ham and cheese, cereals, pastries, and a wonderful selection of fresh fruit. I'd highly recommend this hotel, and I'd have no hestiation in booking it again for a return trip.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel H10 Montcada ecellent stay”
Reviews.Author: EL0wry
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a short break with my hubby in Barcelona (6th feb-9th feb) and stayed in above hotel.Accomodation excellent rooms very clean,toiletry selection good,sweets and fresh flowers in room lovely touch.Staff friendly and very helpul.Only disappointment was roof top jacuzzi and sauna not working.Make sure you see views from roof top..spetacular take some pics! Make sure you visit the two markets one off LAs Ramblas the other off Via Laietana where hotel is situated colours and smells amazing!! we also did Barcelona bus turistic one of the stops just down from hotel very handy.Sunday is quieter for bus than sat. Plenty off eating places we tried coffee shop cappuchino just across from hotel.also ate in medeterrian restaraunt Le Quinze Nits situated in PL Reial off Las Ramblas recommended by locals.Queues start about 1 hour before opening very popular and food excellent you will not be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Break”
Reviews.Author: smythe34
Reviews.Content: Having read all the reviews I decided to book a short break to Barcelona as a surprise for my wife and our 4 month old baby. I booked direct with the hotel; getting a better deal than going through an agent. ( Try booking direct with hotel you should get a better deal i did.) They sent me correct correspondance to say how to get to the hotel from the airport, using the train, buses or a taxi. We decided to get the train&metro as it seemed fairly straightforward - train from the Airport to Passage de Gracia and then change to the Metro Yellow Line for 2 stops to Jaume 1. It was an easy enough journey and only cost about 10 euros for both of us but due to there not being lifts at the train/metro station we had to carry the baby, buggy and bags up and down flights of stairs which was difficult so we opted for a taxi back to the airport, which cost £30 euros. From Jaume 1 metro station you can see the hotel is just across the road, less than a minutes walk. On arrival the staff were very helpful and spoke good English, although our room was not ready we were allowed to use a room to change our baby and whilst my wife did this I was given a map of the city and was also pointed out some of the local sights within walking distance. We booked the 2 day bus tour for $27 euros each. We did both the blue and red routes one one each day. Well worth the money as you can get on and off as many times as you want. The bus route takes you to all the main attractions. The staff on the buses are very helpful and friendly. We booked the hotel with bed and breakfast. The breakfast is buffet style and the choice is excellent, the only critscism was the english breakfast bacon is nothing like back at home. I strongly advise booking bed and breakfast it does save money. We also had our evening meal as it seemed the cheapest option offering a 3 course menu for 19 euros. The food and service are excellent. The menu consists of a buffet starter of Salad, soup and a pasta dish of the day - you can help yourself to as much as you like and there is also free Cava available. The main course and dessert are also very nice with a good choice to choose from. The hotel is in an excellent location and within comfortable walking distance you can visit The Port, La Rambla, The Cathedral and Catalyuna Square. We walked to the harbour and went to the Aquarium. It cost 15.50 euros with a discount voucher you get from the bus tour route. (The voucher book has some good savings inside). The aquarium is amazing and well worth the money. When we came out lining the path were street traders trying to sell goods. Dont be put off by them as there are plenty of police around and as soon as they see the police they run off. BUT DONT GET YOUR MONEY OUT IN FRONT OF THEM. SOME SNATCH YOUR MONEY AND RUN. THIS HAPPENDED TO AN AMERCIAN TOURIST WHILST WE WERE THERE. Overall the break was excellent and I would highly recommend the H10 Montecada Hotel and would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great breakfast at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: silky2
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in Jan 09. It has a great situation in Barcelona, it a 7 min walk to the Placa Cataluya, accross the road from the Old City minutes to the Picasso Musum and beside the Metro station. The staff were very helpful and cheerful, the room was on the small side but spotless, the bathroom was very large. The breakfast was a joy, juices, fresh fruit, cold meat and cheeses, hot cooked breakfast and plent of tea and coffee available. We booked this through Otel.com and got a very good rate for B&B. Barcelona bus and metro system are very usere friendly a ten ride tickets cost 7.70 euro for either bus or metro, and can be use by a group or just 1.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the open air jacuzzi”
Reviews.Author: madpals
Reviews.Content: I contacted the hotel prior to arrival for directions from Girona airport. I had a quick response with clear details. We were presented with a glass of Cava on arrival whilst booking in. My husband had booked the wellbeing experience for me & my daughter for Xmas. We arranged the massages at a time that was convenient to ourselves after which we were invited to use the Jacuzzi on the sunset terrace where we were brought a cocktail and tapas. The staff could not be more friendly or helpful nothing seemed too much trouble. I would certainly recommend it as it was nicely situated with access via the metro to all of Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Great City location”
Reviews.Author: SteveandKimUk
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 16th - 19th January 2008 for a Trade Show Exhibition. We chose the hotel for its location, city centre and right opposite a Metro Station (Jaume 1) and a short 10 minute walk to Las Ramblas. The Hotel is in the Barri Gothic District, lots of beautiful architecture. Hotel was great, staff and service was good, breakfast was amazing, you name it they had it, great value. The room was clean and stylish, but a little on the small side, we read about this on another review so we expected a small room. Flat screen TV and marble bathroom. Best feature of this hotel was the Roof Terrace, Roof Top Hot Tub (was drained in January but great in summer), Stylish Bar Area, fabulous views. A nice touch was the couple of glasses of cava on check-in from Reception. Great hotel, good location, lots of shops, cafe's, bars and restaurants nearby, and a supermarket. We will use it again, good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect - good service and location”
Reviews.Author: GitteLB
Reviews.Content: Perfect hotel - both the service and the location! Very friendly staf, excellent breakfast and good cava :-) And the location is just right for Barcelona. Rooms small, but good - large bathroom! Even though the top floor terrasse was closed due to the heavy storm, we really enjoyed the stay and we will certainly come back when the weather is better. On top of our visit: the didn't want us to pay for the gin tonics from the minibar :-)

Reviews.Title: “H10......Again and again!!!”
Reviews.Author: jenks_8
Reviews.Content: I was booked this trip as a surprise for Christmas by my girlfriend and had absolutely no idea what to expect or where i was going. When i found out it was Barcelona and that i was going to the Nou Camp i was over the moon. The hotel did not let us down either. For the money paid for 3 nights it was of an excellent standard and the staff went out of their way to help if we had a question and their english was very good. The rooms are very clean, if at some points a little warm and the air conditioning didnt seem to work as well as it should, but im sure it wqas only because of the time of year and the hotel probably can control it in different seasons. The main and best part of the hotel was the sun terrace and Jacuzzi on the roof of the hotel and the view was out of this world. We didnt get to use the jacuzzi or bar up there as they were not open this time of year but i can imagine that you can have a really amazing experience up there in the warmer months and there is also a gym and spa that can be booked also. There is also a nice bar and restaurant area where you can sit and relax and just watch the world go by. If i was to advise anything, it would be to ask for a room on the 7th or 8th floor and on the corner as they seemed to be the larger ones and the ones with the best views, but overall you will enjoy this cheap, but extremely adequate hotel if u are looking for somewhere to stay in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, good location. Would recommend!!”
Reviews.Author: belindacoles
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend stayed here from 12th Jan - 15th Jan, we paid £180 for 3 nights and booked via easytobook.com We took a taxi from the airport which took around 20mins and cost 23 euros. When we checked in we were given a glass of champagne each which was a nice touch and then given some leaflets and a map of Barcelona which I always think is a great bonus to receive when checking in to a hotel. We had room 701 - I had emailed ahead asking for a corner room as they tend to be bigger. The room wasnt huge but it was more than ok for us, the decor was clean and modern and the bathroom was very nice with lots of comp toiletrees and clean towels. There are also free safes in the room which to us was another plus. The hotel lobby/bar area looked nice and was often quite busy. The hotel also has a rooftop terrace which was lovely to go to and take in the views of the city. We didnt use the restaurant pr have breakfast but the dinner menu seemed quite reasonably priced and looked nice. The reception staff and "bell boy" were very helpful and printed us lots of timetables out when we enquired about getting the airport train on our return. The location was excellent, right beside the hotel is a metro station (Jaume I) and there are shops, restaurants and cafes all in the immediate area. The hotel is on a long main road, one direction leads you to plaza catalunya/las ramblas and the other direction leads you to Port Vell which is a lovely marina with a shopping centre, cinema, restaurants and aqaurium. We were able to walk everywhere we wanted with ease. It took about 10-20mins to reach Port Vell, Las Ramblas, Arc De Triumph and other tourist attractions. We used the night buses in the evening and found them very convenient and easy to use. We also used a bus to reach the beach which is situated at port olympic, another lovely marina which seemed to have the most night life and nice restaurants, also a casino. All in all we enjoyed Barcelona. We did find it expensive but that is probably because the euro-pound is so low at the moment. We didnt think much of Las Ramblas and am glad we didnt stay too close to it. We did see a few "dodgey" characters on street corners trying to sell you "smoke" or cans of beer, but we just avoided or ignored them... you get these sort of characters in all city centres!! We were concerned about the stories of pick pockets so we decided to take minimal cash out with us and use as credit card where possible so that we had the protection should we have been pick pocketed. Just left of the hotel entrance is a large cafe called cappuccino which was open until about 1am and ideal for a night cap and cake. There is also a large cafe called Maximilan that sell drinks and food until late, we also ate here and enjoyed it. I would return to this hotel if I visit Barcelona again and would absolutely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “welness package is a fiction”
Reviews.Author: gullivertravel
Reviews.Content: Booked the montcada hotel as a christmas present based on the wellness package. I was really looking forward to the hotel and was bitterly disappointed. I recieved none of the extras that i had paid for as part of the package. No sparkling wine and fruit on the terrace, No bathrobe and slippers in the room, No aromatherapy session and the smallest room I have ever stayed in. I have never had to ring and wait at reception so much during a stay. Each rotated staff member just tried to pass the buck every time they were trying to sort out their mistakes. Very very frustrating and a ripped off experience.

Reviews.Title: “The H10 Montcada hotel is a garaunteed excellent time!!!”
Reviews.Author: Farfman
Reviews.Content: Our hotel stay was amazing...when we first arrived they offered us a glass of champagne and sat down with us to give us a map-tour of the city. They showed us some of the popular places and even some off the beaten path that were less touristy and more Spanish. We booked the pleasure suite which included a bottle of wine with dinner, 25% off Spa treatments and a free bottle of champagne with chocolate covered strawberries. The roof access is amazing and happened to be the place where i proposed to my now fiance'. The location is excellent as it has a cafe' on the corner and an organic shopping center half a block away. We pretty much were able to walk to anything & everything we wanted and if you wish to take the metro it is right across the street. On top of all of this the buffet breakfast has an amazing spread of tons of food from fruits and vegetables to all sorts of thinly sliced meats. The rooms are not HUGE but they are just right and we are able to control the temperature. There is great shower pressure and the hotel is very clean!! I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “H10 Montcada”
Reviews.Author: Beatts
Reviews.Content: There seems to be a massive difference in the rates charged for staying at this hotel so my advice would be to shop around and check out lots of different websites. I paid £199 for three nights room only which is not bad for a city centre hotel anywhere. The charge for breakfast was 15euros so we didn't bother as I thought that was really expensive. When we arrived there was obviously some problem with the room we had been allocated and we ended up in 205 which looked down onto the alleyway at the side of the hotel. This would not usually have bothered me but there was a large generator directly under our window that the porter informed me would be turned off that evening. It wasn't....... and it looks like its going to be there for a while so take some earplugs or be prepared to ask for a room change. Everything about the location has been said before .... it is perfect for exploring the city and quite safe at night. We had no problem with pickpockets but some of the side roads are a bit dark however there are loads of bars and restaurants within a few minutes walk. We didn't have any food at the hotel but the drinks were reasonably priced and there is a daily special of beer, sandwich / burger and a coffee for 6euros (ask for your burger well done they are quite pink).

Reviews.Title: “Love the Champagne!”
Reviews.Author: worldtraveler03Italy
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at H10 Montcada. The staff was extremely helpful with booking dinner reservations and a Flamenco show at Cordobes. They greeted us with Champagne and offered us a free bottle with fresh strawberries and cream for later in our stay. The breakfast buffet was ample. It had vegetarian options. The coffee was good. We judge a breakfast by the coffee. Nothing beats a good cup of coffee. Our room was a mini apartment. The seating area was seperate from the sleeping area and the bathroom was on the other side of the sitting room. It had two tvs and was very comfortable. We will definitely stay here again on our next visit to Barcelona!! The hotel is right across the street from the Juame I metro stop. Centrally located for everything.

Reviews.Title: “First Class”
Reviews.Author: MalViDroitwichWorcs
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Montcada for a 3 day break 18-21 November. Excellent location right in the heart of the Gothic area - within easy walking distance to numerous bars and restaurants. The hotel was excellent both the food quality, the staff and the layout. The City offical tour bus is the best way to see the city, its cheaper to get the 2 day pass, you can jump on and off as many times as you want. Don't expect to see everything in a couple of days be selective, plan ahead, the bus tends to get stuck in traffic alot of the time. If your going for a week or more there is plenty to see and do. A wonderful city with very friendly and helpful people, no problems encountered. Will be returning - ENJOY...

Reviews.Title: “Great Location !”
Reviews.Author: mimmiFinland
Reviews.Content: Very good place to visit. Hotel was clean, good atmosphere and quite helpful staff. The single room was spacious enough and the bathroom was bigger than a normal hotel bathroom. The only negative things were that 1. we could not get breakfast on the day we left (we had to leave just after 7 am and the buffet would start at 7). There was no possibility of going in earlier, even if all was set... 2. restaurant recommendations were poor. We asked for a nice steakhouse, we were suggested an "artsy" place with expensive food and limited menu. The steaks on the list were not even available!! I must agree on the other comments here; the sparkling wine when checking in was a big plus. And the beds are very hard :=)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location but a slight lack of client focus”
Reviews.Author: NicPF
Reviews.Content: This hotel has an excellent location, a superb top roof bar, nice staff with very good English and very nice rooms for the price. Normally it would have received a 4 star rating but there were two issues. One, they did not have our room ready as promised and tried to give us a first floor room with street noise and a view to an alley (instead of a bigger room on the eight floor with a spectacular view). Two, they wrote on our client card that breakfast was included and informed my wife when arriving in the morning, that it was not included but she could have breakfast for a *bargain* price of Euro 20. The breakfast was indeed not included in the room rate but I except a hotel to honor their mistakes. Otherwise this hotel would indeed be a four star rating.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: JLHBelfast
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this very centrally located hotel for 4 nights October 2008. Easy access to Las Ramblas and Gothic Quarter. On a main road, which we didnt find noisy as we were on 8th floor. Metro, Tour Bus, taxi rank and Starbucks within 2 min walk. The Port is 5 minute brisk walk. Barcelona Cathedral is directly opposite. Hotel staff were very friendly and very helpful. We had breakfast every morning, which was very fresh with a great selection of cold meats/cheeses, fresh fruit, cooked breakfast and pastries. We had dinner one night in the hotel, fresh, reasonably priced, small portions (but typical for Barcelona). Our room was small, bathroom well-sized. We didnt spend much time there so the size didnt bother us at all. No tea/coffee facilities, not sure if we were meant to have these, we didnt ask anyhow. Roof top terrace has lovely views of city, windy but pleasant to sit in sun. Didnt use Spa faciilities but seemed reasonably priced and you get 25% discount on arrival. Free internet and computers in reception. Hotel very clean, tastefully decorated, free safety deposit box in room. We couldnt fault our stay at this hotel, was perfectly located (away from las ramblas but easily accessible), clean, good food and lovely staff. Would stay here again and would recommend it to others. If you want to try Tapas, highly recommend Cal Pep in Place de Olles, 5-10 min walk from hotel. Opens at 8 on weeknights, expensive but a great experience!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Superb Location”
Reviews.Author: Pfeiffer
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 4 nights at the Montcada. Lots of great things to say about it: We weren't sure about where to be based in the city and plumped for somewhere in the Old Town. The Montcada was an excellent choice therefore and it was in easy walking of the Ramblas, Placa Cataluna and near lots of good eateries, shops etc. The nearest metro was across the road. Having got to know the city a little bit, we were glad we didn't stay elsewhere because it meant that we could wonder 'home' late at night without an unnecessarily long trip or using taxi's or other transport. The location also felt safe (safer than Ramblas anyway). We met an English couple who were staying on the Ramblas and after 4 days their impression of Barcelona was that it was 'seedy'. I think this is because they started and ended their days on the Ramblas and spent loads of time there, and it wasn't our impression at all, excpet that like most city's there are seedier areas. The hotel is lovely, clean and efficient. We got a great internet rate which included breakfast for E5 (euros) pp and the bottle of cava and fruit. We weren't going to have the breakfast included thinking we would eat it out everyday, but were really glad we did and at that price. The breakfast buffet is the best I have ever seen in any hotel. Lots of fresh fruit, pastries, cereals, juices, cheese's, meats, hot food etc. It set us up for the day and stopped us having to wonder the streets looking for somewhere (and stopped my partner being irritable with me waiting for me to be ready - because he could get started without me!!). The room is clean and the bathroom was lovely and supplied with lots of toiletries. We were expecting the room to be TINY after the reviews I had read. Whilst it wasn't the largest hotel room in the world, it was absolutely fine, consisting of a double bed, 2 sideboards, built-in wardrobe. a desk, chair, TV, mini-bar. We were out most of the time and only used it for sleeping and washing, and if you wanted to hang out there were other lounges in the hotel where you could do so. The only thing I would have wanted in the room was a decently comfortable armchair...sadly lacking in many hotel rooms. The maid put fresh flowers in the room on day 2 and when the vase broke was super efficient and friendly about clearing it. In fact all the hotel staff were friendly and they all spoke English. Check in and out was simple and they held our luggage on the last day while we went to see the last of the city. The only problem I had with this was that they photocopied our credit card on check-in and took our credit card details twice and I had to ask for the copy of the first time they did it which was done incorrectly. I don't think we had been conned at all, just that we are more rigorous in the UK about these things. Thankfully we weren't pickpocketed or anything else like that. When we were checking out at the hotel a couple came in looking distressed and said someone had just taken something from their backpack. The receptionist told us this is a regular occurrance and the pickpockets can 'smell' when they will have a success. The hotel literature mentioned that someone throwing things at your shirt and saying you have a stain is a common way to pickpocket. We 'wore' bags across our body rather than backpacks and were obviously cautious...and probably lucky. The best restaurant we found was La Fonda near the hotel...ask the hotel for directions. All the meals we had were good, if expensive. La Fonda was good food, good prices, good service and long queues. All in all we were worn out by Barcelona...Park Guell, Picasso Museum, Miro Foundation, Barcelonetta, the two Gaudi houses, cathedral, familia sagrada, shopping, eating and drinking. The hotel helped us to stay relaxed and rested. Oh BTW, good views from the hotel terrace, but very expensive mohito's from there!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location in old town”
Reviews.Author: JohnTh29
Reviews.Content: Great location for historical areas, chic hotel with friendly reception staff, and now has small restaurant in Lobby (and room service), but be warned service can take 45 minutes or more ! Excellent roof top terrace with Jacuzzi .

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: KarenPW002
Reviews.Content: Fabulous hotel, great staff, great value!! We stayed for three nights on a 3 for 2 offer. We had already stayed in Paris and London before arriving in Barcelona, and having paid roughly the same for all three expected H10 to be much like the others - liveable but nothing to write home about. Comparatively speaking, H10was excellent! The rooms were clean, fresh and comfortable. We had champagne on arrival and I can imagine that the spa and rooftop bar would be fantastic in summer. The only problem we had with the room was that it was located next to an alleyway where an inebriated youth appeared to have misplaced his trusty friend 'Perro' - proceeding to call for him into the wee small hours! I was both fascinated and amazed by the myriad of ways "Perro" can be enunciated!!

Reviews.Title: “Great spot to see Barcelona from”
Reviews.Author: WelshCouple13
Reviews.Content: The hotel Montcada in Barcelona is situated five minutes from the Ramblas, and is right next door to the old city walls, within sight of the old Cathedral. It's certainly a superb view to take in of an evening from the roof-top bar... The harbour is only a 10 minute walk away, where you can find some excellent restaurants and smashing views. The staff at the hotel were extremely friendly and welcoming, recommending good restaurants and generally being very attentive. Rooms are reasonably small, but this is to be expected in a City centre hotel. They are well equipped, clean and well maintained. The room windows are double-glazed, so despite sitting on the Via Laietana you are not overly disturbed by the passing traffic. We didn't eat at the hotel (other than breakfast - a treat!), but heard good reports of the food there. Prices for food and drinks seemed very reasonable, with happy hour cocktails for 6 Euros a pop. All in all I'd recommend it to a visitor who's keen to be at the heart of the action.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: xxamziexx
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Montcada for 2 nights in August we got a taxi from the Airport which cost us 25 Euros but this was with 4 bags you pay more the more luggage you have. On arrival at the hotel we were greeted with a glass of cava as all guests are. We had a room on the second floor which was quiet small but great for what we needed if for. The location of this hotel is fantastic it is just over the road from the Metro which are really easy to use and great for getting around. Its around a 5 minute walk to the rambles and there are loads of places to eat and drink along the way. It can be a bit noisy on a night due to the location but once you get used to it its fine. The rooftop bar is really nice to sit and have a drink although its quiet expensive but your on holiday! We went to a Barcelona match which was amazing and we did the hop on hop off book tour which is also great value. Only wish we had more time 2 nights was not enough but we went onto Salou after Barcelona which was really easy. Would love to go back and would stay in this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Great service, location, breakfast”
Reviews.Author: capswolde
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in great location. Rooms are small, avoid rooms with7 or 10, they are cupboards not rooms. We got 707, we went to change and were moved next day to 302. A very nce room. It seems all rooms in spain are small. Bed was hard but bathroom was excellent. Service was first class, they were helpful and polite. Breakfast is excellent. Rooftop bar and spa area is lovely, drinks a bit expensive but it is a hotel. Close to subway so get train from airport and save youself 25 euro each way for taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: foxyrod
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this Hotel for a 5 day break and couldn't fault it. We booked it as a package and considering the location, modern apperance, cleanliness and helpful staff I believe it represents great value for money. Our room was on the 'inside' of the building - this sacrificed the view of the busy Via Laeitina for that of a narrow court yard but we had no problem with this as it meant that it was amazingly quiet at all times of the day and night. The room was very well furnished with two flat screen TV's (one in the small 'lounge' area and another in the bedroom, a spacious bath and shower room and plenty of wardrobe space. Certainly, the particular room we were in was of a perfectly adequate size for a short break and I have to say could have stopped in our room much longer without any problems. The room also featured a a modern digital safe (free), a fairly efficient air-con system and a mini-bar. The furnishings were very up to date and very stylish. Maid Service was excellent and the room was spotlessly clean. The hotel is in a great location with lots of great restaurants, bars and shops near by, in addition to the Cathedral, Las Ramblas and a stop for the Tourist Bus which is just up the road. As part of our stay we were entitled to a free bottle of Cava which we drank on the fabulous roof-top terrace whilst the sun went down over Barcelona's fabulous skyline. If you get the same standard of room that we were in...book this hotel...it's a great place.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and nice staff”
Reviews.Author: Maryam_UK
Reviews.Content: We've just got back from Barcelona and staying at this hotel. It was very well located and easy to get around Barcelona from. The hotel staff were all very friendly (we got a free glass of Cava on arrival) and spoke perfect English. They were also helpful when trying to sort out the safe in our room as it wasn't working and allowed us to use their safe. The room was slightly on the small side and the bed wasn't very comfortable but it was overall very clean. The air conditioning in our room didn't seem to keep the room cool enough for Mid-July. The included breakfast with the room was very impressive, with lots of different things to choose from including a hot buffet and lots of fresh fruit and cakes. We also ate in the restaurant one night where we were given a free glass of Cava again and the three course fixed rate menu was good and very filling, for just 20 Euros. Make sure you visit the new roof-top bar at night for some amazing views. The staff also allowed us to store our luggage in a safe place for a whole day while we explored the city for the last time before heading back to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Little value for money”
Reviews.Author: Ed-ze-frog
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Montcada in July 2008 with friends. Location is fantastic and roof top bar is worth the visit. However, twin rooms were charmless and very small, beds were mildly comfortable; I do not think that they deserve £100 ($200) asked per night per room (without breakfast) even in peak season. Avoid rooms on Via Laietana as the avenue is very noisy. Rooms on lower floors have a poor view, so ask for rooms on upper floors. Staff was friendly but in some instance not helpful. Free internet access is offered.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: shelleyf
Reviews.Content: This hotel was reasonably priced, so my expectations were not too high but I am pleased to say they were far surpassed. The hotel was stylish, staff were not only courteous and friendly but extremely helpful. Our room was a twin and of good size. It was clean and comfortable. The breakfast was lovely, with a choice of fruits, continental or english breakfast, all within the price. As we were there for a birthday, the hotel looked at the passport details and a bottle of bubbly was delivered to the room courtesy of the hotel. The roof terrace was small but great for a spot of sunbathing or drink in the evening, and the view from up there was spectaular. As you can expect in the city the traffic can be heard, especially in the lower rooms. Would happily return to this hotel. Great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have been better!”
Reviews.Author: clarierose
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the H10 for 3 nights last week and could not have been happier. We had been told that there were mostly twin rooms in the hotel, however we were given a double-room which we were pleased about. The location of the hotel is perfect - walking distance to everything you could want to see. The staff were friendly - particularly liked the touch of a glass of Cava on arrival, and were able to help with all requests and questions. The room was great - we had a room at the front of the hotel, however on the top floor, so noise was not an issue. The room was not large, but had everything that we needed and was never cramped. The bathroom was good also. We particularly liked the roof terrace - make sure that access to this is included in your stay. A great place for a drink or just to enjoy the sun and read, and fantastic views of Barcelona. The breakfast - which was included in our rate - was great: fresh fruit, hot dishes, breads, cold meats and cheeses, cereals, fresh pastries and juices - everything that you could wish for. The only slightly disappointing aspect was the room service - this did not start until 10.30am and then when we ordered dinner to our room we waited quite a while and received 2 compeltely wrong dishes. But in a city with such amazing eating it serves us right for getting room service!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JAS2008
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at the H10 Montcada Hotel despite the fact that it was a little noisy - it's located on a busy main road in Barcelona. However it was central to the main sights and attractions in the city. It's an easy place to get around - we walked about 45 miles in 4 days during which we experienced the real atmosphere of the city which we would not have done had we taken public transport everwhere. The people were lovely - very friendly and helpful. We realised though that March was "maintenance month" as some of the things we wanted to do and lots of the fountains were either being renovated or simply weren't operating. There is a vast array of places to eat and whilst everyone says that it's a real pick pocket area we didn't feel threatened at all. It's the same as any other city in the world - you just need to be mindful of what you do with your belongings. We had a fantastic city break and we would recommend it to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: HSE
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this Hotel from 19th March for 3 nights. Taxi from the airport was about 28 euro's (this included 4 suit cases) I think it's about 3 euros per bag. On arrival we enjoyed a glass of cava and our bags were taken to our room. One thing to mention was that the reception asked for a credit card to swipe incase of damages/mini bar etc. I was not aware of this and had I not have taken my CC card they wanted 30 euros cash for each day! A lot of money to lay out of your spending money so be aware of that. Our room was on the 2nd floor and was TINY and i'm not over exaggerating, I actually gasped when I walked in! I asked for a larger room but was told we would be on the front of the hotel where it is very noisy so we just stayed put and enjoyed 3 quiet nights. When I passed other rooms on the corridor there were some huge rooms so it is possible to get a large room if you prefer. The bathroom was a good size though with excellent shower. There was no safe in our room and we were told this is the case in some rooms, however as we were with other people we used their safe so it was not a problem for us but it maybe if you are alone. The location of the Hotel in my opinion cannot be beat, metro straight outside the door which we never used! The Hotel is very central and we took taxi's to Sagarda Familia (8 euro) and from there Parc Guell. Once we got our bearings we found there were some short cuts up to La Rambla and Catalunya Square etc. One word of warning avoid the narrow street to the left of the Hotel when you come out the front door as we heard of pick pockets operating in that area. If you can brave it there is a lovely jacuzzi outside on the top floor and a really nice lounge area which I can imagine is very popular in the summer months. The bar area of the Hotel is very pleasant for a drink on an evening and I particularly enjoyed the free internet on offer. Breakfast was fantastic with everything you could wish for. Feel free to ask any questions. Another Hotel which looked great just up the street was Grand Central but I am unsure as to the cost compared to the H10 Montcada. P.S Do not miss the Magic Fountains on Fri/Sat evenings!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, wobbly wi-fi”
Reviews.Author: MercerChow
Reviews.Content: I spent 5 nights at the H10 Montcada in March 2008. While not perfect, it was fine and I would stay there again. The location is central, right by the Jaume I Metro station. It’s about a ten-minute walk to Placa Catalunya, where there is a great variety of subway and train service. Ten minutes in the opposite direction and you are at the waterfront. I had a room on the sixth floor, on the corner (room 603). It was not huge but adequate, with two twin beds and, yes, the mattresses were firm. The downside of being above a subway station is that you are above a subway station. I could hear and feel the rumble on the sixth floor, but I didn’t lose any sleep. I was pleased that when I arrived first thing in the morning they had a room for me. Your results may vary, but at least they did not make me wait until the official check-in time. The front desk staff were fine at all times. The shower was good with plenty of hot water and pressure. I did not try the fitness center. My biggest semi-complaint regards the wi-fi. (I say only a semi-complaint because I was not expecting wi-fi at all, so whatever they had was a bonus.) My room was on the fringe of the sixth floor signal. Sometimes it was good, but other times I had to sit on the (uncarpeted) floor right by the door in order to pick it up.

Reviews.Title: “Best location in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: brni
Reviews.Content: Stayed 6-9 March 2008 Had requested a double room, however on arrival reception staff advised us that double room allocated was quite small with no view and suggested that we would be better with room 203 which had twin beds. We took this room which was excellent large corner room with balcony. View to left was of port and to right was towards cataluyna square, across was side wall of cathedral. Hotel location was convenient to all attractions . The hotel reception, bar and restaurant staff were the most helpful and knowledgeable we have ever encountered, taking time to advise on the best methods of travel to the various attractions and pointing out metro and other transport options on our maps. The huge breakfast included fresh fruits ,cereal, full english and continental choices followed by delicious cakes and pastries. We had an evening meal in the restaurant which was served with equal standard of great service value and food quality. Overall a well appointed hotel with great friendly staff in perfect location. In city centre so dont expect tranquility.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but small room!”
Reviews.Author: RosieFlynn
Reviews.Content: I stayed here last year and thought it was OK, nothing special, but did the job. The staff at reception were a bit surly and did a quick check-in and sent me off to my room.. The room was probably one of the smallest I have stayed in, however, I was traveling alone, so thie wasn't much of a problem. The bathroom was a good size, tub with over head shower. For me the location is the best feature of this hotel, you are near a few of the tourist attractions, just a short walk to the harbour and lots of restaurants and bars around. I vist Barcelona twice a year for work and am still in search of a hotel that ticks all the boxes....including price!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel !”
Reviews.Author: bignut
Reviews.Content: Just back from a three night stay at the Montcada in Barcelona with my partner and can highly recommend it ! We arrived on Sunday March 2nd and were warmly greeted at reception by two staff, one of whom gave us each a glass of champagne by way of welcome ! We had booked with HOTELSCLICK.COM and chosen the room only option, so can't comment on the breakfast which could have been purchased separately, but which we declined to do. It pays to shop around online, as some sites were over £100 dearer for the same booking, so we were glad that we went with this company. I had read previous reviews on TRIPADVISOR, and common complaints ranged from the room being too small to it being too noisy. While it is true that the room we had was a shade on the small side, with an admittedly unusual aspect of having a fairly large shower cubicle instead of a bath, we were more than happy with it. As for the noise factor, I do wonder what people look for when they knowingly book a city centre hotel. Our room was at the front on the first floor, and while traffic was heavy during the day as you would expect, at night it eased off considerably and with the double glazed window fully shut, traffic noise, while still prevalent, was at such levels not to interfere with a good night's sleep, and this from one who practically needs total silence and complete darkness to get one ! As for the location, it is in an ideal spot for the tourist attractions of this wonderful city ! Don't waste money on taxis ! We got the bus from Barcelona airport to Plaza Catalunya (€4.10 p.p !) and simply walked straight down the road to the bottom where the hotel is situated, taking only 10 minutes to do so. Admittedly we only had one small suitcase with us for such a short stay. Las Ramblas is less than a 5 minute stroll away and you don't need to venture far for a great abundance of really nice restaurants for your evening meal. Staff, be it at reception, or in the bar area in the foyer, were nothing other than well mannered and pleasant and were a credit to their hotel. A small, but nevertheless important plus point for all you websurfers out there, is that internet access in the foyer is free, unlike all other hotels I have been in which charge a nominal fee for ten minutes usage. All in all this is an excellent choice for visitors to Barcelona, particularly those on a short city break as we were and I can't recommend it highly enough !

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but alot of street noise”
Reviews.Author: IrelandGracie27
Reviews.Content: Myself and my boyfriend stayed here in September 07. The location was fantastic, right by the Cathedral and El Borne and a short walk to La Rambla. There was also a Metro stop opposite the hotel. The downfall for this hotel was firstly the street noise. As the hotel is located on a busy street i found it very difficult to sleep without ear plugs (and im not a light sleeper). So ask for a room at the back. The other downside was our bed was hard as a rock. Im not fussy about hotel rooms, etc as you spend very little time in them when on a weekend break but a comfy bed is a must. Everything else at the hotel was lovely, staff etc we were even greeted with a glass of champagne on our arrival. Breakfast was also good with a good selection. Overall a nice hotel apart from the above

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: kydubb
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights at the H10 Montcada. The Aerobus from the airport to Placa Catalunya was convenient and a good deal for 4.10 euro . Arriving early on Sunday morning, we decided to skip the metro and walked the rest of the way. We quickly realized how centrally located the hotel was. While this was the smallest hotel room we have ever stayed in, it was well laid out, functional and comfortable. We had a room on the 7th floor facing the street. There was some street noise but the view was great. Waking up every morning and seeing the Cathedral and Roman Wall just across the street was amazing. The church bells start at 6am and the city literally comes to life. The location is perfect if you want to explore the Gothic area. The port and the Parc de la Ciutadella are only a 10 minute walk. The Jaume metro station is right outside the hotel and there are numerous restaurants, cafes and bakeries near by. Barcelona is a wonderful city for walking. We walked 6-8 miles each day and the breakfast buffet helped keep us satisfied until we took a break for tapas in the afternoon. They offer a large selection of fresh fruits, cereals, meats, cheeses and pasteries. If all you need is a roll and a cup of coffee, save a few euro and go to a cafe. The staff was friendly, helpful and most spoke English.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: MrandMrsTink
Reviews.Content: Great hotel right in the heart iof the gothic quarter and accross from the cathedral. I had a birthday there and having champange on the roof top in the jacuzzi was fab! Staff are very friendly and helpful with information regarding transport etc. Rooms are modern and clean.

Reviews.Title: “some noise!!”
Reviews.Author: mp1
Reviews.Content: Still here going home tomorrow after 3 nights, i feel my bed is in the middle of the street, it´s now 1.30 am and the noise of the traffic on the street is unbelievable!!. However the location is good and breakfast provides plenty of choice so it compensates a little. Rooftop is a sight to behold especially if the sun is shining! Bar is closed at 12 so if you go out for dinner look elsewhere for a nightcap or else use the mini bar. If you plan to stay here bring earplugs or look for a room at the back of the hotel

Reviews.Title: “just the job!”
Reviews.Author: neilius
Reviews.Content: Clean, modern rooms, friendly staff, perfect location. Can't fault my Barcelona experience!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel, Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Joebella
Reviews.Content: I have just come back form a long weekend away in Barcelona with my friend. We stayed at H10 Montcada for 3 nights and it was brilliant! On arrival we were greeted by the friendly staff and were giving a glass of champagne each, the foyer and bar in the entrance area look extremely posh. The only downside we dfound, was that after our breath being taken away by the downstairs and entrance of the hotel, we were slightly disappointed with our rooms as they were quite small and basic and did not match the elegance of the entrance. However, we were out all day and only slept and got changed in the rooms and did not find them too small for 2 people moving around and getting ready in them. We had only paid for the room so did not have any meals included. However, you could pay 15 euros for the buffet breakfast, which we did one morning. The restaurant area downstairs matched the elgance of the bar area in the entrance. The food was gorgeous and you had a good selection of hot foods, fruits, and pastries, juices etc. The hotels location is perfect, it is on one of the main sreets in Barcelona and is opposite the Catedral de la Seu, withing easy walking distance of the Bari Gotic area and Las Ramblas. The best way to see the sights is on the Bus Turistic, and there is a stop for the blue route just down the road from the hotel, and you can also get on this to transfer to the red route to see the sights in the north of the city, the tickets cost 20 euros for one day and 26 euros for 2 and you can get on and off as you please, its a brilliant way to see the city. The staff were also extremely friendly and helpful, and could not do enough to help. We had an excellent stay here and would definately go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel & Location”
Reviews.Author: monroe8
