Reviews.Content: stayed in this hotel 1901/08 for 3 nites, the hotel was great the staff were excellent, couldnt have done enough for us, on arrival we received a complimentry glass of cava which was lovely! our rooms were on the 3rd floor our room was bigger than our friends but only because it had wheel chair excess , the bathroom was great and a bonus was the hotel left , free toothbrushes, mini shavin kits, shoe shine kits, sewing kits, shampoo rtc, even cologne! the rooms have a mini bar and wasnt over priced like some hotels, for example a small bottle of cava was only 4.60 euros which was good and a bottle of water was 1.85 euros, the hotel has a restaurant we didnt eat in it but the menus displayed seemed good and good price, we did eat breakfast on the last day and they even gave us a half price voucher so for 2 of us it was 8.99 euros, which was brillant. overall the hotel was great and they had a roof top sun bathing area and bar with a jacuzzi we couldnt use it as it would of been a bit cold, but the views were amazing!!!! cant rate the hotel enough we check reviews of hotels when we go away, so we know how important it is to read up so hope this helps , also theres a cofffee bar across the road form the hotel which is great for baquettes, crossiant, pastries, lattes coffees etc, it was lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Great central location, but Tiny rooms with rock-like beds”
Reviews.Author: Vic_Vivant
Reviews.Content: My 2nd trip to Barcelona in so many weeks for business, the oddly named H10 hotel was right in the heart of the town centre. The front desk staff were extremely helpful and polite overall. But that's about all the pluses. The room was literally the size of a large-ish walk-in closet and minute interior window. When asked for a larger room, at first I was told nothing was available, but when pushed, the staff escorted me to a slightly larger room with a double bed. At least in this room, you could turn around and have space to put your suitcase. However, the bed was hard as a rock (even for someone who prefers a firm mattress this was a bit too granite-like), also there no space to work as there was no desk, no chairs - nothing but a bed, and a small mini-bar wedged into the corner by the bed. Breakfast was sad and lacklustre, with no English papers available (I was told they would come in around noon.) So if you don't mind the lack of comfort and amenties, and just want to stay in hub of the hustle and bustle of Barcelona - it's an ok place to stay. Otherwise, proabably best to try another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: ANNA77Uk
Reviews.Content: Excellent location between El Born and the Gothic quarter. Lots of restaurants nearby and right across the road from the underground. Not far to walk to airport bus stop. Rooms are small but fine for what you pay, can be noisy, but isn't everywhere in Barcelona's old quarters!

Reviews.Title: “brilliant hotel location etc”
Reviews.Author: LondonRaz
Reviews.Content: Myself and partner have just returned from a weekend breck in this exalent hotel. from the moment you arrive until departure staff are freindly welcoming and helpful all good english, alot of guest were english speaking also.did not have dinner at hotel as nothing realy caught are eye breackfast was great buffet style not far from ramblas either, we arrived in reus airport tought getting their would be alot of hassel but it was painless. once you cross the road your in shopping heaven.. take a right outside hotel walk straight and you will end up in las rambles we only discovered this last night had been walkin trough side streets which was fine but took a bit longer.Also travel inn pub got the best food large plate of chips topped of with kingsize burger only 11euro for 2 and 2 drinks big difference to 68 for somethin that wud not fill you..To get their cross at hotel walk straight at all side streets on right hand side at tabacco shop also if ya get their at 8 it costs only 1euro..down side streets at back of hotel is a cool irish bar staff are very freindly alot of warnings about pick pocketing etc luckly nothin happened but seemed to be a big thing so beware of that. Roof top terrece is a must at hotel glass of cava on arrival could not ask for more {no smoking hotel }

Reviews.Title: “deadly spot”
Reviews.Author: maryng23
Reviews.Content: Hotel H10 Montcada was in a perfect location, less than five minute walk from Las Rambles (straight up the little side street across from the hotel). We arrived at 11am so we were a little early for the free glass of bubbly, we were told to ask for it later, but we didnt bother, nice idea though. Room was an little small, but we didnt paln on spending our holiday in it, so we didnt mind. Nice clean facilities, well stocked mini bar and loads of soap, shampoo, sewing kit..etc.. The roof top terrace was nice, great views of the city, but a little cold for a dip in the jacuzzi (early dec). Breakfast buffet was excellent, great variety and choice. My only fault is when ordering tea in the bar, Tea for one consisted of a pot of tea, tea for two a night later (from the same waiter) also consisted of the same size pot of tea but twice the price. I should have said something, but we were tired and just wanted to sit down and drink the tea so I let it go, other than that its a good spot, i would definetly go back there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: CorH
Reviews.Content: Myself and My Husband stayed here for our first anniversary in Jan 2006. We enjoyed every minute of it. A nice glass of cava and strawberries on arrival. The room though not big was perfect, nice and clean with a very comfortable bed. The bathroom was beautiful and very spacious. The location of the Hotel is excellent, very central and easy to walk everywhere. The hop on hop off tour bus stops right outside so its a great way to see all the sights. The buffet breakfast was great and filled you up till dinner. I would definately recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Pixelated
Reviews.Content: Friendly and comfortable hotel in a fantastic location - brilliant as a base for exploring the gothic quarter. Good views from the roof terrace too.

Reviews.Title: “SUPERB EXPERIENCE IN BARCELONA”
Reviews.Author: HODDITANDDODDIT
Reviews.Content: Hotel very Central and glass of cava on arrival which is a nice touch. If you choose a Pleasure room you get a bottle of cava and stawberries or melon dipped in chocolate to have at some point during your stay. Worthwhile asking to have them on the Roof terrace which has excellent views over the city and comfortable rattan furniture with luxurious cushions. Another nice touch is fleecy blankets are provided on the roof top terrace to keep you warm in late evening. You can also hire the roof top jacuzzi for a nominal sum and have your Cava there, complete with rose petals for a romantic touch, robes and slippers are provided for this experience. Excellent breakfast which will set you up for the day. Staff excellent and keen to please. 5 mins from Las Ramblas, 5 mins from Marina, lots of super restaurants within 5 min walk. Only downside, request room on higher floors as underground runs under hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Viceliz
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 2 nights, from check-in the hotel was brilliant. Amazing roof terrace with jacuzzi and beautiful views across the city and to the sagrada familia. The rooms are a good size for a city-hotel and the bathroom is modern and clean. The breakfast is a brilliant spread with loads to choose from in the modern restaurant. The hotel is about a five minute walk to La Rambla and you can choose so many different routes to walk you find something new every time! All in all this hotel is a brilliant 4 star very centrally located, would definatly recommend to everyone!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Carol Louise
Reviews.Content: The hotel was brilliant from arrival to departure. The staff are friendly and really helpful and speak excellent English! Check in was quick and the glass of chilled cava was an excellent touch. The rooms are small but then you don't go to a city to stay in your hotel room! The bathroom was one of the best we've ever seen. We didn't have any meals included but found no end of cafes and restaurants within easy walking distance. We had dinner in the hotel restrurant one night which was out of this world, the grilled goats cheese was the best I've ever eaten. The views from the roof terrace were stunning, especially at sunset. Overall the hotel is perfect and we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location!”
Reviews.Author: Cazzan
Reviews.Content: Hotel Montcada was lovely! I stayed here on a city break with a friend in october. Its a great location and we were able to walk to most places. Its about a 10 min stroll from Las Ramblas and right by a metro station. The hotel has a lovely roof terrace which would be great in summer! With a bar up there and jacuzzi. Our room was nice, although our view was straight into someones office in the next building! Not a problem though as were hardly in our room. The bathroom was lovely - one of the nicest hotel bathrooms I've ever stayed in! We didnt have breakfast included, but you can have breakfast in the hotel at extra cost, or a coffee and croissant in the bar. However there is a great cafe opposite which does amazing cakes and lovely hot chocolate! :-)

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: donnerkebab
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel in a fantastic location near the port and ramblas area. Dont book if you are spending time in your room as it is no bigger than a cupboard with no sky television, saying that it is comfortable and clean and ok for sleeping in. Warm welcome by the reception staff and a very welcome glass of chilled cava on arrival. Fantastic roof top terrace with slightly erratic opening hours and poor service(gave up waiting) All in a very nice little hotel and minus the small negatives i would definatley stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fab hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Cheeves
Reviews.Content: we stayed in the Montcada for three nights and found it fantastic. The staff were very helpful, our friends had difficulty with their safe and tv in their room-only minor problems but they werent sure how to fix them- so reception was contacted and an engineer came immediately and rectified the problem in no time at all! The roof terace is absolutely gorgeous the view from it is gorgeous, the bar has a great variety, service is excellent. The room was lovely, very clean and modern with a lovely modern bathroom. The only negative aspect was the room size (apparently typical of barcelona city hotels). It was very small and the window doesnt open, so with no natural air (you have to rely on the ACon) or natural light (as the room faced out to a courtyard type structure , facing the other side of the hotel so it stays dark) my slightly claustropohobic other half wasnt overjoyed!! breakfast was included for us and the selection was great. All in all, a fab hotel with helpful,polite staff and I would highly recommend it to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: NorwayTnk
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel with a great location. Rooms were kind of small but very well equipped, spotlessy clean and the bathrooms are gorgeous! Very friendly and helpful staff and great breakfast buffet. The top terrace with a view of the city is a nice touch. Will definately stay there again if we return to Barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “A disapontment, expensive, noisy and no service.”
Reviews.Author: Annastiina
Reviews.Content: I asked many times for a better room because I couldn´t sleep in that noise. I have never been in a hotel like this; very expensive and no service!

Reviews.Title: “I hope I paid that much for the location, the room certainly wasn't worth it.”
Reviews.Author: Mr_Cellophane
Reviews.Content: Booked 2 rooms for 2 nights through [--] Paid £80 for a double and £70 for a single room per night B&B. Room 707 was about 9 ft square and had a full bathroom. The window looked out on to an internal light well, so was dark most of the time. The lights in the room were not very good at illuminating the room even with them all on. There was a fridge which unfortunately made the room warm. There was a range of toiletries including razor and toothbrush. None were not replaced for the second day. The door did not close very well, so we had to make sure it was shut properly. Room 710 had a view to the north of the city so was much brighter, but slightly smaller. The bathroom here only had a shower, basin and toilet. This room also did not have a fridge. There was a notice in the room advising us that there is usually a queue for breakfast between 9:00 and 10:00. This was not a problem for us, but there are very few tables for 4 so we had to sit apart on the first morning. Breakfast was fried egg, bread beans, bacon and mushrooms, a large selection of cheeses and meats, pastries and various fruits. The location was excellent, just across from the cathedral and near the Jaume 1 metro station.

Reviews.Title: “Small Little Gem”
Reviews.Author: andeth9
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel, upon seeing some of the reviews on tripadvisor. This hotel is in the perfect location for to visit the city, smack bang in the middle and prime location to visit all the attractions and walk around the city. The metro is literally a one minute walk the second you step outside the doors. The location was the main reason for booking this hotel. Now, the hotel itself... The hotel was great, really loved it, we knew before we went there that the rooms were small and they really are, but that never put us off as they are very nice, kept really clean and have air conditioning (which is a must to survive). They have a free safety deposit box which is always a helpful thing, wardrobes are a fine size, bed comfortable, tv in the room, minibar and the bathroom is a good size with plenty of space and a hairdryer there too. The hotel staff were really great and very friendly and have good English. The hotel has a 9th floor terrace bar which is great really loved it, has a great view of the city and do a good mojito, the bar staff are always there to let you sit and relax and do a quick run around to see if anyone wants drinks every so often. I would recommend getting the breakfast included as there wouldn't really be a place around for breakfast in the morning and the breakfasts are a nice continental mixture.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, great rooftop, disinterested service”
Reviews.Author: traveller85
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at the H10 Montcada for 4 nights and it was mostly good. The location is superb. It is on the edge of two districts: Born and Barri Gotic, so whichever way you can't go wrong. We arrived separately, as we took different flights and on arrival we were not offered any Cava as everyone else seemed to get, nor any helpful advice or maps. This wasn't the warm welcome we expected to get. Perhaps they thought that two 23 year old girls wouldn't spend as much on the services as older couples and weren't worth the effort. The room was nice and clean, but the beds were very hard and uncomfortable. We stayed in 2 other hotels in Barcelona and the beds were comparably divine. There was a very nice view from the room and while it was on the small side, the bathroom was large and spotless and there was even a copy of Barcelona Style and Spanish Elle. The roof-top terrace is the jewel of the hotel and it boasts a fantastic view over Barcelona and you can even see as far as the Sagrada Familia. We didn't have a drink there because we were out and about, but it looks like a very comfortable and stylish place to start your night. On the whole a good place to stay and a great base to explore the city. To get the best service, try to look like you're on your honeymoon and flashing your wallet wouldn't hurt either.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a Central Location”
Reviews.Author: Topdog35
Reviews.Content: I took my partner here for a 4 day trip for her 30th Birthday, It was the first time i had been to this part of spain, and thought it would be something "different". This is a great friendly hotel, staff are helpful and always cheerful. I booked it through lastminute.com (as it was cheaper than direct oddly enough), and the flights i sorted seperately (morning inbound, evening outbound) It's nothing like your typical package holiday hotel, and eminates a certain level of classiness, glorious marble floors and surroundings with modern looks befitting the younger/middle age generation. Being greeted by a glass of Cava was a nice touch on our arrival. Breakfasts are amazing with a wide variety of dishes available (although someone should teach the spanish how to make scrambled eggs :P - but this isn't limted to this hotel alone and seems to be a "spanish" trait). The only small item which took the shine off this is that we where placed in a 1st floor room and the walk in shower leaked out onto the floor and into the bedroom area. The hotel staff new about this and where happy enough to supply additional towels to clean this up, but I am not sure if it was just limited to this room, adn i thought ti could have recieved a better response. We plumped for the Jacuzzi option and I can say was thoroughly enjoyable (although cold as hell). Roof terrace is amazing, with fantasic views, drinks up there can be a tad expensive, but it's worth it just for the view/environment, and serves well as a pre curser to going out for dinner. You will find that Barcelona is more expensive than other spanish areas, and this seems to be the case in Barca in general; more so if you spend time on the Ramblas (so try to steer clear when eating). There are a few really nice restaurants in the area, and most don't generally open until about 20:30 onwards. It isn't unusual here to eat late and everywhere doesnt really come alive until post 10:30 anyway, and in some places, post midnight. If you really like seafood try El Chipiron in Port Vell (by Mare Magnum), an outside table (upstairs) overlooking the bay is a real treat, cost varies, but at a minimum is about 25-30 Euro each for a main meal/drink, and increases as you go more towards the platters (but these can be shared as they are huge), there are also options for the less adventurous (chicken, lamb etc). La Fonda in the Gothic Quarter is great too (on E'scudellers), although be prepared to queue if you arrive post 10pm (this is apparently a typical sign of a good restaurant so you will find a few places like this). Three Courses and a bottle of wine here is about 50 Euro, so its well worth it if you want "bang for buck" and the food is fantastic. Try to steer clear of Placa Reial at night (or more so the part where you enter from the Ramblas), as there can be a few "undesirables" hanging around in large groups (supposedly Algerian immigrants), and you need to be a little more aware of whos around you. Make sure you keep hold of your belongings, there were a few occasions where it was apparant we were being followed, but as long as you know whats going on you should be ok. Once thing i will say is that for me personally the nightlife was better than the day, but it is very centered around dinner, wine a few beers and relaxing rather than the traditional pub scene (i guess thats because there is a large amount of walking to be done during the day) but if you want that, there are a few Irish Bars around which are always good too. Also, don't get too worried if you get some strange stares from the locals, this seems to be a common thing especially shoe wise (as they supposedly love their shoes), and in some cases the older locals are not fond of the younger looks (short dresses etc), but that doesn't stop you from looking good, and i found that the majority of tourists, didn't really care what they wore. If you have never been to Barcelona before, and despite the shoulder shruggable "oh well" problems i can really recommend this hotel. All in all an enjoyable experience with a few things to thnk about when you are out there.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: APPLES7
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the H10 Montcada Hotel for 5 nights and loved every minute. From the moment we arrived the service was superb being greeted with a glass of cava and some helpful hints regarding barcelona. The roof top bar has amazing views of the city and also mix a great mojito, a perfect way to watch the sun go down. The Montcada is also ideally located in the Barri Gotic surrounded by great bars, restaurants and boutique shopping. Some of my favourite spots were the "Placa Reila" which is a square with fab bars to sit and people watch and killer paellas. The Ginger bar in the Barri Gotic is also adviseable. The Borne area is also full of great bars sorry I can't remember the name of my favourite however I do know it's next door to Karma the indian restaurant, Its a beautiful baroque style bar . Last but not least "Zaharas" bar on the Barceloneta boulevard a lovely little place to sit in the sun with an ice cold drink, If your lucky like me you might spot a star (Woody Allen) in my case. If you decide to stay at the Montcada you won't be disappointed. Happy Holidays.

Reviews.Title: “An fabulous hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Musicman007
Reviews.Content: Well, after reading a number of the reviews posted here we decided it would be difficult to go wrong by booking our stay at the H10 Montcada - and how right we were ! From the minute we got there the staff were helpful and courteous and having read the reviews on room sizes we asked for a large room. All that was available was one on the 2nd floor overlooking the main street, they did say it could be noisy but we elected to have it anyway on the basis that we would harldy be in, and after some Rioja who cares ! What a suprise !! The room was lovely, compact, but perfectly adequate, the bathroom was beautiful ( I know that is important to you ladies out there !) and to cap it all - we had a balcony ! Room 201 if you are interested. What a bonus that was, we spent ages out there watching people, traffic, and even a Gay & Lesbian procession marched by. We had breakfasts in the hotel, which were excellent and plentiful but if you dont fancy that there is a great Patisserie across the road and even an Organic supermarket 50m away. On the downside we did book the Cava and Stawberries and would give that a miss next time. The Jacuzzi looks small but adequate and the views from the roof are excellent, a great place for a cocktail or two before dinner. As to location it simply couldnt be better. There is a metro station across the road, plenty of cafes and bars in the two squares nearby and we could walk into the centre in no more than 10 mins. We also took the tour buses as we learnt in New York that they can be an excellent way of getting your bearings, the stop is 100m away. We did the usual sights of La Famillia and the Gaudi buildings and Park - we are now well and truly Gaudied out ! All in all a great break and a fabulous city, cant wait to go again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good breakfast, staff is nice”
Reviews.Author: ValAmsterdam
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a 3 day stay at H10 Montcada, very good location (a few minutes from Las Ramblas, on nice large street Laitana, a few minutes from the harbour and MareMagnum), very close to Metro station Jaume 1. I sent a mail to the hotel a few days before my arrival, asking for a high floor room, and got one on 7th floor, not a great view but plenty of light, and decent size. The staff is nice, the breakfast offers choice, and quality, in a quiet environment. I recommend this hotel, and would return to H10 Montcada. Tips on restaurants: - dinner 1, went to TROBADOR FERRAN, close to via laitana, on the way to Ramblas, before reaching Plaza del Ayuntamiento: good service, enough choice, the food was good, I would return. - dinner 2, went to QUINZE NITS on Placa Real (pass by Trobador Ferran, on the left before Ramblas), queued there for 40 minutes (restaurant no opened yet, staff waiting in front of the queue for god knows what!, got in around 20:45). Low price but: NO service, VERY BAD FOOD, would NOT recommend! Hardly no spanish dishes, I tasted the Paella Mixta, the worst "paella" I've ever eaten in Spain (spent several months in Valencia and Barcelona in the past, have had much better paella!). I've read good reviews of this restaurant before going, I can't understand why! If you're on a low budget, better go to a bar (not on Las Ramblas) and get a few tapas portions, you will have a better experience for sure!!

Reviews.Title: “Fab hotel, location.”
Reviews.Author: LLor
Reviews.Content: Having booked a last minute room at the H10 we weren't sure of what to expect. We knew location was great but were really surprised at how great on arrival. Pretty much everything was within walking distance, Harbour, shopping, tube, las remblas. It was great! We arrived early as we had an early flight and were still greated with a welcome glass of Cava and our luggage was taken, all forms were completed so when we returned all we had to do was collect luggage & keys! Our first room unfortunatly was no bigger than a closet. When i opened the door, it hit the bed! I would advise calling ahead and requesting a room over looking a street and not a very small courtyard. This wouldn't have been a problem if we were there for only the 1 night, we had reserved 4 nights. Their handling of this was effecient but not very polite, however we were offered another room eventually and did end up having a lovely stay.. Definitely make sure you make the breakfast, selection was fantastic, as was the roof jacuzzi!! The views were outstanding! A well recommended hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel, Fabulous Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: sommervillegirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for one night on May 28th. There were 6 adults in our party (3 rooms). The lobby is small and gorgeous. The staff is very helpful (maps/directions/advice) as previously reported. One of the gentleman brought our luggage up to our room. They also had a glass of Cava for us which was a very nice touch. The rooms were very, very, very small. My husband and I slept in a room with 2 twin beds. We could barely walk around the room once we had our luggage in. The bathroom was modern, clean and well-lit. They provide all necessary toiletries. We needed our luggage stored the morning of the 29th, as we were leaving on a cruise and had to wait a few hours for boarding. They allowed us to leave our luggage in a back room of the hotel while we went out and discovered Barcelona. The staff also arranged for us to get transportation to the ship. The breakfast in the morning was WONDERFUL! It was very worth spending more to include breakfast. They had all kinds of cheeses, meats, breads and pastries, lots of fruit, juices, yogurts and coffee. They even had eggs and breakfast meats (bacon, sausage). It was exceptionally good. The hotel is only a few blocks away from Ras Ramblas (the busy street with shops and restaurants). Also, the hotel is very accessable to the underground subway. We were able to hop on and off very easily. We would definately return and highly recommend it to other people. Good value.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BruceLeeInEurope
Reviews.Content: Having been to few hotels across Europe I can rate this as one of the best hotels I have ever stayed in. Finding the hotel was really easy from the airport bus stop it was about ten minutes away, there is also a discreetly positioned Metro station outside if you got the Metro from the airport. Upon our arrival we enjoyed a glass of Cava and a pleasant welcome by staff. Our room was very well presented, it boasted lovely views from the windows and the room was adequately sized - especially the bathroom. The room had other good features such as an air conditioning unit and a mini bar. The only issues we had with the room was the television reception, the curtain falling on our heads and the cleaner breaking our plug! Aside from the room there was the roof terrace complete with great views, a bar and a Jacuzzi, we found this to be a great place to relax with a vodka and coke before going for our evening meal. The only problem with the roof terrace was the fact that we were charged a different price for the same drink on a number of occasions. They also gave us some unusual snacks which I can only described as weird, apart from that the roof terrace was awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel & Location for a Great Price”
Reviews.Author: YumYumTraveler
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel during our honeymoon while we were visiting Barcelona. We were looking for an affordable hotel in a really central location. We loved this hotel! The room we had was pretty tiny, but it was modern and very clean. The bed was comfortable, but not as comfy as some others we've stayed in. However, it was fine and we were able to rest and sleep well. The AC worked pretty well for us. We did not have any issues. We also were able to open our window and look out onto the little side street below. It was pretty cool. The hotel was really wonderful. It was modern and felt hip and cool. The breakfast selection was great and we felt it was totally worth it to get the breakfast. It has an awesome rooftop terrace with great views of the city. The jacuzzi was a little bit disappointing in that it didn't seem hot enough for us to enjoy. The water tempurature felt more like a heated swimming pool rather than a jacuzzi. That said, we didn't travel to Barcelona to sit in a jacuzzi all day! We went there to see the city and this hotel is in a great location! There is a metro stop just outside the hotel across the street. Also, there are tons of restaurants and shops in the surrounding blocks. We could get to anywhere we needed to get to from this hotel. Most everything is within walking distance. The staff was very friendly and helped us out a lot. They warned us of the pick-pocketing that goes on in Barcelona, which was very nice of them to do. Overall, we were totally happy with our stay at the H10 Montcada. We loved it and had a great experience here. It was not too stuffy, but felt like much more than it's 2 star rating on TripAdvisor.

Reviews.Title: “You Must Stay At H10 Montcada!!”
Reviews.Author: chicagokelly
Reviews.Content: AMAZING!! MUY BUENO! I stopped in this hotel on a whim to see if they had available rooms, and thankfully they did, because this hotel is amazing! And very reasonably priced. I will definitely stay here when I return to Barcelona. The staff is VERY nice, and as a single female, I felt completely safe and at ease at all times. I have stayed at some very fancy hotels in the US that are much more expensive, and H10 definitely holds its own against luxury hotels. The rooms are small, but the place is so nice it´s worth it.

Reviews.Title: “H10 Montcada - Excellent !”
Reviews.Author: kremlingazette
Reviews.Content: Hi We stayed for only 1 night here, what a mistake that was ! The 2 previous nights we stayed at another hotel in the city. I had read reviews about how the rooms can be a bit small and noisy if they are on the front of the hotel. We got room 809 as a B&B through laterooms, the room is an absolute gem ! walk in wardrobe, corner sofa, 2 big windows looking out over the rooftops, jacuzzi bath and another big window in there too. And a free bottle of the local Cava as well. The food in the morning was good standard, the staff are very helpful giving you a good quality city guide and map when you check in. These where as good as the ones I had purchased.........And the venue is good being central to the city with a Metro station opposite. The roof terrace is very good too, there is a jacuzzi there but I didnt have time to use it. Enjoy yor stay, and dont forget room 809 !

Reviews.Title: “excellent location”
Reviews.Author: woof137
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, brilliant location in old city but don't stay in room 610! This is a tiny room beautifully finished BUT once a double bed is in there literally is no room for anything else - no dressing table, no chair, no minibar, no room for two suitcases. Would pass as a small single room but a disgrace as a double. Staff accepted complaint graciously but couldn't move us immediately. After a couple of nights were moved into room 607! What a difference.! Apart from room 610 the hotel was excellent. Beautiful fittings and furnishings, excellent food especially breakfast and pleasant helpful staff. Lovely roof terrace with spa however this is only open to all in the mornings, after that by prearrangement. Disappointing if you spend the day shopping / sightseeing and then decide to go back and relax for the evening in the jacuzzi. Good location in old area. Would have got top marks except for the disappoinment of the first nights in room 610. Beware!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Vee M
Reviews.Content: Our second trip to Barcelona March 24th~27th 2007 and we stayed at Hotel Montcada as we liked the Trip-Advisor reviews. We were not disappointed, check-in with a very pleasant staff member who brought us a glass of Cava each then a map and circled where hotel was on the map and showed us how to get to places of interest, plus telling us which bus routes to take rather than use taxis. The room although small was perfectly adequate, comfortable and spotlessly clean, with a good selection of toiletries, even two toothbrushes with sachets of paste and also a razor with gel, the maid opened the window for us when requested to as there was no way we could open it, at first we were disappointed with the view from the room, but decided we were glad it was on the quiet side of the building and we realised it had interesting views rather than the busy front street. I left a note for maid asking for two extra pillows {dos almohadas mas} and they were there when we returned to the room. The roof terrace is a definite bonus and the views for the keen photographer (like me) cannot be beaten! Although they have a jacuzzi on the roof it was a bit cool up there in March for anyone to be using it, but I am sure it will be popular in more clement weather, with plenty of sun loungers ...so quiet up on the roof!!! Very nice breakfast with lots of choices of fresh fruit and a fine array of the usual cold things, plus a nice hot buffet too...I loved their little spicy chorritzos along with the delicious scrambled eggs! Breakfast serving staff were very attentive and pleasant. Being in the middle of the Gothic Quarter there was no shortage of interesting things to see, we still haven't seen everything we want to so we have booked up for another stay in August, this time booking direct with the hotel for a better rate, with cheap flights. Best to eat at tapas restaurants in the Gothic Quarter, you can choose several dishes to share which makes for an interesting meal. Avoid the restaurants on La Rambla where the PR asks you to come in, they are just tourist rip-off places. I have posted some photos to prove how nice the hotel is. All in all I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, fabulous rooftop terrace/jacuzzi”
Reviews.Author: Bartystix
Reviews.Content: I stayed here a while ago with my partner. The hotel is situated on a main road that effectively marks the divide between the Barrio Gothic and the Born district, both of which are very atmospheric and full of wonderful architecture. We were greated at the reception with a glass of cava and they were always very pleasant and happy to help. The breakfasts were plentiful and good quality with options of hot and cold buffet available. There was also cava available to make a bucks fizz style drink. What was particularly nice about the hotel was the rooftop area, with a deckchairs and jaccuzzi. We ordered a bottle of cava (we like the stuff, as you can gather) to drink up there and, in the summer heat, was a perfect way to round off a long day of site seeing. My main gripe was the room itself and while it was clean with pleasant decor, was quite small. Whilst it wasn't on the main road, which I would presume would be noisy, it did look onto a brick wall. We booked a cheap deal through a website and this probably affected the room that we were given. Thankfully we were out most of the time so did not spoil our stay. Overall, I would recommend the hotel but make sure you get a room with a better view!

Reviews.Title: “loved Gaudi”
Reviews.Author: Janeeda
Reviews.Content: Booked the hotel through lastminute.com and paid for the montcada pleasure which turned out to just be some strawberries and a bottle of cava. Stayed on the 8th floor very hot and no opening windows but the bed was too small for two of us to sleep in so next morning explained that bed wasnt suitable and asked for twin room. Told no problem and went out for day returned to be given card for new room but when got up there found that room not cleaned from previous occupants. Went and waited in lobby for one hour and then got into room with twin beds which was a lot bigger than previous room and had better bathroom. Only problem was on 4th floor so much noiser and the good thing was that the bathroom window opened. Breakfast very good and worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “H10 Montcada - a fabulous stay”
Reviews.Author: MarianneVienna
Reviews.Content: I just spent a few days at the H10 Montcada hotel and I would really like to recommend the hotel. Right from the beginning, the hotel was a great place to be. Check in with friendly, helpful staff and a nice glass of Cava champagne. The rooms were well fit with all necessary amenities and very clean. Towels and bedding were changed daily. There were fresh flowers in the room. A bottle of water was available every evening. The breakfast was fantastic. Due to the international clients, one could choose from strictly continental style, to bacon and eggs, to cereals, to tremendous cakes, and not to forget the fresh fruit. The terrace is lovely. It gives you a terrific view. For those who prefer to sunbathe rather than sightsee, it is well-kept, refreshing area. The jacuzzi is small. The only setback I felt was that no window could be opened and therefore you had to rely on air-conditioning, which can be problematic if you are not used to it. All in all, I will definitely return to H 10 Hotel Montcada.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - EXCELLENT location”
Reviews.Author: hugb20
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a 2 night weekend break, having booked it for an incredibly cheap rate onlie with [----](£130 pp includin flights) and we were worried that we might have a bit of a dog on our hands, how wrong we were! The hotel is in an excellent location 5 minutes walk away from La Ramblas, through the great gothic quatre (the highlight of the city fo me) and the tourist sight seeing bus stops rite outside the hotel. The hotel itself is very small, but extremely clean and comfortable, with everything you need. The staff are freindly and able to help where ever possible. The roof terrace is beautiful, with excellent views accross the city, and a small bar to have drinks at during the evenings. A top tip, dont have the breakfast, book room only and make use of the great bakers across the street, a real find. This was the perfect base from which to explore Barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, and location perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Lizzynorgate
Reviews.Content: We have just arrived back from a two night stay at this hotel, and i can say that it is a lovely hotel in a great location! I was a little concerned from some of the reviews that I read prior to our visit but we were not dissapointed at all. On our arrival, we were greeted by very friendly reception staff who explained all the hotel facilities and talked us through the high lights of Barcelona whilsdt relating to a map which was provided. We then went to our room which was on floor6. The view from our room was nothing special, but we were not here to spend time in the room! The rooms are small and as a previous review suggested: there is no room to swing a cat! (who wants to do this anyway!) But this was not a problem, what do you need lots of room for? The room was clean and modern with a lovely bathroom. the only down side was no bath but there was a large shower. I believe that some rooms do have baths though, so if you request one then you should get one! We were not too fussed about this anyway as we spent both nights in the roof top jacuzzi in the early evening. I would say that this is what makes the hotel that little bit extra special! The roof terrace was lovely and I can imagine that in the summer months this would be a lovely place to enjoy the sun lougers and bar. We were also given our champagne which was included whilst sat in the jacuzzi which was a nice touch! overall I would definatly recommend this hotel, as it is centrally located and amongst many bars and restaurants. we did not use any transport whilst in Barcelona and saw most of it on foot. We also did not have any problems with noise whilst staying at this hotel. I was concerned about the bed on arrival as they are very hard, but I have to say I had two very good nights sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: OxfordshireBakers
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is located just on the edge of the Old Town so you are right in the centre of everything. We were presented with a chilled glass of Cava when we arrived and were checked in by a friendly member of staff. Our room was modern with a large bathroom and had everything that we needed. We were on the 7th floor and had a good view across the city. We booked on last minute and got a free bottle of Cava and strawberries which was great after a day sightseeing. Would definitiely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent city centre hotel”
Reviews.Author: 19lucy84
Reviews.Content: Highly recommend this city centre 4 star hotel where we & our 2 adult children stayed for 4 nights. Staff were very helpful, public rooms smart, double bedroom small but with everything we could need & twin room a very large corner room. Breakfast was cold & hot buffet with large selection of cereal, juices, rolls, cold meats , cheese, smoked salmon, cakes & hot selection of eggs, sausage, bacon, fried bread. Didn't dine in hotel but bar service very friendly with extremely large measures! Minutes away from the Barre Gothic & Las Ramblas, opposite a metro station & 2 mins from tourist bus stop. Felt we got very good value for our money & hope to stay there again in the not too distant future. Hunter family, Glasgow & Oban

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in central location!”
Reviews.Author: spam10
Reviews.Content: I booked this long weekend break as a xmas present for my wife. We had a great time. Glass of cava on arrival, we requested a high room as we were concered about the noise other reviews had warned of. We were given room 806 (top floor) room was great, quite large (another concern when reading previous reviews) staff were very freindly and spoke good english. The bar was closed for refurbishment whilst we were there which was a little disapointing, but didn't spoil the stay. The hotel had an offer on, 2 people dine in the evening for £30 Euros. This sounded great, although the food was not that good, we would suggest eating out in the huge choice of restaurants. Barcellona was fantastic, we simply didn't have enough time to see all we wanted to. Great location to see all major attractions, litterally opposite the cathedral and tube. Would recommend taking the tube and train to and from the airport as it s very easy and much cheaper than taxi. Would definately stay here again, if you shop arround this hotel can be very cheap through last minute or other simmilar sites. If you are unsure, just book it! we did and very much enjoyed it. I believe some rooms are quite small but you only sleep there as there is so much to do. Oh and dont forget the roof terrace, hot tub is a nice touch and views are great.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, good value”
Reviews.Author: gigglybebe
Reviews.Content: We are a young couple just returned from a long weekend in barcelona staying at the montcada. We were a bit sceptical after reading the reviews but were very impressed with the hotel and the city. We arrived to a glass of cava whilst checking in and although we did get put in one of these small rooms (307) it was furnished to the same standard as the larger rooms and we did get a very cheap deal. The hotel is in a excellent location and although you can feel the vibrations from the tube (even on 3rd floor) this isn't disturbing and we were not in the room very much. I would recommend the hotel due to fantastic location and good value for money (not sure if this would be true if we had paid full price?)

Reviews.Title: “A good quality and central hotel for the Tourista Bus”
Reviews.Author: coxychick
Reviews.Content: We arrived with a few doubts after reading about the Hotel but we were greeted with a glass of cava and informed that they had 2 very nice rooms for us. Our friends were upgraded to a Junior Suite(809) and we had room 406 which was a large room with a lovely bathroom. It was noisy from the street but this is a City and when I opened the window i was stared at by a man in the office opposite!! We could also feel the rumble from the Metro below. The Jacuzzi was filled for us on request and we receive 2 tickets to obtain our Champagne(Cava) and strawberries in chocolate when we required them. We drank ours after a long day touring the city, on the roof top terrace in the late afternoon sunshine. We realised that we were central to everything and purchased a 2 day tourista bus pass for 23 euros each which passed our Hotel and we managed to see everything we wanted to see. Camp Nou was well worth a visit and we paid 11 euros each to view inside the Stadium. Queues for food are not good here tho and the staff were quite rude in the Food Counter outside but we just got on the bus and went to the next stop to find something to eat. We did visit the FCB shop but there are FCB shops in Barcelona(opposite our Hotel) and at the airport. We ate in lots of places. Altho be careful in La Ramblas we stopped for a beer and snack (they charged us 11 euros for each beer) and it cost as much as a full meal in the Restauarant we had the night before. We had a lovely Italian meal at a Restaurant just up from the Hotel(La Perla) and it was reasonable and good. As it was Epiphany we had the opportunity to see the Kings procession thru the streets from the Hotel roof top terrace which was magnificant. We came home very tired but we all had enjoyed it and we have lots of photos and videos to remind us of our stay. We flew from Coventry airport which altho small was quick and easy. We would recommend the Hotel and Barcelona to others.

Reviews.Title: “If you have another option, do not choose this hotel”
Reviews.Author: JaviFP
Reviews.Content: Well, my experience with this hotel has been really terrible. First of all I booked a really good room and I chose a higher rate for that. I called the hotel in order to be sure that the room was big enough for two people and the hotel told me that the room was really big. But when I arrived I discovered the first lie, it was tremendously small. I went to reception and they told me that they could not changed the room because the hotel was full. On the other hand, I was checking the web page of the hotel, and the were saying that the restaurant was really appreciated by the customers, so I thought that it should be good. So I booked a table for 2 people for the dinner of news eve. The menu was a little bit expensive, 70€ per person, but if the menu would have been ok it would have not mattered. But the dinner was the worst I ever had in my life. The quality of the products that they were offering were not the one that we got. So it was horrible. So, if you have other option, do not choose this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Top floor”
Reviews.Author: Stodds
Reviews.Content: Well, we have also just returned from 3 days stay in the hotel and we were very satisfied with what we got for what we had paid. As advised before we tried our luck on the check in and asked for a top floor room, if possible. "No problem - room 810 is available" And it was standard double, modern and clean with bedsides tables on both sides, plazma TV, Minibar, little desk, laminated floor, large sliding wardrobe. The barhroom was the best. Big, marbelled from top to bottom, nice power shower, bath ... The view from our window was also good. We could see the Sagrada Familia and other famous buildings. Very easy access to the center, but not too close to the center. About 15 min. walk from the main Train Station (last train station from the Airport). The only fault I could point out was the not very sound prove door to the room. The noise in the hall is a bit disturbing. Also the jacuzzi was just above our room and luckily it was not in working progress during our stay, but I can imagine it could be a bit too noisy when in full operation. But the staff vere very friendly and helpful. Breakfast was excellent too. (A slight vibration from the undeground was a bit weard though). I would not mind to stay in the hotel again. I thing it was a reall good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid room 211 - broom cupboard”
Reviews.Author: graceholme
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Hotel 3 years before and so returned because we had enjoyed it. This time however we were so disappointed. We had booked this 6 months before, I e-mailed with time of arrival - no response! On arrival the reception staff were ages sorting out the room, laughing and joking together at which point I decided to listen! Big mistake as I do speak Spanish. Much of the discussion appeared to be about the size of the bed but I didn't say anything until we were taken to the room - 211. It was tiny and stunk of smoke even though I had requested non-smoking. Window could not be opened. Small bed with only just enough room to walk by if you edged up the side of the wall. Simply awful. Straight down to reception to be told they were full! Told them I am asthmatic at which point they then offered another room which had not been made- up. Went to see it - marginally better rather like a cell! After creating yet again, speaking in spanish so they knew I understood their earlier conversation, they said they would move us the next day if we would stay in the 2nd room offered for one night. The next day we stayed in room 502 - much better with nice bathroom in which we could open the large window. Even though it was not that big it was very pleasant and had we have checked into this room the first day we would have unpacked and started our holiday very happily. If you look at the floor plans, the same for each floor, you can see the same tiny rooms run throughout the hotel in the same position. They are not big enough for one person even and feel very claustrophobic , being internal rooms with no opening windows. The people who have enjoyed this Hotel are quite right, it is in a great position, and I too don't need to spend long in the room, but if they had been given the rooms we were first offered they would give the same review. It's not even cheap at over £110 a night with no breakfast! The arrogance of the reception staff was unforgivable. The complaints must go on all the time whenever they give these small rooms out. I suggest they no longer let these rooms or lose their 4 star rating and become a Hostal! We shall not be returning to this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: ardsvisitor
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights in from the 7th August and had a great stay. We were greeted on arrival by helpful and friendly staff who offerred us Cava and to take our bags to our room. All the staff we spoke to had a good understanding of English which really helped as our Spanish/Catalan isn't great. They were more than willing to help We had a double room on the 2nd floor which wasn't massive but we didn't intend to spend much time in it anyway. Everything was spotlessly clean and the bathroom was excellent. Having your own safe and a well stocked mini bar in the room was a real bonus. The air conditioning was a real help as well as it was 30 degrees plus outside when we were there. Breakfast was included in our price and is served from 730 in the morning and there is a great selection of both continental and hot breakfast. You can eat as much as you want and the variety was great. The other great feature of the hotel is the roof terrace where you can sit and relax in the jacuzzi or on the sun loungers with a great view if you get tired of walking around. There is a small bar in the lobby area of the hotel as well which was nice to relax in after being out all day and the hotel provides free internet access in the lobby also. The hotel is in a fantastic location, you can walk to Las Ramblas in about 10mins, place de catalunya is about 10mins away as is the beach. There is a metro station just accross the road (Jaime 1) which we found really useful for getting to the main attractions slightly out of the city centre, its easy to use and a 10 journey ticket is good value. You can hear the metro from the lower floors of the hotel which might be something to bear in mind if you are a light sleeper as it starts early in the morning though. Overall we really enjoyed our stay at the hotel, the staff were great - if you're nice to them they're nice back! The hotel was clean and it was great value for money especially if you can get a deal with breakfast included. The location could not be better for seeing the gothic quartter especially if you do not want to stay directly on Las Ramblas

Reviews.Title: “Best service ever”
Reviews.Author: ScottishTraveller
Reviews.Content: We are still staying at the hotel as I write this. We are spending 5 days in Barcelona and have never experienced service as good as this. We are surprised by other reviews. Staff are always smiling, nothing is too much trouble. Room is small but still nice and not an issue as we are hardly ever in it. Breakfast is superb and really sets you up for the day. Its worth searching the internet for a deal which includes breakfast. This would be my first choice when I come to Barcelona again.

Reviews.Title: “Montcada and Barri Gotic”
Reviews.Author: HethAnne
Reviews.Content: I stayed here from 31st July to 6th August. On arrival we were met at the front door by a member of staff who brought our bags in and were given a glass of Cava. We were told that due to the time of our arrival (9pm) that the room we had been given was on the small side, but that if we came down the next morning they would give us a bigger room. We were on the 7th floor and when we looked out the window we saw only other windows - this was good because it meant no noise. There was air conditioning in the room so there was no need to open the windows and the roof top views from the 9th floor were fantastic! The staff were very friendly and were able to communicate in both English and Spanish (handly for my boyfriend who was trying to practise his Spanish). Our rate only covered the room so on the occaisions that we took breakfast is was 13.50 euro's each, however you could have as much fresh juice, tea/coffee/hot chocolate, cereal, hot food, toast, croissants, cakes, meats and fish as you wanted. Considering it was booked through british airways as a flight & hotel together booking, the £370 that we paid each I think was extrememly worth it. Hotel is situated in a great area, can walk to LA Rambla, the beach, Gothic Quarter etc and more.

Reviews.Title: “We had no problems”
Reviews.Author: hickmanaz
Reviews.Content: We stayed on 29-30 June and again 8 July, 2006. I had read reviews here about the noise and size of rooms, but gave the hotel a chance. I had none of the problems that others mentioned for the same time period. 99% of the staff was very helpful and gracious. Might have to do with treating them with respect if you expect it yourself. Saw other guests being rude and pushy and they got what they gave. Only one of the staff was not as polite as the others. Happens anywhere. Yes, rooms are small. We didn't spend much time in the room. We had a shower and tub. The shower enclosure was just a half wall which was strange, but great water pressure. The lobby was nice, two computers on internet for free usage. The views from the roof were awsome. We had a bottle of champaign one evening on the roof and the bar tender came up to see if we needed anything else and spent some time giving us a bird's eye tour. The first stay we had room 501 on Thursday and Friday nights. Some city noise, but not bad. The next stay we had room 204 and it was Saturday night. The city never sleeps, especially on Saturday so there was a lot of outside noise. But we expected it. Would recommend this hotel to others. Only warning would be that if staying on Sat night try to get a room on floor 5 or above.

Reviews.Title: “not 3 star”
Reviews.Author: loll01
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 2 nights and like other reviews we were quite dissapointed. We arrived to be given a room that was a smoking room even though i had asked for a non-smoking room. We got moved to room no 2 that was awful it faced out to the back of the hotel and did not have any extra's that i had paid for. We had to go back and ask for another room but were told that we had no right to a mini bar or any extra's. Luckily we had printed out our confirmation and sunddenly the awkward attitude changed. We had to wait over an hour for our room and noticed that if you spoke with an american accent then you got treat with a lot more respect. We have been all over the world and this is not a 4 star hotel it did not even have a swimming pool, the bar closed really early and the staffs attitude ,especially nicole was so rude. Their are a lot more hotels in barcelona that are cheaper with better facilities. Shop around as the choice is quite wide. The tourist bus is really good value for money, the port is good for food but i think you would struggle for things to do after a couple of days.

Reviews.Title: “A BIG Disappointment....................”
Reviews.Author: haskaro
Reviews.Content: We have just come back from a 3 night stay here at the end of May 2006. We booked the hotel after reading the reviews here. Maybe there has been a change of managment as the experience we had was a nightmare. We had room 711 - I call it a room it was much more like a cupboard!!!! You couldnt even get all the way around the bed as it was so tighlty sqeezed in. The bathroom was bigger then the main room and was lovely although watch out for the spray as the screen could do with being a bit bigger but we did have a bath too!! It was so small that the TV had to be wall mounted and was flatscreen WHEN it was working!! Service from most of the staff was awful and they didnt seem to listen or respond to anything you asked. It took over 8 hours and reminders to get some extra clothes hangers. Many of the staff had a poor grasp of english which made things very difficult. Whilst I appreciate I am in another country in an international hotel you would expect a certain level of understanding of english??!! We did make a formal complaint and noticed that after this things did improve slightly in the attitude of the staff, particularly with the breakfast service. This was awful on our first two mornings. Kept us waiting to be seating, food running out, unhelpful etc... The only good thing that we thought was it was in a great location right by the metro and near enough to the main places to walk comfortably. THE CHOICE IS YOURS but I would consider other places first if you can ........

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, great roof terrace”
Reviews.Author: GB_WGC_2004
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location near the Gothic Quarter and right opposite the old cathedral, close to many restaurants and tapas bars. The rooms are small-ish, but you spend so little time in there, who cares. Nice wooden floors in the bedroom and a very smart bathroom. My room (701) on 7th floor had a great view over the street. I ate in the restaurant and enjoyed the 25 Euro menu - service was a bit slow, but the food was good. The key selling point for this hotel in my view is the roof terrace which has sunbeds, a jacuzzi and excellent views over Barcelona - priceless! There is also a small gym with a couple of stationary bikes, running machines and a small rack of weights, it was very hot in there, but (a good tip, even for those not working out!), there are free bottles of water in the fridge! There is also a free wireless network in the hotel which I was able to pick up from my room. Overall, a reasonably good value hotel, hotels in Barcelona aren't cheap, but if you want a smart, modern hotel with a good outdoor area, the H10 Montcada will fit the bill nicely at about £95 a night.

Reviews.Title: “What did you expect?”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A fair bit written already on this hotel on a number of subjects - I have split into headings here: Room Size - Fine, please don't go to Barcelona and spend all your time in the room. Couldn't open the window however, if you like fresh air! Room Amenities - No bath (if that's a problem), but good shower. TV, minibar all good. Good headboard and mirrors. Location - Just what you need - near Bari Gothic and ten minutes from beach / port. Noise - It's Barcelona!!! Yes loud but if you've been to Madrid this will seem quiet. Staff - They're Catalans - Don't take it personally. Breakfast - European, don't leave your table unattended for too long or it might go! Bar - OK - everything you need, plenty better a short walk away. Restaurant - Didn't use - but given location shouldn't need to. Gym etc. Sorry can't comment - but it was open if I'd wanted to use it

Reviews.Title: “Better late than never!”
Reviews.Author: chunkomunko
Reviews.Content: I actually went to Barcelona in August 2004 and only found this site looking for a hotel in Venice so this is why I have only wrote a review now. Could not fault this hotel! It was truly excellent! On arrival and check in me and girlfriend were greeted by the very freindly and helpful staff and handed a glass of sparkling wine, which went down very nicely. We went up to our room and although a little small, it was modern, clean, fresh and cool, We dumped our bags and went up to the roof. The views from the top are great and you get to see a lot of Barcelona. There are sun loungers, seats, tables and a shaded area. The best bit is the jacuzzi, just sit in, relax and read a book looking over the city! (Best done while the sun is setting) Breakfast was a great surprize, pleanty to choose from and tasty too! The hotel staff are great, I quizzed them (in English) about lots of the usuall holiday stuff, best way to see the city, places to eat, places to drink and they couldn't have been more helpful. To sum up: Excellent Hotel in an excellent location with excellent staff in an excellent city!! PS You must eat at a restaurant called 'Taller de Tapas' that is a short walk from Montcada. We ate there about 5-6 times on our 4 day trip! PPS BEWARE of bag snatchers on the ally next to the hotel!! Don't let this put you off, it happens in every city!! Just don't mess about with all your stuff out in the street clutching all your valubles while reading a map and taking a picture..... Have a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Nice Hotel,Great City”
Reviews.Author: dizzybabe45
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for a short city break. Staff were polite and helpful. The breakfast has a large selection and includes English Breakfast not just cold meat as is often the case in European Hotels. The rooms are on the small side but are adequate and the bathrooms are spacious, modern and clean. The location of the hotel is great especially for those wanting to stay close the the sights but on a quieter road than the Ramblas.

Reviews.Title: “Good location to explore.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Ideal location for exploring the city, 15 mins walk from the main square. The hotel, bedrooms and bathrooms were very clean. and the staff friendly. Excellent breakfast with a great selection. Yes the bedroom was small and there was little natural light as the window looked out onto an internal courtyard. The airconditioning was also a bit dodgy, but for a short break at this time of the year was quite acceptable. Would not have been satisfactory in the summer. Roof top jacuzzi and gym were free. Would recommend for a short break but shop around to get a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Over rated, Unhelpful & Not worth the Money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Ok, I'm just back from a weekend @ the Montcada. My first Complaint, like everyone else....there wasn't room to swing a cat in the room! I ordered the bumper package with the robes, champagne etc but we ended up leaving them in the packages as it wasn't a room made for relaxing in Robes and drinking champagne etc. We just wanted to get out of there. Next was the Breakfast. The ladies serving weren't very pleasant to say the least. I phoned for it to be brought to the room and I was told that I would have to pay for the full breakfast (even though it was part of the package) plus extras. The menu in the room said that there was just a 3 euro charge for bringing it to the room. I went down for Breakfast at 10.15 (Serves until 10.30) and I it was pretty much thrown at me. I asked the girl at the reception where was good place for dinner around the area. She said nowhere. We sat and had a meal in the "lobby" (read below). While having the meal I overheard another person asking a different girl at reception the same question, where was good around the area for dinner?, and she gave him a list of places! When you enter the hotel, the reception is in the lobby. This is a nice area with a bar BUT is was also used as the restaurant in the evening. Which like the bedrooms, cramps your style. The food was nice the first night. The second night my partner asked for her salmon to be well done. It was so on the outside but raw on the inside. She ended up ordering another dish that she was charged for. We asked for a wake up call on our last night that we had to get a flight the following morning. We had a few drinks and our mobile phones were dead (no alarms) so we pleaded with them to keep ringing us and make sure we got up. They didn't. First they said they didn't have the list. Then they said they made all the calls and a room that didn't answer, they called up to and knocked until the people got up. They did not do either for us. We missed our flights, had to stay another night in the hotel and pay another 400 euros for flights, along with missing a days work. They would not except responsibility. An hour later the changed their story and said they called us and we answered. We know this didn't happen. Overall...the Montcada is over priced, inconsistent, small and unreliable

Reviews.Title: “Over-rated”
Reviews.Author: jdf2006
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 4 day break at the Montcada. Firstly, as others have mentioned, the rooms are tiny. The double room we stayed in (see photo) was as small as it was physically possible to be. There was a small shower room (no bath) and no tea or coffee making facilities. Also, there was a note in our room apologizing for no mini fridge. We asked to be moved but were told that no other rooms available. Just as I was walking away from reception, a couple wallked in off the street and asked for a double room. They duly obliged. The breakfast was reasonably good but on Sat morning (25 Feb) was told that basement restaurant had flooded and a limited 'cold' breakfast was being served in the bar area - friut, bread,cereals . No apology was made and the staff seemed unconcerned. I repeatedly asked for some croissants but in the end gave up and went out for breakfast. The hotel location is however excellent and if this is your main criteria then it would be a good choice. However having said this there are plenty other 4* hotels with an equally good location. On the whole, I would not rate this hotel as 4* for service, size of rooms or facilities. A word of advice regarding currency exchange - the local bureau de change called 'Exact' close to the Cathedral were only offering 1.17 euros to the £.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was ok, location was great”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned after a 4 day break in barcelona. Hotel was nice but with one or 2 complaints. Room size was fine - not a big room but nothing to complain about, bathroom was really nice. The biggest problem we has is that we were on the first floor at the front of the hotel - weekdays the noise was not to bad but at the weekend it was impossible to sleep because of the noise from the street so if you are not staying out until 5 try and get a room higher up or at the back of the hotel. We had booked the mondcada pleasure offer which includes access to the jacuzzi on the roof with the cava reception. The jacuzzi was closed - did not really mind but thought we should have been informed of this before we arrived as it did influence picking the hotel. Champagne was not forthcoming either. Breakfast was lovely and the location was excellent

Reviews.Title: “Barcelona wondeful but.....”
Reviews.Author: Lily121
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated in a great location, but can only be described as functional. I really cannot understand how it has been rated so highly as I was bitterly disappointed. Let me explain. The rooms vary in size considerably depending on where in the building they are situated. I know this because faced with a room where you could barely walk around the bed, and no bath, we asked to move. To be fair there was no quibble about this, and for reference, the twin rooms tend to be larger than the doubles. However, even having acquired more space, the room was basic. Small details such as no full length hanging space, no sockets near a mirror (other than in the bathroom), one pillow per person, no tea/coffee etc etc I should point out that none of this would have bothered me in the least if I had paid a bargain price, but this hotel is vastly over valued/graded. At best it is a functional, business hotel - clean and tidy, and the staff are polite and efficient. It is certainly not my idea of romantic, in any way, shape, or form, even if they do give you a glass of Cava on arrival! Barcelona, on the other hand, I would go back to in a shot. It is a wonderful place.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just got back from three nights in Barcelona at the H10 and certainly have no complaints at all. It was a great hotel with champagne on arrival, very clean facilities and the breakfast was fantastic it set you up for the day. I can't understand why this hotel receives negative reviews for the size of the bedrooms when you're in Barcelona do you really want to spend that much time in there anyway? Our room overlooked the busy steet but we weren't disurbed by any traffic noise, the rooms are of ample size for two people and the bathroom is modern and spacious. We ordered the champagne and strawberries package which was great, we just asked reception and they brought it to the room for us. Unfortunately the jacuzzi wasn't filled when we were there which we could have used because the days were warm but it wasn't a problem enough to mention it to the staff. Anyway, the views from the roof are a good enough reason to go up there anyway! All in all we had a great time in a wonderful city and would definitely stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Booked hotel before reading the reviews..........then I started to worry. The room size was fine for two people - lovely ensuite, friendly staff, massive selection at breakfast. The location was fine, at no stage did one feel threatened/uncomfortable wandering in the vicinity. CAVA reception is provided - but it does depend what time you get there (ie daylight hours!) Hotel is very easy to find as a metro stop is opposite. Would recommend to anybody.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Weekend Break”
Reviews.Author: Slickslider
Reviews.Content: What is it with the size of rooms??!! We slept in the comfortable bed, showered in the wonderful bathroom and dressed in the clean and well maintained room... we didn't play 5 aside!! If you are going to spend all day in the room... it ain't big enough! Pefect location with wonderful views from the rooftop. A busy road but no noise... Breakfast was superb, the widest choice I've seen (Turin, Porto in the last 12 months) and was of excellent quality. If you're lured by the hottub check it can be used... not sure if it was time of year or weather, but never saw it in use. We arrived at 1:30 am the receptionist was efficient but there was nobody to carry our bags! When we left they stored our bags till later in the day and were very helpful in general. In between then we had no cause to use the reception. As for Barcelona... wonderful, we did the bus touristic (recommend) but could walk to all the tapas bars and shops you'll ever need!

Reviews.Title: “Would certainly go again, not as bad as people make it out to be.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel a lot better than I was expecting, I was a bit worried by some of the reviews but I found this hotel to be really nice. Bags were collected as soon as we got out of the taxi and drinks offered at reception this was a nice touch and made you feel extra special. We were shown to our room and I found the staff to be very helpful, the rooms were very clean and although perhaps a bit small nothing major, we had plenty of room to move and put our suitcase, what you have to remember is this hotel is very close to everything we wanted to see so I feel we had to compensate on the size of the room a little, we walked to most places and even took the bus tour to see Camp Nou this was amazing!! The breakfast is the best I have ever seen and for what we paid this in itself was well worth it, it was lovely and really set us up for the day. Would certainly go here again and would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Second visit in 3 years.. first visit fine.. recently refurbished, staff friendly, great service.. this time round very different. Staff were very unhelpful.. tried several times to book taxis with them .. they booked them for wrong days .. no apologies given. Ended up going to another hotel to get them to help us.. Rooms very poor.. had to ask for extra pillows, when they arrived they had no covers on them. Asked for a continental breakfast on room service..extremely poor attempt made. Not impressed with the quality of food, rooms or service. Not value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for a long weekend”
Reviews.Author: brindle
Reviews.Content: We were slightly worried before arrival having read about the size of the rooms and the noise. Yes, the rooms are small but you are hardly in them at all (too much going on in the City to be stuck inside). We were were in room 302 and our friends in 205 - both rooms were exceptionally clean and the power showers are brilliant. The view from the rooftop terrace is an added bonus - we have some great photos of the sunrise. The breakfast buffet is excellent - tons of choice - eat as much as you want. We found we didn't need lunch as we were still so full! The staff were very helpful and we were able to leave our luggage in a secure area as we were returning on a late evening flight. The location is perfect - within walking distance of many of the main attractions. Yes it is noisy - but it is a City! As in a lot of major cities, crime is a problem (although on this occasion we didn't see anything) - my friend and I left our handbags at home - this meant no worries about security when we went out! To summarise - the hotel was better than we had expected and we had a great weekend. Buy a ticket for the Tourist Bus to get the most from the city and enjoy the breakfast buffet!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed in H10 Montcada for 6 nights. The room was of a good size for a twin room. The staff on reception were very friendly and always smiling. The room was very clean. The breakfast was excellent. The safe in the bedroom came in very handy and you could set your own code. The room also had a mini-bar. The hotel is in an ideal location, only a short walk to Las Ramblas and the beach. And then there was the Bank Holiday Festival !!!! It was fantastic - the atmoshpere was great. If i was to go back to Barcelona again I would most definately stay in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were in Barcelona Hotel Montcada for 4 days/nights and everything was fantastic from the service to the food to the hotel roof!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: WicklowIrelandOntour
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Montecado and can reccommend it to anyone looking for a comfortable professionally run hotel in the centre of Barcelona. Sure the room was a little small but that aside there was nothing negative whatsoever to say about the Montecado. The jacuzzi is a splendid touch and was the perfect end to a day strolling the Ramblas and shopping. Breakfasts were excellent - the bathrooms are excellent and the air conditioning worked perfectly. The room safe was very handy - you set the combination yourself so no need to carry an extra key with you.

Reviews.Title: “Room was expensive AND tiny.”
Reviews.Author: sdb123
Reviews.Content: The H10 Montcado is in a great location in the Gothic Quarter, which scores it some points, but our room was tiny, which for the price ($250 - $300) was very disappointing. Literally, there was 18 inches of space on the three sides of the double bed. The bathroom was also tiny - one of those showers that gets the whole room soaked. The breakfast was good, but I would not recommend this hotel. You could do better for the price and similarly well-located.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: TRAVELLER25039
Reviews.Content: As soon as we entered the hotel we were greeted with a champagne reception. The staff were really nice for the whole 4 nights we were there (apart from the one who was asleep when we left at 3am in the morning). Excellent location within walking distance of everywhere but virtually next to a metro station as well making getting around the whole city really easy. Food was really tasty with a big variety buffet selection. the rooms were modern and were spacious enough for two. I would definitely go back there again!

Reviews.Title: “Dont listen to the others - H10 is fantastic”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
