Reviews.Content: Myself and 3 girlfriends stayed at the hotel from a Saturday morning to Monday afternoon and it was fantastic. On arrival we were offered a glass of cava which really set our weekend off to a good start. The staff are very friendly, our rooms (2 x twins) were very clean - they might not be very big but what do you want from a city break hotel, the bathroom was very clean. Oh and the breakfast - the choice is yours.... I cant understand why anyone would complain about this hotel. I would certainly go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Room was so small l thought we would run out ot of oxygen”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Barcelona is probably a really good city but our stay at this hotel ruined the experience. The room was so small we had no room to unpack our luggage. Can you imagine that in a hotel room for two you could only get out of one side of the bed, awful. l had to keep my clothes packed for the entire trip with the bag up against the wall. The walls themselves appeared to be paper thing allowing us to have full access to converstions next door. We tried to upgrade the room but with no luck The only thing that this hotel had going for it was location. The service was poor with little in the way of amenties in the hotel itself. The bar is in the foyer so you feel it inapproprite to drink, and there is no late bar so unless you want to go to a club you are pretty lost.

Reviews.Title: “loved Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a brilliant location and very near a metro station. Yes the room was small but it was clean and very well equipped. The bathroom was a really good size and lets face it how long do you spend in your hotel room anyway? The breakfast was fantastic and the staff were really friendly and helpful. We will definately stay here when we return to Barcelona. It's worth going up to the roof of the hotel for the view over the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tripper43
Reviews.Content: We booked this hote through HOTELCLub and got a great deal in October. Yes, the rooms are compact, but nice and anyway, we were on a weekend trip so who stays in the room for long? We made great use of the cava at reception and excellent breakfast buffet, always plentiful despite arriving 5 minutes before the end each time (Cava available yet again for the hard core). Friendly service, spotlessly clean, somewhat anonymous but would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Ok- tiny rooms - there are better hotels”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the H10 Montcada and on first impressions this seemed a good hotel. The Cava reception that so many people rave about however was not offered to us- rather we were given out room details- the dreaded 507! As we opened the door, like previous reviews- we could not believe what we were seeing. A tiny, tiny dark room. I opened the door to the bathroom thinking this was a family joint room- it wasn't! The room was very stuffy so we flicked on the air conditioning- it didn't work- the cold air doesn't work at this time of the year. So we went to open the window- no - this overlooks a sealed interior court! This room is a prison cell. We did ask to be moved- they said come back in the morning- we did.....we were then told the hotel was booked out. Even though we had a nice time in Barcelona- we dreaded going back to the hotel each night. So; ======================== Good points about this hotel are ======================== * The bathroom is clean and modern * The breakfast * Location * Free net access * Breakfast service staff * Good views from the terrace ======================== The bad points ======================== * The rooms are very small *in fact too small * Beds are not great * Rooms 507, 607, 707 and the ones ending in 11 are the smallest and if you use lastminute/expedia to book then be sure to bring a fan. * Jacuzzi is ice cold- not working at all * Bar Closes early * Hotel is currently under refurbishment- floors 6 & 7- be prepared for drilling noises-bangs at 8 in the morning ======================== Recommendations ======================== * If you are checked in to 507 or similar ask immediately to be moved * If you cannot move- a tip is too run the shower in the bathroom (cold tap) and close up the door for fifteen minutes- then open the door to let you have some cold air (first I've done this in a four ****hotel!!!!) * Bring lots of face creams etc- otherwise your skin will dry out with the heat in the room. * Bring good company (I did) as you will probably not get much sleep in 507 etc ======================== Would I stay at this hotel again? ======================== The Answer is no. Try Hotel Jazz. .

Reviews.Title: “Modern, Charming but small!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Montcada for three nights, overall had a wonderful stay there. On arrival we were greeted in an appropriate manner and shown to our room. The room was very nicely decorated, modern, clean and the bathroom was lovely. My only point would be how small the room was! This did not however have any impact on our stay. Facilities in the hotel were good although the bar area of the hotel (part of the reception area) did get busy in the evening and only had a limited amount of seats. Great location, close to everything. Lovely!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - very central”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the H10 Montcada for a week in December, 2004 and had a very nice time. Staff were friendly and helpful. Breakfast was great - there was a great choice. Rooms were a little small but nice. Bathroom was spacious and very clean. Hotel is 10 mins walk from the Ramblas and beside a Metro station - good location for easy access to the city centre. Overall, we enjoyed our stay in the H10 Montcada.

Reviews.Title: “Central, quality first class”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed in 20 dec 2005. Excellent position shops, cathedral, marina all short walk. Carva on arrival nice touch. Breakfast brilliant, rooms clean tidy sufficient space in 808. Will stay again next xmas.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: saltairetripper
Reviews.Content: visited montcada hotel for 6 days in december and the location was excellent, just on the edge of everything and right on the route of the open top tour bus, giving you a base to see everything that barcelona offers with many good restaurants nearby at reasonable prices. only 2 downsides to this hotel, the noise, 24 hours a day of nonstop traffic honking horns and waking you up in the middle of the night, also the noise from the metro system is like a plane taking off from the hotel lobby every ten minutes. the second problem is the rooms are a little on the small size. these aside the hotel does not fail on anything, top quality breakfast, the staff are the happiest spaniards i have ever met, nothing is too much trouble, the rooms are very modern in decor with brilliant power showers. a great holiday in a tremendous city

Reviews.Title: “If you want your bag snatched stay at the Montcada”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I'm writing this review as I really would like to tell people what happened to us and warn them away from this location. I've just returned from a few days in Barcelona, we were part of a fairly large contingent of people who were over for a wedding. Tuesday night my friends bag was snatched just outside the hotel at the pedestrian crossing. Thursday night another member of the wedding group who was staying at the hotel had their bag snatched outside the hotel at the same pedestrian crossing. Saturday night two more people who were staying at the hotel had their bags snatched within half an hour of each other at the same location. While I realise that the hotel is not responsible for these crimes I really do not feel that they impressed enough on people the danger that exists. I wouldn't recommend this hotel to anyone. It is obviously targeted by bag-snatchers. Of the five days we were there four people that left the hotel had their bags snatched. There could even have been more. The hotel was relatively nice. Luckily we managed to avoid the dreaded small rooms. However its impossible to relax for the holiday as you learn to dread each time you step outside the hotel. Stay away....

Reviews.Title: “Small For Sure”
Reviews.Author: slamberty
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Montcada in Sept 2004. I had read all of the reviews and was expecting a small room. I have to admit that it was smaller than I had imagined, the bedroom was about 7' x 12'. The bathroom was nice, not large but it had updated fixtures, shower, etc. Our room was on the 2nd floor so I wasn't surprised to be able to hear people out on the street and this wasn't so loud that it bothered us. What I didn't expect was that the subway ran right underneath the hotel and so our room shook and we heard the subway every 5 minutes. The location was otherwise good. We were in easy walking distance of lots of shops and the subway station across the street allowed for easy access to anywhere in the city. I doubt that I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “*****Will stay again *****”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Good hotel, good location really friendly staff and EXCELLENT breakfast. A little disappointed on size of our room. But very clean and modern. Will stay again.... xx

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, a very good choice”
Reviews.Author: ahdphoto1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the H10Montcada in Barcelona one night in September before embarking on a cruise and 2 nights in October after returning from the cruise. Location, location... location was perfect not far from the port and right in middle of the Old Town (across from the Cathedral) and very accessabile to public transportation. Walking distance to The Ramblas, Picasso Museum and good restaurants. Yes, the rooms are small ( we had 4 large pieces of luggage for a month cruise and left them safely in hotel storage bringing up our overnight cases),but the rooms and baths are modern and spotless, the staff multilingual and anxious to please. Dinner one night in hotel restaurant very good with complimentary wine. A plus is the rooftop lounge area with a large hot tub and a splendid view of the city. As a serious photographer I enjoyed taking sunset and sunrise pictures of Barcelona and the spires of the Cathedral from the rooftop vantage point. We definitely would go back.

Reviews.Title: “nice break to barcelona”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: hotel in good location to all areas of city life. the rooms are small but are very clean. the only downside to this hotel is the noise at night the windows are only single glazed and if like us right on a corner of a busy street with an all night coffee shop opposite be prepared to buy earplugs if we had not been touring long periods of the day it probably wouldnt have mattered. any way staff are helpful restaurant manager always cheerful and the food was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “great english speaking hotel”
Reviews.Author: mpjj49
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights at the H10 Montcada from the 17th to 19th october . Great english speaking hotel in a good location next the Gothic quarter. Very helpful english speaking staff with a viewing area around the top of the hotel. Breakfast was wonderful and saved the cost of eating out first thing. Rooms were average in size but acceptable for tourism and the bathroom was great, (even a disposble razor was supplied).

Reviews.Title: “Montcada was great”
Reviews.Author: coopstar
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 10 days at the Montcada on our honeymoon in late September and early October and really enjoyed ourselves. The staff was very friendly and helpful, the buffet breakfast was good and the free Internet was another great benefit. Plus it's in an incredible location. While the room was small we did not find it unreasonably so (and I'm more than 2 meters tall). It was nicely decorated and the bathroom was plenty spacious. Altogether, it was a great place to spend our honeymoon. We'd return to the Montcada (and to Barcelona) in a minute.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: reading222
Reviews.Content: We arrived early straight off the tube and our room was ready. Cava on arrival is nice touch. Nice modern bathroom with walk-in type shower. Very good choice at breakfast. Great views from the roof garden. Location is ideal near Barri Gothic and Born and opposite the tube station. As regards other comments on this site, I don’t think this is a high crime area. The Born area is young and trendy, although like many gentrified areas it has a mixed population. Nonetheless, we felt comfortable walking around at night, especially if you stick to the main streets. There are probably fewer ‘arabs’ here than in my home town. Barca is known for pickpocketing and bag snatchers, but I wouldn’t say this area was any higher risk than elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Moncada”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 8 days at the H10 Moncada beginning Sept 12th. The Hotel was perfect in every way from the glass of cava and chocolate covered strawberries on arrival to the modern, clean, corner room facing the Cathedral. The room was on the smallish side but big enough with a large marble tiled bathroom with all amenities. The buffet breakfast which was included in the price had everything you could possibly want and was delicious. The location was excellent- in the Bari Gotic next to the Ribera and a block or so the the tourist bus. The staff were very friendly and helpful and made you feel at home. All in all a delightful place to stay and I would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in a fantastic hotel, clean, friendly with a lovely breakfast within walking distance to a great many sights and also near the metro. Room size more than adequate if you're in barcelona to enjoy all the city has to offer. Didn't experience any problems at all, as always be aware and be sensible with regards to pick pockets etc

Reviews.Title: “Great location, facilities and staff!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: On arrival, we were informed our floor had a problem with the electrics, and we were put up in another hotel just up the road. The manager himself and the bellboys walked up the road with us and insisted on carrying our cases! We ended up with the top floor suites of the other hotel because of the inconvience! We moved back to the Montcada the next day. Rooms were very clean and tidy, everything modern and working. Very good shower! Rooms were on small side - but when in a wonderful city like Barcelona - who stays in their room for long!? Staff were consistently helpful. Room terrace is stunning - view only bettered at the very top of the Sangrada Familia! Breakfast offered a great choice, which set us up for the day! Location also fantastic, 2 mins from tube stop, and 5 mins walk to main restaurant square off La Ramblas. We walked our feet off! Our initial hiccup was handled very professionally, and our stay at the Montcada was great - we'll recommend to friends. It's a very nice hotel, in a fantastic location. Don't be put off by room sizes (which really aren't bad!) Get out there and see the city!!

Reviews.Title: “An upmarket hotel in the middle of below average”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had mad the mistake of being put into the hostel across the street from the H10. So at 11pm at night we were able to get a room. Stayed up till 3 using the free internet access in the room. Great value. Room had bathrobes, marble bath, free internet, great breakfast (huge!). Room is european and small. Don't pan on doing any intertaining in the room unless it is very intimate! Good business hotel, staff speak english (mostly) and work hard to please.

Reviews.Title: “first class location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was prepared for the smallish room so everthing else was a bonus. The room was immaculate and the bathroom was actually quite spacious with white fluffy towels and toiletries. No tea making facilities, but I brought my own travel kettle. There was a fridge for my milk! Sorry, I'm English! Anyway, the location was FABULOUS. It was so near everthing, the ramblas ( overrated!) the tourist bus stop ( great for seeing all the sights, easy peasy and cheap) and being right in the gothic quarter was amazing. It was our favourite part of Barcelona and we could walk everywhere. Narrow streets, full of shops, restaurants, shadowed by a huge cathedral, museum full of Dali's paintings and sculpture, street performers and you can even walk 6 mins and be at the huge department store el corte ingles......The hotel staff were very friendly, no problems there at all. The receptionist explained how we used the tourist bus, booked a taxi for us to the marina......how stupid were we , it was only a 2 minute drive! At the top of the hotel on the roof there is a hot tub and you can take drinks up there to see the panoramic view. From there you can see just how close you are to the marina and see for miles. We went up there after we had checked out whilst waiting for the time for us to leave for the airport. The hotel were fine about this. It was lovely in the sun up there as our hotel room had no balcony. One problem we had was the window. You had to ask to get it opened and shut. My friend was a smoker so this was a bit of a hassle and we decided to leave it open full time. Only problem was at night you could hear the distant noise of the city and more local noise like dogs barking and mopeds. Shutting the window would have dulled this but I didn't want to keep asking the porter to come up to our room.....nice as he was! Breakfast was lovely. Everything was there, bacon, muffins, fresh strawberries, melon, salmon and a drawer full of teas to choose from, including ENGLISH. It was a very calm start to the morning. I loved Barcelona and I really enjoyed my time at this hotel. The rooms aren't big, but they are very clean, the bathroom is a fine size but most of all the LOCATION of the hotel is first class.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I chose this place based on reviews from this site and i have to say it was one of the best hotels I've stayed at. The staff were friendly and helpful, the double room was a good size and the bathoom was lovely too. I would definetly reccomend this hotel as it is ideally located 2 minutes walk from the Cathedral and about 10 minute walk to Les Ramblas.
